loans.name: Jose David

texts.es: José David es originario de la ciudad de Granada, Soltero. Tiene 23 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuestos, reparación y venta de bicicletas. Inicio su negocio con la ayuda de una tía quien le proporciono el local para que instalara su propio negocio, poco a poco fue adquiriendo sus herramientas de trabajo y ahora cuenta con un negocio prospero. Su meta próxima es incrementar el inventario de sus productos. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Llantas y repuestos de bicicletas. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para incrementar la venta de sus productos y aumentar su clientela. Su plan futuro es ampliar su negocio y ofrecerles más productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
José David is from the city of Granada.  He is 23 years old and single.  He is a merchant by trade.  He sells replacement parts, and he repairs and sells bicycles.  He started his business with the help of an aunt who provided the space to set up his own business.  Little by little, he  acquired his work tools.  Now he has a prosperous business.

His next goal is to increase his inventory of products.  He is requesting the loan to buy tires and bicycle replacement parts.  He feels that the loan will be a big help in increasing the sales of his products and in getting more customers.  His plan for the future is to expand his business and to offer more products to his customers.

loans.use: to buy tires and bicycle replacement parts.

loans.name: Bollo Liguey Group

texts.fr: Le groupement Bollo Liguey regroupe un nombre de 5 personnes qui font toutes parties d’un regroupement d’intérêt économique qui se réunissent tous les week-ends. Elles habitent dans le meme quartier. Leur présidente Madame Kouna est celle qui a levée la main sur la photo. Elle évolue dans l’aviculture. KOUNA a une expérience de plus de 7ans et aide son mari dans la gestion des dépenses quotidiennes et les frais d’scolarité de ses enfants. Elle commence sa journée à 6h pour la terminer à 22h. Elle souhaite à l’avenir avoir plus de crédits grâce à l’aide de l’institution et avoir d’autres pointes de vente pour ses produits.
texts.en: The group Bollo Liguey is composed of five persons, who are all part of the economic interest group meeting every weekend. The group members live in the same district. Their president, Ms. Kouna, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. She works in poultry farming. Kouna has over seven years of experience, and she helps out her husband in managing the day-to-day expenses and her children's schooling costs. Her day starts at 6 AM and ends at 10 PM. For the future, she would like to have more loans, thanks to the microfinance institution, and to have other outlets for her products.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed in order to raise additional chickens

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.es: Adelaida tiene 32 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como pollos, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más pollos, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Adelaida, age 32, lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  She is a hard-working and enterprising person, who gets her family ahead with the effort of her work.  Her business activity is raising small animals like chickens.  She is a responsible person, which is why they invited her to participate in the “Siempre Juntos” communal bank.

She now needs the loan to buy more chickens.  She is grateful for and values the loan.  She pledges to make her monthly payments very responsibly.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a Ugandan male aged 36 years married with four children. He is a teacher by profession working with a local government of Kagadi Uganda and he has spent 12 years in service. He choose that profession because it is the only one that his parents could afford to pay for. Edward wants this loan to enable him start a restaurant to supplement his small salary from teaching. He intends to use the loan to buy plastic chairs, tables, plates and saucepans for the restaurant.

loans.use: to buy plastic chairs, tables, plates and saucepans for the restaurant.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de GONIDO, FANA dans la Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréale, de condiment, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMA sont à leurs sixièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. 
La cliente ALIMA la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter avec son argent des colliers, des boucles d’oreilles, des porte monnaies, des sacs en mains et des bagues auprès des grossistes à Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes chez elle-même à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 48.500FCFA par mois, qui seront réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Group Dembagnouma is composed of married women, who are on average 42 years old with four children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Gonido, Fana, in Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They met through family relations, neighbors, and friends. They trade in cereals, condiments, and various articles. The women of group Dembagnouma are on their sixth solidarity loan. To meet huge demand from their clients, they have recourse to Soro Yiriwaso.
Alima, the customer standing in the middle, has no education. After unsuccessfully starting several businesses, she currently sells various items. With her money, she is planning on purchasing necklaces, earrings, wallets, and rings, all from Bamako wholesalers. She sells from her home to a clientele mostly made of women. She is counting on a 48,500 XOF monthly profit, which will be reinvested in the business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous articles for her store like earrings, rings, necklaces etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal and bananas.

loans.name: Brillyd Alexandra

texts.es:
Brillyd Alexandra es una mujer de 21 años de edad, tiene una hija de 4 años de edad   y el esposo con el cual convive hace 2 años. 
La historia de vida de Brillyd  esta basada en que desde pequeña tuvo muchos inconvenientes  por el motivo de vivir en medio de conflictos familiares y  maltrato, entorno a esto la  atención prestada departe de los padres fue muy poca,  fue madre a los 16 años de edad, lo cual fue una época  muy difícil ya que no contaba con el apoyo de nadie, estaba  cursando grado octavo cuando quedo en estado de embarazo por lo cual se retiro de estudiar  para así trabajar y poderle brindar un mejor bienestar a la hija, al cabo de unos años decidió terminar el bachiller y se matriculo para estudiar los fines de semana  en el colegio sierra morena, ya para el año 2012 brillyd logra graduarse  y terminar el bachiller, después de un tiempo se le da la oportunidad a brillyd de estudiar lo que ella siempre anhelo, que fue estudiar ENFERMERÍA  ese es el gran sueño, pero  en estos momentos no cuenta con todos los recursos económicos para terminar los estudios, solo espera tener la oportunidad de seguir con los estudios, lo que la motiva a estudiar esta carrera es la hija, por que quiere que se sienta orgullosa de ella y poder cumplir los sueños, Las metas es llagar hacer jefe de enfermería poderle brindar un mejor bienestar a la  hija dentro de 5 o 10 años  con esta educación seria capas de hacer cosas que quizá nunca pensó hacer  por los conocimientos  que a obtenido, podrá crecer como persona y en lo laboral, lo que a inspirado a brillyd  a trabajar cumplir las metas son las ganas de salir adelante, la hija, el esposo, espera terminar con la ayuda de kiva, ya que como menciono antes, no cuenta con los recursos económicos suficientes para poder pagar las mensualides y los gastos que esta carrera implica.
texts.en:
Brillyd Alexandra, age 21, has a four year old daughter.  She and her husband have lived together for two years.

The story of Brillyd’s life is based on having many difficulties ever since she was little.  This is because she lived in the middle of family conflicts and mistreatment.  In this environment she received very little attention from her parents.  She became a mother at age 16, which was a very difficult time for her.  She did not have support from anyone.  She was in the eighth grade when she got pregnant.  Therefore, she left school in order to work and be able to provide for her daughter’s well-being.  After some years, she decided to finish high school.  She registered to go to the Sierra Morena School on the week-ends.  In the year 2012, Brillyd managed to graduate and get her high school degree.  After a time, Brillyd had the opportunity to study what she always longed to, which was nursing.  This is the big dream.  

However, at this time she does not have the financial resources to complete her studies.  She only hopes to have the opportunity to continue with her studies.  What motivates her to study this career is her daughter.  She wants her daughter to be proud of her, and she wants to fulfill her dreams.

Her goal is to become the head of nursing to be able to provide for her daughter’s improved well-being.  Within five or ten years with this education, with the knowledge she has gotten, she will be capable of doing things that she never though she would do.  She will be able to grow as a person and in her work.  Her daughter and her husband have inspired Brillyd to work to achieve her goals and to have the desire to get ahead.

She hopes to finish with help from Kiva.  As she mentioned before, she does not have enough financial resources to be able to make the monthly payments and the expenses involved with this degree.

loans.use: to pay registration fees for a semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Leonardo tiene 59 años de edad, 39 de ellos, dedicado a atender su propio negocio, una puesto de venta de comidas que inició por la necesidad de solventar los gastos familiares y dar sustento a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos, el negocio está ubicado en una calle muy transitada del centro de la ciudad, por lo que cuenta con la ventaja de ser reconocido en el sector pues trabaja todos los días de 8 am a 7 pm, sin embargo, su mayor dificultad es la competencia que ha ido aumentando en la zona y que su labor la hace al aire libre; sin embargo así ha logrado sacar adelante a todos los miembros de su familia.
El crédito solicitado será invertido en la compra de insumos al por mayor (granos, carne, verduras, arroz, entre otros), esto le permitirá contar con disponibilidad de inventario suficiente para solventar los gastos.
Leonardo manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder montar su negocio en un local comercial, en el que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y se incrementen las ventas para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y, disfrutar una vejez tranquila en compañía de su esposa.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 59 years old and has been managing his own business for 39 of them. He has a food stand that he started out of necessity so that he could pay for his family’s expenses and support his wife and three children. The business is located on a very busy street in the center of the city. This location is advantageous since it is a well-known area. Leonardo works every day from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. However, his greatest difficulty is dealing with the increased competition in the area. His work allows him to be out in the open. Nonetheless, he has been able to move forward along with the rest of his family.

Leonardo is requesting a loan so that he can invest in supplies in bulk (grain, meat, vegetables, rice, and other items). This will enable him to have sufficient inventory at hand so that he can cover his expenses. He says that his greatest wish is to set up his business in a commercial shop where he can better serve his customers and increase his sales. This would allow him to provide a better quality of life for his family and enjoy a peaceful retirement with his wife.

loans.use: to buy grain, meat, vegetables, rice, and other supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Iragi Group

texts.fr: Mbavu Moja est une brave commerçante du collectif d’affaires «Iragi », senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants, qui tous étudient. La cliente est vendeuse de la boisson locale, d’où, elle-même, est productrice. Elle installe sa marchandise dans une buvette sur la rue dans une avenue mouvementée de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un ajusteur soudeur. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 6 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de sorghos, etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite  construire sa parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie  fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler, qu'une cliente est avec son bébé.
texts.en:
Mbavu Moja is a hardworking merchant who belongs to the Iragi business group. A dynamic and experienced entrepreneur, she is 43 years old, married and the mother of 2 children who both attend school. She makes and sells the local drink. She displays her merchandise in a bar on a busy street in town. She started her business with funds she received from her husband who is an adjustment welder. Later on, she benefited from loans from the MFI Hekima. She has been in business for 10 years. This new loan will be used to buy cereals including 6 bags of maize and 2 bags of sorghum. She would like to build on her plot of land, feed her children and ensure that they get an education. Finally, she would like to strongly thank Hekima for helping to make small entrepreneurs excluded from traditional banking channels self-sufficient, especially in this difficult time after the conflicts in the east of the country.

Note: one of the customers is with her baby.

loans.use: to buy 6 bags of maize, 2 bags of sorghum, etc.

loans.name: Wendy

texts.en: Wendy is a 24-year-old single woman. She describes herself as determined and focused. She operates a café where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to open another food café within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a family of her own. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.es: El G.S. Amor y Paz, está conformado por cuatro integrantes que son: Yorlenig Magdalena, María Jesús, Irma Lisseth, e Itza María, todos originarios de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega, todos ellos se conocen porque son de la misma zona por lo que optaron en realizar un crédito en grupo solidario, y de esa manera poder ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocios. María Jesús quien es la coordinadora del grupo en el cual ella se encarga de la responsabilidad y el cumplimiento de las cuotas; ella se dedica a la actividad económica de venta de cuajada y crema; el cual lo comercializa de manera ambulante en barrios de este municipio de Chinandega, además es propietaria de un caramanchel donde vende productos de consumo como: granos básicos, jabones, golosinas, entre otros productos, sus compras las realiza en los mercado de este municipio; tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo este financiamiento es para invertir en sus negocios como: granos basicos, leche, pastilla de cuajar entre otros y poder suplir con las demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Amor Y Paz” (Love and Peace) consists of four members: Yorlenig Magdalena, María Jesús, Irma Lisseth, and Itza María. All of them are from a town in northern Chinandega. They all know one another because they are from the same area. They chose to participate in a solidarity loan because it would help them financially and allow them to invest in their different businesses.

María Jesús is the group coordinator and is in charge of submitting the loan payments. Her business involves selling curds and cream. She sells her products as a traveling vendor in the neighborhoods of Chinandega. María also owns a vending stall where she sells consumer products such as basic grains, soaps, snack foods, and other products. Her purchases are conducted at the municipal market. She has established and occasional customers. The purpose of her loan is to invest in her businesses. María will buy basic grains, milk, coagulant tablets, and other products so that she can meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, milk, coagulant tablets, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 55, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is an electric worker. She earns an income running a general store and an internet shop in front of her house. 

She started this business three years ago. She sells sugar, toys for children, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. 

Yen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products to restock her store and to buy equipment for repairing second-hand computers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and that it will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to restock her general store and equipment for repairing second-hand computers.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 53 years old and is widowed, with three children. She has been running a food stall, selling fried food in front of her door for ten years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Lien is requesting a loan to buy good-quality ingredients to make food to sell from her stall. She hopes that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that, through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality ingredients to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Ahmadjon

texts.ru: Ахмадчону  28 лет. Он живет на районе Шахритус. Гостеприимный район Шахритус славиться своим чистым воздухом и неповторимой природой. Ахмадчон один из жителей этого района. В Шахритусе и в других районах основным занятием является сельскохозяйственные деятельности. Он не стал отставать от своих односельчан и решился взять кредит и купить телят. Ахмадчон собирается начать животноводческий бизнес. Он будет выращивать скотов в коровнике. Ахмадчон просит Вас помочь, надеясь на то, что такой бизнес принесет успех и прибыль в семейный бюджет.

loans.use: Для купли телят и начала нового бизнеса.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.ru: Ответственная девушка из Таджикистана нуждается вашей поддержки. Ее зовут Шахноза и ей 19 лет. Она не из богатой семьи. Ее мать бухгалтер, а отец спортсмен. Их доход не достаточно для оплаты обучения Шахнозы в университете. Она является студенткой 2 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Политики и Бизнеса. Она учится на факультете Международное отношение. Шахноза должна оплатить годовой договор. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты обучения в университете. Она ждет и надеется на вашу доброту.
texts.en: This responsible young woman from Tajikistan needs your support.  Her name is Shahnoza and she is 19 years old.  She doesn't come from a rich family.  Her mother works as an accountant and her father is an athlete.  Their income is not sufficient to pay for their daughter's university tuition.  Shahnoza is a second-year student at the Tajik State University of Business and Politics and she studies at the Faculty of International Relations.  She needs to pay her yearly tuition.  She is taking a loan of 800 USD to pay for her university tuition.  She is awaiting and relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Mahmadyor

texts.en: Mahmadyor was born in 1995. He is not married and lives with his parents. Mahmadyor is a student of the first course at Tajikistan State University. He studies in the faculty of Tax. He is one of the best students. He was also one of the best pupils in a school. He likes Tajik language, culture, etc. Mahmadyor dreams of being the best specialist in future. He is asking for a loan to pay for his tuition at the university. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To pay for tuition

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsetseg is 29 years old and lives with her husband and two children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband, Nyamdavaa, works at a local construction company as an assistant worker. Her children attend local public school and kindergarten, respectively. 

Altantsetseg has been running her clothes retail business in a rental stall of a local market for 10 years. She already has regular local customers and suppliers in Erlian, China. She wants to expand her business by increasing the variety of clothes and improving the quality of the products. She is now importing inventories from Erlian, China, to continue her business and is now requesting a loan of 3,500,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory to sell at her rental stall. 

She is a hardworking woman who wants to raise her children to be educated and have brighter futures.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory to sell at her rental stall

loans.name: Norah

texts.en: Norah is a Ugandan female who is 41 years old. She is married with 10 children, and she operates a retail shop in Kagadi to earn a living. She also does farming as a side source of income. She hopes to finish her house in the future and to educate her children such that they can be independent. Norah is requesting a loan to buy soap, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and other general merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekafo est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 51 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala commune de Warassala préfecture de Dioila, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, et d’articles divers. Les femmes du groupe Djekafo sont à leurs vingt quatrième  prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énormes de la clientèle elles font recourt à Soro Yiriwaso. 
La cliente PENE la première personne à partir de la gauche vers la droite dans le rang debout n’a pas été à l’école, elle est actuellement vendeuse de riz. Elle compte acheter avec son argent 4 sacs de riz chez les grossistes à Niono. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce à une clientèle mixte dans son petit magasin. Elle  compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000Fcfa qui sera réinjecté dans l’activité.
texts.en:
Djekafo Group is made up of married women who average 51 years of age and two children. They all live in traditional families in Warassala, a village in Dioila Prefecture, Koulikoro Region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They got to know each other through bonds of kinship, neighborhood, and friendship. They sell cereals, condiments, and various products. They are seeking their 24th solidarity loan (group loan). In order to meet a very strong customer demand, they are turning to Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso.

Pene is the first person from the left in the standing row. She never went to school. At this time, she sells rice. She intends to use her part of the loan to buy 4 bags of rice from wholesalers in Niono. She retails for cash in her little shop, to a mixed-gender clientele.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000 (ca US$ 170), to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy 4 bags of rice

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de DIOILA, commune de KALADOUGOU, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiment, de jus, d’habillement, et de produit cosmétique. Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à treizièmes prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente CHITAN la personne au milieu dans le rang debout n’est pas instruite. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités de revenue sans succès, elle est actuellement vendeuse de produits cosmétiques. Elle compte acheter 50 kg de guéni, 1 carton de pommade, et 1 carton de parfum chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce à une clientèle mixte chez elle et parfois ambulante. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 75 000Fcfa par mois, qui seront en partie réinjecté dans l’activité, et le reste dans l’élevage de petits animaux.
texts.en:
The DANAYA group is made up of married women who are, on average, 31 years old.  They also have an average of four children each.  They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla , located in the Kaladougou commune, Cercle of Dioïla, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

They know one another through neighborhood, kinship and friendship ties. They sell condiments, juice, clothes and cosmetic products and are on their thirteenth solidarity loan.  In order to meet the high demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso.

Chitan, the group's featured borrower (standing in the middle, in the photo) never attended school.  After being involved in several unsuccessful income-generating activities, she now sells cosmetic products.

She is planning to buy fifty kilos of "guéni" (a fragrant root used to make incense), one box of ointment and another box of perfumes from wholesalers in Bamako.  Chitan resells her goods for cash on a retail-basis.  She sells from home, to both men and women, and she also sometimes works as an itinerant seller. 

She is expecting to make a monthly profit of 75,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to raise small farm animals.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur del País de Perú, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Hilda lives in the beautiful city of Cusco which is located in southern Peru. She is a hard working, entrepreneurial person who keeps her family moving forward with efforts from her work. She works in the business of raising small animals like guinea pigs. 

She is a responsible person and therefore was invited to participate in the credit union "Siempre Juntos" (Always Together). With this loan, she will buy more guinea pigs. She is thankful and values the loan. She promises to make her monthly payments responsibly.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is 44 years old and married. She has two sons and lives with her husband’s family in Ho Chi Minh City. She operates a general store while her husband repairs and sells old electrically powered items.

Kim is applying for a 12,000,000 VND loan through CEP to buy inventory to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items. She hopes her business runs smoothly and she will be able to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy inventory to sell such as eggs, sugar and sanitation items.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, él se dedica a la fabricación de colchones y los vende en diferentes lugares de la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar espumas y telas.  Gerardo está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gerardo lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru. He is in the business of making mattresses and selling them in various places around Cusco. He has several years of experience at the work, and it's going well for him. He has an opportunity before him that requires a loan so that he can buy foam and fabric. Gerardo is happy about the loan and he is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: buy foam and fabric for his mattress-making business.

loans.name: Marquirivi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MARQUIRIVI” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marcela es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: producción y venta de queso, venta de comida, tejido de chompas, producción de leche, tejido de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marcela es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción y venta de queso; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia que tenían el mismo negocio, con un poco capital emprendió su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado) que adquirirá de su comunidad y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito y capacitación que ofrece la institución.

En la imagen falta una señora porque se fue por un imprevisto personal.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Marquirivi” is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Copacabana Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Marcela is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as producing and selling cheese, selling food, weaving sweaters, producing milk, and weaving blankets.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Marcela. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who visited her at her house. At the moment, Marcela has a business in which she produces and sells cheese. She learned the trade from her family since they had the same type of business. With a small amount of capital, she was able to start her own enterprise.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying cows. She will acquire the animals in her community and raise them. Marcela will sell her products at the fairs in the city of El Alto. Working in this manner enables her to generate income so that she can support her family. Marcela is in a common-law relationship and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Marcela said that she enjoys the loans and the training classes offered by the organization. In the photo, one woman is missing because she had to take care of unexpected personal business.

loans.use: to buy dairy cattle.

loans.name: José Alexi

texts.es:
José es un joven de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta primer año de bachillerato general, se retiró de los estudios ya que su estado económico y  el de su familia no era muy bueno como para poder costearse los estudios; así que tuvo que abandonar el instituto y se dedicó a trabajar la agricultura.

 José esta soltero no tiene hijos y vive con sus padres a quienes les ayuda económicamente con los trabajos que realiza como jornalero.

Él cultiva maíz y frijol en la temporada de invierno, pero actualmente está cultivando hortalizas con regadillo, con esto podrá tener un ingreso de dinero en este tiempo que no hay mucho trabajo, también en sus momentos libres trabaja  como carpintero, este rubro lo desempeña desde hace más de un año, aprendió en el taller donde trabaja primero como ayudante y hoy que ya realiza trabajos de construir piezas de madera o reparar las mismas.  Sus cultivos de hortaliza le quedan a unos 20 minutos a pie por veredas y el trabajo como carpintero lo tiene a unos 300 metros de su casa, con ello puede llevar los dos rubros a tiempo y sin ningún tipo de problemas.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes, manguera para sistema de riego para cultivar las hortalizas, ya que comprando todo de una sola ves puede tener un ahorro en dinero y tiempo; porque no andara comprando las cosas caras y haciendo varios viajes para tener todo lo que necesita.


Él desea formalizar su vida formando una familia,  trabajar muy duro para darles todo lo que ellos se merezcan, que sus padres ya no tengan que trabajar tanto sino que él les pueda ayudar económicamente, desea tener su propio taller de carpintería donde pueda generar una mejor fuente de ingresos para el y su familia
texts.en:
José is a young man of 22 years of age. He studied through the first year of high school, but due to his and his family's poor economic situation, he could no longer cover the costs of education. He left school and began working in agriculture.

José is single. He has no children, but instead lives with his parents whom he helps financially with the money from the work he does as a day laborer.

He grows corn and beans in the winter season, but he is currently growing crops with irrigation, as this allows him to bring in money during the time of year when there is less work.  In his free time, he also works as a carpenter. He started in that field about a year ago, learning in a shop where he worked at first as an assistant. Today he does jobs either building wooden parts or repairing them. His crops are about a 20 minute walk on pavement, while his carpentry shop is only about 3 blocks from his house. He is able to do both jobs on time without any trouble.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizer, and hose which he will use to create an irrigation system for his crops. Buying all of this at once will save him both time and money, since he won't be wandering about buying expensive things and making a bunch of trips to get everything he needs.

He wants to get his life together and start a family, and he wants to work hard to give them everything they deserve. He wants to be able to support his parents so that they don't have to work anymore, and he wants to have his own carpentry shop where he can earn more money for himself and his family.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and hose for an irrigation system.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My, 66, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband works for a local company.

Five years ago My opened a food stall. She sells many kinds of dishes along with rice for people in her community. She is applying for a 15,000,000 VND loan through CEP to buy a greater variety of food to sell at her stall to attract and better satisfy her customers.

My’s ambition is to expand her business. She hopes to see her business run smoothly and make more money to help her improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of food to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children between the ages of 2 and 10. She describes herself as visionary and committed. 

Mercy operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, onions, carrots and other items. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy and friendly area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of groceries. Her business goal is to open another branch within five years. She hopes that in the future, her business will yield high returns. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
54-year-old Andresa lives in Panglao, Bohol with her family. She is married with five children who range in age from 24 to fourteen. For four years now she has had a thriving business raising hogs that has helped her supplement the family’s income.

Andresa is applying for a 10,000 PHP loan through CEVI to buy more piglets, pig feed and supplements for them. In the future, she hopes to expand her piggery for increased profits. She also dreams of sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more piglets, pig feed and supplements for them.

loans.name: Salvadora De Jesus

texts.es: la señora Salvadora trabaja para la alcaldia desde hace 10 años como operaria de limpieza en el mercado, es madre soltera tiene que mantener a dos hijas que estan en edad escolar, se ha sacrificado por sacarlas adelante con mucho esfuerzo, solicita el financiamiento para compra de utiles escolares para sus hija ya que se aproxima la entrada de clases.
texts.en:
Sra. Salvadora has worked for the city the past 10 years as a janitor at the market. She is a single mother who is supporting two daughters who are of school age. Salvadora has sacrificed and put forth much effort in order to get ahead.

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy school supplies for her daughters since they will be starting classes soon.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, backpacks, uniforms, and shoes for her daughters.

loans.name: Julio Emilio

texts.es: Don Julio Emilio es originario de la ciudad de Granada, casado y padre de tres hijos. Tiene 40 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería. Inicio su negocio con el dinero que obtuvo en su trabajo y su esposa fue quien instalo la pulpería. Su meta próxima es iniciar el negocio de venta de comida. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Frijoles, Azúcar, Aceite, Pollo, Carne entre otros productos. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para ofrecerles a sus clientes una amplia variedad de platillos en su comideria. Su plan futuro es aumentar sus ventas y mejorar la infraestructura de su comideria.
texts.en: Julio Emilio is a native of the city of Granada. He is 40 years old, married, and the father of three children. He owns and runs a small corner general store, which he started using money that he'd earned from his job. He and his wife opened the shop. His next goal is to start a business selling food. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, chicken, beef, and other items. He says that the loan will really help him be able to offer his customers a wide variety of foods in his diner. His plans for the future include increasing his sales and improving his diner's infrastructure.

loans.use: buy foodstuffs for his new business venture: a diner.

loans.name: Omar Mateo

texts.es: Omar vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, él se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, él está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Omar lives in the city of Cusco, which is in southern Peru. He raises small animals, such as guinea pigs. Omar has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.

He is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can buy guinea pigs. Omar is pleased with the loan and promises to complete his payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Tania Mercedes

texts.es:
Tania es una joven emprendedora y activa de 24 años de edad, 3 de ellos dedicados a trabajar como empleada en diferentes restaurantes de comidas rápidas, donde adquirió experiencia y conocimiento de todo el manejo de este tipo de negocios, hace un año realizó un curso de manipulación de alimentos con el fin de iniciar con un proyecto productivo en compañía de su madrina, desea montar un negocio de comidas rápidas y aprovechar el espacio que tiene disponible en su vivienda para tal fin. Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito para comprar un carro de perros, una freidora, una estufa industrial, un refrigerador e insumos al por mayor (panes, carnes frías, salsas, gaseosas), de esta forma dará inicio a su idea de negocio, de la cual espera generar buenos ingresos, pues tiene la ventaja de estar ubicada cerca a la zona rosa del municipio, por lo que es un sector muy transitado.
Tania con su espíritu de superación y su visión de negocio, sueña con tener un local propio en el que pueda tener su restaurante y vender tanto comidas típicas como comidas rápidas, así mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio y brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Tania is a young, active entrepreneur who is 24 years old. For three years, she worked as a server in different fast food restaurants where she gained experience and an understanding of managing this type of business. One year ago, she completed a food handling course in order to start a production project in her godmother's company. 

She wants to start a fast food business and take advantage of the open space in her home. This motivates her to apply for a loan to buy a food cart, a deep-fryer, an industrial stove, a refrigerator and wholesale provisions such as breads, cold meats, condiments and sodas. This way she can launch her business idea. She hopes to generate a good income because she has the advantage of being located near the main zone of the city which is a sector with lots of movement.

Tania has a spirit of excellence and a vision for her business. She dreams of having her own establishment where she could have her restaurant and sell typical dishes such as fast food. This will improve the profitability of her business and afford her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a food cart, a deep-fryer, an industrial stove, a refrigerator, and wholesale supplies such as bread, cold meats, condiments, and sodas.

loans.name: Teriya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six  membres du groupe Teriya ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila un des quartier de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de, pagnes wax, condiments, poisson frais, fruits et légumes.  Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèbou (femme assise au milieu sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toutes sortes (l’ail, échalote, oignon, farine de gombo, etc). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs d’ail, 5 sacs  d’oignon et 10 sacs d’échalote à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au marché à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Djènèbou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the six women who make up the TERIYA group come from monogamous families.  They are, on average, 40 years old, and also have an average of five children each.  They all live in Kanadjiguila, a neighborhood of the city of Bamako. They know one another through neighborhood ties and through their income-generating activities at the Kanadjiguila market.  These women sell wax-print pagnes (colorful West-African fabrics), condiments, fresh fish, fruits and vegetables.  Eager to develop their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso.  This is their first solidarity loan.

Djènèbou (sitting in the middle of the group, in the photo) is an important seller of various condiments (she sells garlic, shallots, onions, dried okra powder etc.)  She is planning to use her loan to buy three bags of garlic, five bags of onions and 10 bags of shallots in Bamako.  She resells her goods on a retail-basis at the market.  Her customer base mostly consists of women.  Thanks to this loan, she is expecting to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her activity and also used to meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer and cattle keeper who works seven hours a day, six days a week. He started farming in 2000 because it was profitable and he wanted to be able to pay his child’s school fees. He sells his output to traders around the area. However, he must deal with price fluctuations and drought conditions which affect his crops and can lead to a low yield.

Joseph is applying for a 1,000,000 UGX loan through UGAFODE to buy organic manure, which he thinks will boost his earnings. He also hopes to be the leading supplier of his variety of produce in his village and surrounding areas.

Joseph feels it is good that UGAFODE advises its clients about their businesses and listens to any problems that may result in a delay in payment. He wants to thank Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy organic manure,

loans.name: Luisa Dominga

texts.es: Doña Luisa es originaria de Granada, casada y madre de seis hijos ya independientes. Tiene 52 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa interior. Inicio su negocio hace varios años vendiendo ropa interior y ropa de dama ambulante en diferentes sitios de la ciudad y poco a poco fue obteniendo mejores ganancias, luego obtuvo un lugar en el mercado local y hasta la fecha ha permanecido ahí. Su meta próxima es mantener el negocio en crecimiento. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Ropa interior, uniformes y camisolines. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para abastecer la demanda de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es obtener un tramo más grande en el mercado local.
texts.en:
Doña Luisa is originally from Granada. She is married and the mother of six children who are already independent. Luisa, age 52, is a merchant by trade. She has a business in which she sells undergarments. Luisa started her business several years ago by selling women’s clothing and undergarments at different locations within the city. Gradually over time, she was able to improve her earnings.

Later on, Luisa obtained a place at the local market where she has been permanently situated ever since. Her next goal is to maintain the growth of her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy undergarments, uniforms, and spaghetti tops. Luisa expects this loan will be of great help so that she can meet the demand from her customers. Her plan for the future is to obtain a larger stall at the local market.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, uniforms, and spaghetti tops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory for her business.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a forty-eight-year-old married man,  living in Kasese, Uganda, with eight children. He has been in the restaurant business for  thirty-two years. He also practices farming for extra income. 

Wilson started his business to pay school fees for his children. Wilson hopes to educate his children to higher levels, however, competition and high license fees are challenges being faced, so Wilson is in need of a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Elonga Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyamuto est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’un groupe d’affaires « Elonga », senior  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui tous, étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse des pagnes et divers habillements. Elle installe ses marchandises dans le marché animé de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec l’assistance de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est commerçant de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le  prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 ballon de pagnes.  Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une belle maison, scolariser, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
A client of MFI Hekima, Nyamuto is a hardworking businesswoman, president and member of a business group called « Elonga », a senior and dynamic entrepreneur aged 43, mother of six children who are all in school. This lady sells lengths of African print cloth and various other garments. She displays her merchandise in the busy marketplace of the town. She began her business with the help of her husband who is himself a local businessman. Later on Nyamuto was able to take advantage of a loan from MFI Hekima. She has been at this business for 15 years. 

This new loan will allow her to buy one bale of lengths of African print cloth. She hopes to build a nice house, pay school fees, and feed her children. Lastly, she thanks Hekima sincerely for helping women entrepreneurs who are not served by commercial banks to become independent, especially at this critical moment after the conflict in the East of the country.

loans.use: to buy a bale of lengths of African print cloth (pagnes)

loans.name: Dinh

texts.en:
Dinh is 39 years old and is single. He lives in Ho Chi Minh City.

Dinh started a business to sell materials for making shoes five years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a larger quantity and higher quality of materials to better meet his customers' needs. 

He hopes that this will enable him to attract more customers, and that he will be able to increase the turnover of his business

loans.use: to buy materials for making shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of electronic goods to sell.

loans.name: Enkhtaivan

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhtaivan is 55 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two sons in Arkhangai province of Mongolia. They live in a house and they have a decent standard of living. His wife helps him with his business and his two sons also work with their parents. 

Enkhtaivan is hard-working and polite. Enkhtaivan started a business making traditional house parts in 2000. He also makes a wide range of products including tables, chairs, beds, etc. His monthly gross income is between 2,500,000 and 3,000,000 MNT.  He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy material to expand his business.

loans.use: to expand his carpentering business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, oil, fish, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hang

texts.en:
Hang and her husband earn money through their business of selling duck eggs. She started this business four years ago. 

Hang would like to get a loan to buy a larger stock of duck eggs to meet her customers' needs. She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy and sell eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and rice to resell.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 51, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her daughter. 

Phuong earns money through her business of selling vegetables. She would like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of vegetables and fruits to meet her customers' needs. 

She also hopes her business will ensure that her family members will have a better future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
41-year-old Jimmy has steadily grown his business. He operates a Zoona mobile money transfer business and an auto spare parts business in his home town of Lundazi. He has been involved with the business for five years and he is very well known in the community. 

Jimmy, who is married and a father of three, is very hard working. With the help of Kiva lenders, he has managed to expand his business. This has helped him earn more profits and service customers who need to access financial services.

Jimmy’s first two loans helped him boost his working capital and expand his business by opening four additional Zoona mobile money outlets in the eastern province of Zambia. The profits from his business helped him to provide for his family and take his children to better schools. He says his standard of living has also improved with the growth of his business.

He is requesting his third Kiva loan to help him boost his working capital at his five mobile money transfer outlets.  This will insure that he stays capable of serving his growing customer needs to send and receive money.

Jimmy explains how he is grateful to be connected with Kiva lenders and thankful for the opportunity to access affordable working capital to grow his business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital to perform mobile money transfers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used fabrics (sheets, towels, and curtains) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more inventory (rice, soap, toothpaste, oil, tissue, milk, batteries and many  others items) for her shop

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en: Sammy is a 57-year-old married man. He has eight children. He describes himself to be God fearing and honest. He operates a retail business where he offers printing services, photocopying and other services. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a marketable place and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more computers to expand his business. His business goal is to open a cyber cafe within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will save and have a better life. This is his fourth loan with SMEP-DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more computers

loans.name: Nancy Ercilia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tienen 4 hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aun viven con ella. Su esposo es agricultor. 
Ella aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad hace muchos años atrás., como es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo lograr lo suyo para el beneficio de su familia tiene un bazar y un taller de costura, ella confecciona todo tipo de ropa la misma que las elabora para clientes en particular que llegan hasta su taller o también elabora para vender en su bazar, también tiene una tienda de víveres en la cual vende todo tipo de víveres además de legumbres y carnes, uno de sus hijos le ayuda más que todo en la tienda, actualmente recién empezó a vender helados de una marca muy reconocida en el país con lo cual mejoro sus ingresos, esto lo inicio con el crédito anterior. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar telas y víveres para abastecer su tienda. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde el inicio y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe del grupo. Sus sueños son seguir aumentando sus negocios.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Grupo de Crédito Salud y Vida [Credit, Health and Life Group] meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture and, additionally, for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches of the province like San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Nancy, 59, lives in this area. She is married and by the fruit of this relation, they have 4 of-age children, two of whom still live with her. Her husband is a farmer.

She learned sewing and tailoring in an academy from the area many years back. Since she is a woman who, through work, likes to achieve what is hers for the benefit of her family, she has a bazar and a sewing workshop. She sews all kinds of clothing, which she also makes for specific customers who arrive to her workshop and she also sews to sell in her bazar. She also has a grocery store, in which she sells all kinds of provisions besides legumes and meats.

One of her sons helps in the store more than anything. Currently, she recently started to sell ice cream of a well-known brand in the country, with which she improved her income. She did this with the previous loan.

She is going to utilize this loan to buy fabric and provisions to stock her store. She has been in the Credit Group since the beginning and she likes it for the benefits that the group receives. Her dream is to continue growing her businesses.

loans.use: to buy fabric and provisions.

loans.name: Barbara Fredesbinda

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Charapoto se reúne cada quince días el Grupo De Crédito Salud y Vida.  Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.
Allí vive la señora Bárbara, tiene 54 años y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tienen 4 hijos los mismos que ya son  mayores de edad, uno de   ellos aun viven en su casa junto a la mujer y sus dos hijos de 9 y 8 años, los mismos que son la alegría de la Señora Barbara. Su marido se dedica a la agricultura. 
Ella junto a su  familia se dedican a la agricultura, siembran en toda época del año maíz y verduras como habas, habichuelas, achochas y otras verduras, dependiendo de la época del año. Trabajan de lunes a viernes desde las 7h00 hasta las 14h00, allí trabajan con la ayuda de su hijo, cuando llega el tiempo de cosecha su esposo recoge los cultivos y los lleva a entregar al mercado de Tosagua o los comerciantes llegan hasta su sembrío.
Este crédito es para comprar químicos y fertilizantes para tener una buena cosecha. Lleva 9 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
texts.en:
In the city of Charapoto, the Grupo de Crédito Salud y Vida [Credit, Health and Life Group] meets every fifteen days. This area is known for its traditional culture and, additionally, for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches of the province like San Jacinto and San Clemente.
 
Bárbara lives there, she is 54 and maintains a common law marriage with which they have 4 children; they are already of age. One of them still lives in his house along with his wife and their two children of 9 and 8 years, who are Bárbara’s source of happiness. Her husband works in agriculture.

She, along with her family, make their living in agriculture. They plant throughout the year corn and vegetables like lima beans, red beans, achojcha [similar to okra] and other vegetables, depending on the time of year. They work from Monday to Friday from 7:00 AM until 2:00 PM. There they work with the help of her son. When harvest time arrives, her husband collects the crops and carries them to be sold in the Tosagua market or the traders arrive to his plot.

This loan is for buying chemicals and fertilizers to have a good harvest. She has been in the Credit Group for 9 years and likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to have good health.

loans.use: to buy chemicals and fertilizers.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur de Peru junto con su familia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y trabaja preparando hamburguesas, sándwich, jugos, además vende todo tipo de productos de snack y bebidas heladas, ella continua con su puesto de venta en uno de los colegios de la ciudad del Cusco. En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería como por ejemplo dulces, empanadas, gelatinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates e insumos para la elaboración de los diversos sándwiches como por ejemplo pollo, pan, salsas y otras cosas más. Esta agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Vilma lives with her family in the city of Cusco in southern Peru. She belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank and works preparing hamburgers, sandwiches and juices. She also sells all types of snack products and cold drinks. She is continuing with her stand in one of the schools in the city of Cusco.

On this occasion she is requesting the loan in order to buy merchandise, such as candy, empanadas, gelatins, soft drinks, cookies and chocolates, as well as supplies for making the various sandwiches, such as chicken, bread, sauces and other ingredients. 

She is grateful for the opportunity to take out a loan that will allow her to invest in the business and grow financially.

loans.use: To buy candy and ingredients.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a 54-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 10 years to 24 years. He describes himself to be determined and focused. 

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, bread, washing soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for six years. His business is located in a strategic place, and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the lack of funds. 

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, milk, rice and other items for resale. 

His business goal is to own a supermarket within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, milk, rice and other items for resale.

loans.name: Zeddy

texts.en: Zeddy is a 46-year-old married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 4 to 26 years old. She describes herself to be God fearing, responsible and honest. She operates a retail shop where she sells drinks, washing soap, cooking oil, sugar and other items. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy stock of sugar, bread, cooking fat and other items and to pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future, she will have a wholesale business. This is her first loan with SMEP-DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries and to pay school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more pure water, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Los Perseverantes Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS PERSEVERANTES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina, la socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como leche, golosinas entre otros.
Los demás socios se dedican al negocio de pasamanería, hospedaje, fotocopiadoras, cabinas de internet, cerrajero, restaurante, panadería.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y salud.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The people shown belong to the “LOS PERSEVERANTES” [Those who persevere] communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, in Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. 

Alejandrina still runs her grocery store; she has been doing this for quite some time now, and it brings her personal satisfaction as well as financial benefits. She is responsible and a hard worker, and wants to continue running this business in order to continue supporting her family. 

Alejandrina is requesting this loan to buy goods such as milk and snacks, among others. The other members of the communal bank earn their living in a variety of ways, including by selling accessories and providing lodging; running photocopy shops, internet cafes, restaurants, and bakeries; and as locksmiths.

The members who do not appear in the main photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting for personal and work reasons. The person whose face is covered is not a member of the communal bank. 

Alejandrina thanks those who are helping her to achieve her goals through KIVA, and she is committed to paying off her loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: to buy goods such as milk and snacks, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú, ella pertenece al banco comunal "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", ella sigue trabajando en una entidad pública. Ya son varios años que trabaja en esto el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para el estudio de su hija para pagar la matrícula. Ella agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Edith lives in the city of Cusco in southern Peru. She belongs to the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank and is continuing to work for a public entity. She has been working in this area for several years and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. 

On this occasion she needs the loan in order to pay tuition for her daughter's schooling. She is grateful for the loan, and promises to make the installment payments in accordance with the payment schedule.

loans.use: To pay the tuition for her daughter's schooling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, water, rice, etc. for her business,

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Doña Sonia es originaria de Granada, casada y madre de cuatro hijos, todos ellos ya independientes. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos. Inicio su negocio como una manera de obtener mejores ingresos y le ha resultado hasta el día de hoy. Su meta próxima es seguir manteniendo su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cremas, Perfumes, Aretes y Cadenas de fantasías. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá satisfacer la demanda que presentan sus clientes. Su plan futuro es mantener el negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia is from Granada. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are now independent. She is a vendor by occupation, and sells cosmetic products. 

She started her business as a way of obtaining better income and has been successful to date. Her next goal is to continue running her business. She is requesting the loan to buy: creams, perfumes, earrings and costume jewelry chains. She believes the loan will be a great help to her, as she will be able to satisfy customer demand. Her future plan is to keep her business going.

loans.use: To buy: creams, perfumes, earrings and costume jewelry chains.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Luis Uriel

texts.es: El señor Luis, de oficio taxero quien todos los días recorre las calles de Managua en busca de pasajeros, su esposa labora como secretaria, sus hijos estudian y trabajan. Don Luis siempre vela por el bienestar de su hogar, solicita este préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y poder ter minar la construcción de un cuarto en la par te posterior de su casa.
texts.en: Luis is a taxi driver who drives around the streets of Managua every day looking for passengers.  His wife works as a secretary and his children work and go to school.  Luis is always looking out for the well-being of his household.  He requests this loan to buy construction materials so he can finish building a room at the back of his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, sand, iron rods, and cinderblocks

loans.name: David

texts.es: David vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al Sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Siempre Juntos", él es una persona responsable y amigable se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. El proceso es el siguiente: primero compra animales críos para luego hacerlos engordar y crecer para después venderlo en diferentes ferias.  Él tiene varios galpones donde cría los cuyes y desea incrementar más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes.
texts.en:
David lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, in the south of Peru. He is a member of the "Siempre Juntos" [Always together] communal bank. He is a responsible and friendly person. 

David earns a living by raising guinea pigs. The process is as follows: first, he buys the animals very young, and then raises and fattens them to sell in different markets. He has various pens where he raises the guinea pigs, and he would like to expand his business. He has been earning a living by raising small animals for several years, and is doing very well. 

David is requesting this loan to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.use: to buy more guinea pigs.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio continua  dedicándose al negocio de venta de panes chutas, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio vende los panes a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como harina, manteca, azucar entre otros.
El socio está feliz con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victor is continuing to work at his business selling chuta bread (a large, round Peruvian bread). He has been working in this business for years, and it is going well, thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He is a responsible and persevering person, and sells bread to his customers who request it, as this is the way he is helping his family get ahead in life. 

The borrower is requesting a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, lard, sugar and other items. He is happy about the loan, and promises to make his installment payments.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, lard, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases different types of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of groundnuts for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rubber dishes to sell

loans.name: Katherin Andrea

texts.es: la señora Andrea tiene 20  años y un bebe de seis meses,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de avenida 6 de Julio de la ciudad de el Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Andrea va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Andrea enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Andrea is 20 years old and has a six-month-old baby. She sells basic household necessities in her neighborhood store, located in her home, which is in the Avenida 6 de Julio area of the city of El Alto. 

This is her first loan with the institution, and Andrea is going to use it to purchase merchandise for supplying her business, such as groceries, candy, and a variety of soft drinks. Her reason for requesting this loan is the need to supply her store, as at this time of year she has a great deal of demand. 

Andrea is facing challenges in her business, such as competition, as there are many neighborhood stores in the area. 

She is going to use the profits to continue buying merchandise, and this way increase her working capital and be able to have a shop, as this is one of her wishes. She is happy and grateful for this opportunity that she is being offered.

loans.use: To stock up on merchandise for supplying her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of native rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wood for expanding her business.

loans.name: Banco Del Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “BANCO DEL DESARROLLO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Miriam Laura ella es casada y tiene 42 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de librería, la socia vende cuadernos, lapiceros, lápices y borradores, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de librería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuadernos,lapiceros,lápices y borradores.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo esperemos que para la proxima reunion esten todos reunidos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the “Banco del Desarrollo" communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which is part of Cusco province and Cusco department. 

The member is Miriam Laura. She is 42, married, and has a son. She works at her bookstore business and sells notebooks, pens, pencils and erasers. She works from 8:00 a.m until 7 p.m.  She has eight years in this business already and it is going very well.

The member's dream is to expand her bookstore business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy notebooks, pens, pencils and erasers. The members who are attached to the group photo had their pictures taken after the meeting, because they requested permission due to work reasons. We hope that by the next meeting everyone will be in attendance. 

The other members work in a laundry business, an Internet café, grocery store business and restaurant. The member is grateful to those who form part of this dream by this means, and promises to make her installment payments on a timely basis.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, pens, pencils and erasers.

loans.name: Jesus Esta Aqui 1 Group

texts.en:
Ysabel is the coordinator of her group 'Jesus Esta Aqui 1 (Jesus is here). Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and 3 children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to raise her children and her nephews and to provide for their needs. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying being at home with her family and watching television. 

Ysabel is excited to be taking her 13th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and expanding her business. She has had her business for over 8 years, starting with her first loan with which she bought a stove and gas tank to fry food. 

She plans to use this loan to invest in her businesses to increase her inventory by purchasing goods like flour, meat, cooking oil, butter, plantains, potatoes, and other miscellaneous products like clothing, handbags and shoes. She runs two different business. 

She will use the profits to reinvest in her businesses and to provide for her family, thus helping her partner. She wants to buy a home and have all her family together in a better house.

loans.use: To buy flour, plantains, meat, and other products like clothes, bags, and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more groundnut, palm oil, rice, and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more native rice and local food for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of native rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of groundnut for resale to expand her business.

loans.name: Carolina Enriqueta

texts.es:
