La socia continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia lleva años de dedicándose a este negocio el cual le v a bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, golosinas, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member continues with her grocery store business.  She sells staple items such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.  She has been in this business for years and it's going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day.  She wants to be able to keep on working so she can continue helping her family.

She's requesting the loan to buy milk, sweets, rice, and other products.

She's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy milk, sweets, rice, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more bags of native rice and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Makhabat

texts.ru: Махабат 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. Двое старших детей -студенты, учатся в столице Кыргызстана, остальные четверо школьного и дошкольного возраста. У Махабат - среднее образование, по характеру Махабат -целеустремленная, умеет вести свое хозяйство. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Махабат занимается животноводством, стартовав 4 года назад, с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Махабат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 1 жеребенок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Махабат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Makhabat is 39 years old and married.  She and her husband have six children.  The two eldest are university students and study in the capital of Kyrgyzstan.  The other four are in school or preschool.  Makhabat has a secondary level education and she is a goal-oriented woman.  She is adept at running her household and business.  Her family's main income is the animal husbandry business she started four years ago with the purchase of 25,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of her hard work, today Makhabat has 3 milk cows and a colt.  Her monthly income amounts to 20,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further developing her business, Makhabat applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy cows in order to increase the size of her herd.  Makhabat plans to invest the profits from the loan in adding more cattle and to save up money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Jumagul

texts.ru: Чумагул 22-летняя молодая девушка с села города Вахдат. Она еще не замужем и живет с родителями. Чумагул не имеет высшего образования, но у нее есть профессия швеи. Она занимается шитьем женских национальных платьев у себя дома. Семья Чумагул большая и состоит из шестеро человек. Чумагул видит как трудно приходится родителям обеспечивать семью. Так как она предприимчивая и энергичная девушка, она хочет параллельно открыть семейный бизнес откорм и продажа скота. У них при дворе дома есть коровник, а также Чумагул имеет сбережение в размере 400 долларов, накопленное за счет ее швейного дела. Чумагул не хватает еще 1800 долларов США. Эту сумму она просит в кредит. Чумагул на сумму кредита и сбережения планирует купить трех голов крупнорогатого скота и 240 килограмм жмыха. Этот кредит ей очень важен. Она с надеждой ждет поддержки.
texts.en:
Jumagul is a young, 22 year old woman from a village near the city of Vahdat.  She has not yet married and still lives with her parents.  Jumagul does not have a higher education, but she is a professional seamstress.  She works from home sewing traditional women's dresses.  Jumagul has a large family--six people in all.  She sees how difficult it is for her parents to take care of the family.  And so, like the enterprising and energetic young woman she is, Jumagul wants to start a business that she can run in addition to sewing.  The business will be fattening and selling cattle.

The family has a cattle barn and Jumagul has $400, which she saved up from her sewing earnings.  Jumagul needs another $1,800 (USD).  She is requesting a loan for this amount.  Jumagul plans to use her savings and the loan to buy three head of cattle and 240 kg of press cake for feed.  This loan is very important to her.  She is waiting hopefully for your support.

loans.use: to buy three head of cattle and 240 kg of press cake to start a cattle business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more book bags, and used clothes for her retail business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food and supplies to open a food store.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Djekafo ont en moyenne 33 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Hamdallaye un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Hamdallaye. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de produits cosmétiques (boucles d’oreilles, bracelets en plastiques, peignes, parfums, mèches à cheveux…), lait en poudre,  restauration et des fruits et légumes. Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe décident de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Rokia (femme assise à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse du lait en poudre. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de lait en poudre au grand marché. La revente se fait en détail en ambulant et à Hamdallaye à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Rokia compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The four members of the Djekafo group are married and mainly living in monogamous families. On the average, they re 33 years of age, with three children. They all live in Hamdallaye, a neighborhood of Bamako and know each other as neighbors as well as through their work at the market of Hamdallaye. The group members sell  cosmetic and beauty products (earrings, plastic bracelets, combs, perfume, hair extensions  etc), powdered milk, cooked dishes as well as fruits and vegetables. With the goal of bolstering their working capital, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Rokia (the one seated on the far left in the photo) is a well-known vendor of powdered milk. She plans to user her loan to buy five boxes of powdered milk at the market. She sells in cash, as a street vendor and in Hamdallaye to a customer base composed mainly of women. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Rokia plans to earn an average monthly income of 50,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business and pay for some minor household expenses

loans.use: to buy powdered milk.

loans.name: Mederbek

texts.ru: Медербек 25 лет, женат, вместе с супругой воспитывают 1 дочь. У Медербека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Медербек занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Медербека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Медербек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Медербек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Mederbek is 25 years old and married.  He and his wife have a daughter.  Mederbek has a secondary level education.  His family's main income is the animal husbandry business Mederbek started six years ago with the purchase of 15,000 som (KGS) worth of cattle.  As a result of his hard work, today Mederbek has four milk cows, two calves, and 20 sheep.  His monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS).  

With an aim to further developing his business, Mederbek applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan to buy sheep in order to increase the size of his herd.  Mederbek plans to use the profits from the loan to buy more cattle and to save up money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise, milk, drinks and ketchup to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more rice, vita, fish, charcoal, pepper, oil, etc. for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more meat, fish, pepper, oil and rice for her restaurant.

loans.name: Al-Tfawl Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Tfawl, and it consists of four members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Amama is 30 years old, married, and has children. She has been selling clothes for two years. This business allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. She enjoys her business and has learned to save. She is satisfied with everything she has achieved. Now, she has set a lot of goals, and she is sure that she will reach them. She has requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy more ladies clothes for resale. She hopes to expand her business to generate more profit.

loans.use: to buy more ladies clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicken and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Al-Shwra Group

texts.en: The Al-Shwra group has five members, all of whom work in a small business. The women feel very excited by the mutual support among them, which is constant and above all inspires them with the will to continue striving for their families. Their work as a team and utilizing all their available resources makes their efforts their greatest strength. Amna is a street vendor, and through her selfless work she is raising her family. She has been selling perfumes. She defines herself as a very hard-working person who does not fear challenges and dares to do anything to help her family. She is applying for a loan from AMB to buy items including perfumes, incense and henna to resell and thus continue improving her life and that of her family. She hopes that this financing will increase her sales, as she will be able to buy a variety of products to satisfy the needs of each one of her customers.

loans.use: to buy items including perfumes, incense and henna to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more Lappa cloths for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, cooking oil and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tiles and wood for her roof

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bales of bags of assorted plastic shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, palm oil, rice and cooking seasoning for resale.

loans.name: Santigie S.

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Santigie. He is married and has four children, aged 16, 12, 10 and 7 years, all of whom go to school. 

Santigie is still continuing his building materials business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,200,000 SLL every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of 4,500,000 SLL in order to buy hammers, roofing nails, oil paint, Evo-Stik (adhesive), lines, etc.

Santigie has succeeded in some of his plans by building another house. The loan will help him to achieve some of his future plans. He is a hardworking and trustworthy businessman. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy  hammers, roofing nails, oil paint and Evo-Stik, lines etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as outgoing. 

Mary operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale. She also grows crops. Her business is located in a productive area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be animal diseases. 

Mary will use the loan of 50,000 KES to buy another dairy cow. This will enable her to increase milk production. Her business goal is to do extensive dairy farming within 5 years. This is her second  loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more cows.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 31-year-old married woman. She has 1 child. She describes herself as determined and confident. 

Gloria operates a retail business where she sells wheat flour, sugar, maize flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge as the rent she pays for the business premise. 

She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, milk and other items. 

Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, her life will be different. This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, milk and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items such as Star beer, soft drinks, and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchases more wax cotton material for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new car to continue his taxi business without interruption.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, and sugar to expand her food market business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more variety of rice, soft drinks and pure water for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, rice, fish and cooking seasoning to expand her restaurant business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and mayonnaise to expand her grocery store business.

loans.name: Santos Medardo

texts.es: Santos Medardo mayor de edad casado con hijos menores de edad originario del municipio de Chinandega zona ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable con sus formas de pago, es propietario de una linea de taxi, el cual ofrece sus servicios como medio de transporte en esta ciudad a los ciudadanos, Santos poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia, buscando un medio digno de sustento para su familia, lamentablemente no logro sacar una carrera universitaria, y uno de sus sueños es poder ofrecerles una mejor vida a sus hijos y verlos coronados siendo unos profesionales, el objetivo de este crédito es para darle mantenimiento a su unidad de transporte e invertir en llantas y otros repuestos. Santos Agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos economicos
texts.en: Santos Medardo is grown-up and married with children. He is originally from the municipality of Chinandega, an area located in the western part of the country. He is a hard-working man who is responsible with his methods of payment. He is the owner of a taxi company which offers its services as a means of transport in the city. Santos has managed to get ahead a little at a time with his family by looking for a decent way of supporting his family. Unfortunately, he did not manage to get a university degree, and one of his dreams is to be able to offer a better life to his children and see them be awarded with degrees. The goal of this loan is to maintain his taxi and invest in tyres and other spare parts. Santos is very grateful for the support Kiva investors offer to people of limited means.

loans.use: to maintain his vehicle and purchase tyres and other spare parts

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
La socia Juana pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS; la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de artesanía, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende chompas, chalinas, guantes, polos entre otros, a la vez la socia continua elaborando algunos adornos, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercadería como chompas de alpaca.

La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Juana belongs to the “Caminemos Juntas” communal bank. She continues with her business of selling handcrafted products. She has been doing this for a while, and it is going well thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. She sells jumpers, scarves, gloves, polo shirts, and other items, and she also continues to make some ornaments. She wants to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase merchandise, such as alpaca jumpers.

She feels grateful for the loan and she promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise, such as alpaca jumpers

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Jorge Luis vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al Sur de Perú y pertenece al banco comunal "Siempre Juntos", él es una persona responsable y amigable se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes. El proceso es el siguiente: primero compra animales críos para luego hacerlos engordar y crecer para después venderlo en diferentes ferias. Él tiene varios galpones donde cría los cuyes y desea incrementar más. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes.
texts.en: Jorge Luis lives in the lovely city of Cusco in the south of Peru, and he belongs to the communal bank “Siempre Juntos”. He is a very responsible and friendly person, and he makes a living by raising minor species, such as guinea pigs. The process is as follows: first, he buys baby animals; then, he fattens them up and lets them grow older before selling them at different fairs. He has several sheds where he raises the guinea pigs and he wants to add more. He has already spent several years raising these animals and it is going very well. On this occasion he needs the loan in order to purchase more guinea pigs.

loans.use: to purchase more guinea pigs

loans.name: Cerafina

texts.es:
Cerafina vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco junto con su familia, ella tiene 38 años de edad y tiene cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, Ella es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante  a su familia. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más cuyes. 

Cerafina se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cerafina lives in the beautiful city of Cusco with her family. She is 38 years old and has four children. She makes a living by raising minor species, such as guinea pigs. She is a responsible and persevering person who helps her family get ahead in life. On this occasion she needs the loan in order to purchase more guinea pigs.

Cerafina is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more guinea pigs

loans.name: Asri Lestari Group

texts.en:
The Asri Lestari group repaid their loan on time. The repayment was not attended by all members, but representated by the board. Ni Nyoman, as the head, decided to resign because she must move to another place and follow her husband. Because her new place is too from the other members, she can’t join the group again and control the group. She will try to establish a new group in her new place. She said thank you to the lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her and the Asri Lestari group. This period she sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She’s replaced by the secretary, Ni Luh.

Ni Luh is a housewife with three school-age children. Her husband works at the harbor near her house. She joined this group when it was first established. Ni Luh is also the head of her neighborhood. She’s using her portion of the loan to purchase superior piglets and feed for the two sows that she already owns. She hopes the sows give birth soon and give her healthy piglets that she can sell after two months. One new member joined the group.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Los Urpichas De Huancaro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS URPICHAS DE HUANCARO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yery Bernarded ella es conviviente y tiene 34 años y tiene 3 hijos; ; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de verduras, la socia también vende zanahorias, tomates y pepinos, la socia tiene un puesto de mercado donde vende las verduras, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender las verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cebollas, zanahorias y pepinos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to a communal bank known as ‘Los Urpichas de Huancaro’, which is located in the district of Cusco and belongs to the province and department of the same name.

One member, Yery Bernarded, 34, lives with her partner and has three children.  She has a business selling vegetables, such as carrots, tomatoes and cucumbers.  She has a stall in the market where she sells them, working from 8 in the morning until 5 in the afternoon.  She has been in this business for seven years and it is going very well.  She dreams of having her own shop to sell her products.  She is asking for a loan to buy more onions, carrots and cucumbers.

Apart from selling vegetables, other activities the members are involved in are selling animals and running grocery stores or restaurants.

This member appreciates those who help her to fulfill her dream and she promises to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy onions, carrots and cucumbers.

loans.name: Freddy Diego

texts.es: El señor Freddy  tiene 21 años, el se dedica a la venta de celulares, cargadores, accesorios, etc, muchas veces a pediso, este préstamo es la primera secuencia dentro de la institución va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y celulares por mayor  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es que tienen  pedidos de sus clientes, el señor Freddy  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la falta de capital,  y va a utilizar los beneficios en el crecimiento del negocio su deseo  para  su negocio es tener mayores ingresos y apoyar a la familia económicamente y así mejorar su calidad de vida, se siente feliz ya agradecido por esta oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Freddy, 21, sells mobile phones, chargers and accessories.  He gets many orders for his products.  This is his second loan with this organization.  He will use it to buy accessories and mobiles wholesale.  He needs this loan because he has got some orders from his customers.  

Freddy struggles to find capital to fund his business so he is going to use the profits he generates to develop his business.  His dream is to increase his sales and support his family economically, whilst also improving his standard of living.  

He is happy and grateful for the help that he gets through these loans.

loans.use: to buy goods for his business.

loans.name: Ana Vilma

texts.es:
Ana es una señora de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, ella es casada su esposo se dedica los trabajos de albañilería en construcciones, ellos tienen 4 hijos dos niñas de las edades de 5 y 8 años y dos hijos de 14 y 17  años de edad y que actualmente sus hijos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela y los más pequeños en  la preparatoria, en su vivienda solo viven y dependen de  ella su esposo y su cuatro  hijos. 

Ana se dedica a los trabajos de oficios domésticos en su casa y cuidar a sus hijos mientras su esposo sale al trabajo, comenta Ana que desde que ella estaba pequeña se dedica a esta actividad,  pues es un trabajo hereditario por parte de su mamá. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la ampliación de su casa específicamente lo necesitan para construir un dormitorio para su hijo pues hasta el momento comparte habitación con su otro hermano, por eso  no cuentan con esta comodidad que es tan indispensables para ellos y que desde hace ya varios años tenían el deseo de construirlo. Esto les permitirá a  su familia vivir más cómodamente en su hogar.

Ana siempre ha querido seguir estudiando y trabajar al mismo tiempo, terminar una carrera universitaria  Vivir en un casa digna  para su familia y para sus niños desea que sean  personas de bien que estudien mucho. El otorgamiento del crédito siente que es una gran oportunidad para ella y su familia de seguir superándose día a día.
texts.en:
Ana, 42, studied until 6th grade at school.  She is married and her husband is a builder.  They have four children; two daughters aged 5 and 8, and two sons aged 14 and 17.  At the moment, her sons are at high school and the two daughters are at primary school.  These are the only people who live in their house and depend on her and her husband.

Ana is a housewife and she looks after her children while her husband works.  She has done this since she was young; it is a job that she has inherited from her mother.

She is asking for a loan to build an extension to her house, which will be built specially for a bedroom for her son, who until now, has been sharing with his other brother.  This will make things more comfortable for them and is something that they have wanted to do for several years now. 
 
Ana always wanted to study and work at the same time, go to university and live in a nice house with her family and children.  Now she wants her children to grow up to be nice people and study a lot.  This loan will give her and her family a great opportunity to continue to make life better.

loans.use: to build a bedroom for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy compost, pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La socia Celia se dedica al negocio de pasamanería y a la confección de artesanía de tipo bisutería, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeños siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de betunes, pasadores entre otros.
Celia pertenece al banco comunal “Caminemos Juntas” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco, Perú.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Celia is in the business of selling decorative items and of making various types of accessories. The has worked in this business for quite some time and she is doing well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work every day. She sells her merchandise to customers who request it. She is a responsible and committed person and by this she is getting her family ahead.

She is asking for a loan for the purchase of polishes, fasteners, and more.

Celia is a member of the communal bank “Caminemos Juntas” of the UMF Asociación Arariwa in Cusco, Peru. She is thankful for the loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy polishes, fasteners, etc.

loans.name: Ruth Leyni Margareth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 21 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros más, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Ruth is 21 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She is a hard-working and enterprising person who is getting her family ahead through her efforts.

Her economic activity is the sale of staple goods like rice, sugar, noodles, oil, and more. She is a responsible person and therefore she was asked to become a member of the communal bank “Siempre Juntos”. This time, she needs a loan for the purchase of sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

She is thankful and appreciates the loan. She promises to make her monthly repayments in time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron bars and zinc sheets.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
La socia Cirila se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboracion de panes,la socia vende panes desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de panes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar los panes como harina,mantequilla,huevos y azucar.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Cirila continues with her bread making business. She sells bread from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm and has been doing this for five years, with good results. Her dream is to expand her business.

Cirila is requesting a loan to buy ingredients for her business, such as flour, butter, eggs and sugar. She is grateful for the loan she received and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her bread making business, such as flour, butter, eggs and sugar.

loans.name: Honorio

texts.en:
This is Honorio, a 42 year old resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines.  He is married to Helen and they have children.  He and his wife manage their household as they manage their business.  They both work hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Honorio maintains a tricycle business.  He owns and drives a Tricycle (motor cycle with sidecar) that carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community.  He starts working early in the morning until late in the evening. There are times when he drives late evening until wee hours in order to have bigger profit. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of PHP 500 in his transportation business everyday.

To help him continue the operations of his business, he is requesting an amount of PHP 11,000 in his loan.  He will be utilizing the loan to buy motorcycle parts for the maintenance of his tricycle unit.  He has to maintain his unit in good condition in order to have a regular income for the daily needs of his family. 

Honorio hopes to buy another tricycle and dreams to have a better living.  He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis.  A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners.  The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their Tricycle unit.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase additional supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help with her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures. She would like to apply for another 48,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business. More items to sell will result in larger profita. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. Mary Grace dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* partners to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stock of supplies, materials and medicines needed in her business.

loans.name: Daya Pertiwi Group

texts.en:
The Daya Pertiwi group made the payment of 30.000.000 IDR to MUK on time for a previous loan.  They tell us that there’s an increasing profit that they earned during the loan period of six months.  The pigs can grow fat and healthy.  They can sell the pigs at high prices because there is lots of demand from the market.  These situations stimulate their spirit to continue to run the business. 

The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the client continue smoothly and lasts for a long time.  Dewa Ayu, as the head, controlling and monitoring the member of her group.  She was help by other boards.  She sold all of her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit.  She saved all of the profit and used it for business capital later.

The Daya Pertiwi group received a new loan of 30.000.000 IDR.  The loan is being used to increase the number of piglets, renovate the barns and purchase superior feed.  The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run the business by themselves.  Now they already have savings and use it for capital.  Dewa Ayu and her members feel happy at receiving the support all this time from Lenders, Kiva and MUK.  She is using the loan to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed.  She hopes she can has enough savings soon to continue the business by her self.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets and feed

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. She also has a direct selling business for additional income.
 
She would like to apply for another 48,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies of fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business. Her profits from business will definitely help sustain her family's daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Marciana hopes that her business will continue to flourish and dreams of helping her children. She meets up every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from the study of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, cloth, thread and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City and has been a member of Paglaum MPC for a couple of years. She has two daughters who are now in their college years. Her husband earns income by having a chainsaw. 

Laura wants to support her husband in earning income since they have college students and it is very hard for them to finance the education of their daughters. She started to put in place a food-vending business and sari-sari store. She applied to Paglaum MPC for a loan to buy inventory like canned goods, rice, sugar and other basic commodities. 

With the loan, Laura is confident that she will be able to support her husband financially as well as contribute to the education of her daughters and the other needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy inventory like canned goods, rice, sugar and other basic commodities.

loans.name: Adora

texts.en:
Adora is married, a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative from Sampaguita, Olingan, Dipolog City. She has two kids and she raises them together with her husband with courage and the determination to give them education and shelter. Their business is a sari-sari store which supports the family's needs. 

Adora wants to make her sari-sari store more stable and as much as possible have ongoing sales as her husband has no regular job to sustain the family's needs, and she needs this income for the education of her two kids. 

She decided to apply for a loan from Paglaum MPC for the amount of five thousand Pesos (PHP 5,000) to expand the inventory of her sari-sari store with goods such as rice and canned goods.

loans.use: to expand the inventory of her sari-sari store with goods like rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Vay

texts.en:
This is Vay. She is a 54-year-old woman living in a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. She previously used a loan to buy various types of mixed products to sell in her general store in order to keep her business in a sustainable way. The loan was a great help for her and gave positive impacts to her current business and general living conditions.

As of now, Vay is asking for a new loan for working capital to refill stock of her inventory again so as to satisfy her customers’ needs. She will buy noodles, snacks, sweets, toiletries and other miscellaneous household items for sale. The income from farming and selling items assures her of enough supply of food and payment for household bills like electricity and water. She expresses her thanks to Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy noodles, snacks, sweets, toiletries and other miscellaneous household items for sale.

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.es:
La socia Sebastiana se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de frutas como manzanas,naranjas y platanos,la socia tambien se sigue dedicando al negocio de crianza de animales como gallians y cuyes,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y tambien alimentos para los animales.

La socia esta feliz con el credito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sebastiana still works in her business selling fruit such as apples, oranges, and bananas. She also continues to raise animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs. Her dream is to have a business property where she can sell the animals. She is applying for a loan to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as animal feed.

She is happy with this loan and she promises to comply with her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and chickens, as well as animal feed.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, 49 years old, is married and blessed with five children. She has managed a retail store for almost five years. According to her, she encounters many trials in her life. That's why she worked hard for her family so that they won't experience her past hardships. Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for a loan amounting PHP 7,000 to buy cooking oil, salt, sugar, flour and rice grains to sell in her store. She hopes some day that she can achieve her dreams for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, salt, sugar, flour and rice grains for her store.

loans.name: Cirila

texts.en:
Cirila is 63 years old. She is married with two grown children and is from the municipality of Maribojoc, Bohol. She has been raising hogs for quite some time. 

She is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy supplements and feed to fatten them and keep the animals healthy. She works hard in her business and expects a better return on her investment. The loan will enable her to buy supplies of the much-needed feed so she will not have to worry on a daily basis. Her income will be for food and future savings.

loans.use: to buy supplements and feed.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a resident of Olingan, Dipolog City and has been a member of Pagalum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for years. She is a provider for the family since her husband is a motorcab driver and earns income just enough to provide for the daily needs of the family. 

Carmelita wants to start a new business which is sari-sari store. She wants to pay for more inventories like sugar, canned goods, rice and oil for her new business. While she's taking care of her granddaughter who lives with them, she can still earn additional income. Aside from that, she also has another source of income which is from doing manicures and pedicures.

loans.use: to pay for more inventories like sugar, canned goods, rice and oil for her new business.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is from Olingan, Dipolog City and has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for 2 years. She has 1 daughter who is now a college, who is a graduating student. Her husband is a regular wage earner, but she still needs to work hard and earn additional income in order to support her husband in financial matters especially since their daughter is a college student. 

Vivian decided to have a small business of a sari-sari store. With this, she can support her family and that is why, aside from the assurances she got from Paglaum MPC, she applied for a loan to restock her store with basic commodities like bags of rice and canned goods. With this, it can help her business grow and at the same time can give her additional income.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities like bags of rice and canned goods.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “CAMINEMOS JUNTAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Guillermo; el socio continua dedicándose a brindar el servicio  de transporte, el tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco ,el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez el socio continua trabajando en construcción haciendo diferentes obras de construcción, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El  socio solicita el préstamo para mantenimiento de su carro.                                     
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Caminemos Juntas" communal bank, located in the Cusco district of the Cusco province and Cusco department.

This borrower is Guillermo. He continues to work providing transport services - he has a car which he uses to provide taxi services in the streets of Cusco. Guillermo has been doing this work for some time now, and it is going well thanks to the effort he puts in every day. Guillermo also continues to work in the building trade. Guillermo wishes to continue working in order to keep on supporting his family.

Guillermo is applying for this loan to pay for maintenance on his vehicle.

Guillermo is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Yhasmany

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS, él socio continua con su negocio de venta de cigarrillos el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir adelante, a la vez el socio continua trabajando en una empresa privada siendo de esta forma que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de cigarrillos para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Caminemos Juntas" ("Let's Walk Together") communal bank. He continues to work in his business selling cigarettes. He has had this business for a good amount time. It brings him both financial and personal benefits. He would like to continue working and to move forward. He is also still working for a private company to provide for his family.

He is applying for a loan to buy cigarettes for his business. He is grateful for this loan and he promises to comply with the established payments.

loans.use: to buy cigarettes for his business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria tiene 39 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, ella es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, ella es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cuyes, ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en: María is 39 years old and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco. She is a hard-working and enterprising person, who is trying to get ahead with her family. She is doing this through the effort she puts in at her work raising young animals such as guinea pigs. María is a responsible person and for this reason, was invited to participate in the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank. On this occasion she needs a loan in order to buy guinea pigs. María is grateful for and knows the value of this loan. She promises to be responsible as she makes her monthly repayments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education and for their personal, household and business expenditures.
 
Sally would like to apply for another 32,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her child’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Sally dreams to be more successful in business and hopes that her child will finish his studies. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Sari Rahayu Group

texts.en:
After six months of maintaining their pigs, the Sari Rahayu group successfully paid off all their loans to MUK. During the period, there was not any problems found because they really cared for their pigs. Besides giving them nutritious feed, they always ask for solutions from the Field Officer or the Vet on how to be a good pig breeder.

Ni Made is very happy because her sow gave birth to eight healthy piglets. After she kept the piglets for two months, she sold her piglets and earned some profit. She renovated her barn. Now the pigs have a comfortable and healthy barn. She asked for a higher loan for the next period because she will purchase super quality feed for her piglets. 

Ni Made successfully maintains her pigs and her husband supports her business because the result can help improve the family income. She also renovated her house. Now, she needs a new loan to purchase super quality feed to make the piglets grow faster and also to purchase two superior piglets for fattening. She hopes the piglets can grow fast and healthy so she can sell them to other breeders in her village.

Two members cannot attend the meeting because they are attending a religious ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: to purchase super quality feed and piglets

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,la socia vende escabeche,la socia vendE este plato que es a base de pollo cocido con cebollas, zanahorias, arvejas y yuca,la socia tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollo y verduras para preparar el escabeche.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The member continues with her business of selling food.  She sells “escabeche”.  This dish is made from chicken pieces cooked with onions, carrots, peas and manioc.  The member has had this business for several years.  It is going very well for her.  The member’s dream is to have a restaurant.

The member is requesting the loan to buy chicken and vegetables to prepare the escabeche.

The member values and is infinitely grateful for the loan that will be granted.  This way she will be able to improve her quality of life.  She pledges to make her payments according to the established time frame.

loans.use: to buy chicken and vegetables.

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn is a food vendor from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 10 and the youngest is 3. She sells snack food like siakoy (fried dough sprinkled with sugar), ice candy (popsicles), candies and chips in the school near her home. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy chips, flour, sugar, cooking oil and milk. Her income provides food for her children and pays for school fees. She would like to continue improving her business so that she can give her family a comfortable life and her children can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy chips, flour, sugar, cooking oil and milk

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les cinq  membres du groupe Sabougnouma ont en moyenne 35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenus au marché de Banconi-Flabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce produits cosmétiques (encens, couches d’enfants, parfum, etc…), pagnes wax et basin. Dans le but de constituer leurs stocks de vente, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Batoma (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse  d’encens. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5kg de magnonkisèni, 80kg de guenis, 1 carton  d’eau de Cologne et 5 bouteilles de parfum de qualité  à Bamako. 
Pour confectionner l’encens, on imbibe le magnonkisèni ou le n’gueni dans l’eau de Cologne pendant 15 jours au moins puis on l’assaisonne avec des parfums de qualité.  L’encens ainsi fait est répartie dans des bouteilles prêtes à être écoulé en détail et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Batoma compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the five members of the Sabougnouma group are married and live in polygamous families. They average 35 years of age with three children each, and they all live in Banconi-Flabougou, one of the districts of Bamako. They got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Banconi-Flabougou. The group members have small businesses selling cosmetics (incense, children's diapers, perfume, etc.), "pagnes-wax" (brightly colored and highly decorative pieces of fabric) and damask fabric. The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to building up their stock and are on their third group loan cycle.

Batoma (who is the woman standing on the far right of the photo) is a significant vendor of incense. She intends to use her loan to buy 5kg of "magnonkisèni", 80kg of "guenis", a carton of eau de Cologne and five bottles of quality perfume from Bamako. In order to make the incense the "magnonkisèni" or "guenis" is soaked in the eau de Cologne for at least 15 days and then scented with quality perfumes. Once prepared, the incense is put into bottles and sold retail and on a door-to-door basis to a primarily female customer base. 

Batoma expects to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA as a result of this loan, and the profit will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for the household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making incense.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en: Sharon, 34 years of age, is married to a government employee and has two children. She's in the retailing business, particularly selling grocery items in their village.  She's been in this business for almost ten years and earns a net income of PHP 3,000 weekly. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase noodles, curls, detergent soap, shampoo, and beverages to sell in her store. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can be able to improve and expand her business to earn more income.

loans.use: to purchase noodles, curls, detergent soap, shampoo, and beverages to sell in her store.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygamiques, les quatre membres du groupe Danaya ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Banconi-Flabougou un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Banconi-Flabougou. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, pagnes wax, brodés, basins, produits cosmétiques (boucles d’oreilles, bracelets plastics, peignes, parfums, mèches à cheveux, …). Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Bintou (femme debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de vêtements (wax, léger, bazin, brodé …). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 15 pièces de pagne wax, 5 pièces de pagnes brodés, 10 mères  de bazins, et  8 mètres de tissus léger à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail au Banconi-Flabougou et en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Bintou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the four members of the Danaya group are married and live in polygamous families. They average 43 years of age with three children each, and they all live in Banconi-Flabougou, one of the districts of Bamako. They got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities at the market in Banconi-Flabougou. The group members have small businesses selling "pagnes-wax" (brightly colored and highly decorative pieces of fabric) as well as embroidered "pagnes", damask fabric, cosmetics (earrings, plastic bracelets, combs, perfumes, hair extensions, etc.). The group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso with a view to getting fresh supplies for cash and are on their third group loan cycle.

Bintou (who is the woman standing on the left of the photo) is a significant vendor of clothes (brightly-colored, light, damask and embroidered).  She intends to use her loan to buy 15 pieces of "pagnes wax", five pieces of embroidered "pagnes", 10 meters of damask fabric and eight meters of light fabric in Bamako. She sells her products retail in Banconi-Flabougou and on a door-to-door basis to a primarily female customer base. 

Bintou expects to make an average monthly profit of 100,000FCFA as a result of this loan, and the profit will be used to reinvest in her business and provide for the household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en: Norma runs a small variety store within her locality.  She is 65 years old, widowed and blessed with two children.  Norma plans to acquire more stock of grocery items to sell but she has insufficient capital.  With regard to this matter, she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell. She believes that her requested loan will enable her to make improvements in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, noodles, snack foods, beverages and seasonings to sell

loans.name: 08-01-01-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mai has a service business shipping goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase a taxi lorry for shipping goods. Mai is 29 years old, and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

Mai is the group leader of the 08-01-01-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

In 2011, Mai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Mai has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Mai has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Mai faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mai hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase a taxi lorry for shipping goods

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau, 42 years old, is married and has two children: one son and one daughter. Her husband supports the family through the income he earns from buying and selling recycled materials. She has run a food stall selling pork and noodles for eight years. Giau lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Giau intends to take a loan to buy good quality noodles and pork to make better food for selling. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy good quality noodles and pork to make better food for selling

loans.name: Koech

texts.en:
Koech is a 32-year-old single man. He describes himself to be determined and hopeful. He operates a retail shop where he sells sports items like balls, gloves and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area, and his primary customers are small-scale. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of sporting goods for resale. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a bright future. This is his first  loan with SMEP DTM. He will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sporting goods for resale

loans.name: Emmy

texts.en:
Emmy is a 22-year-old single woman. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a food stall where she cooks potato chips for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of a permanent place for doing business. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of potatoes for making potato chips. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, her life will be different. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to build a permanent home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes for making potato chips

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open a boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a home. This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Beata

texts.en:
Beata is 38 years old and from the community of Panglao, Bohol. She is married with five children. Her eldest is 18 years old, and her youngest is 2 years old. Beata's desire is to help her husband, who works as a carpenter and also is engaged in fishing. 

She is asking for a loan of 7,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy  fish net, rope and weight leads. Beata would like to make sure that she can make her business more profitable. Her income will assure her that her children are kept in school and her family is well-nourished.

loans.use: to buy fish net, rope and weight leads

loans.name: Christabel

texts.en:
Christabel is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 3 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hairdressing services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a vibrant place, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy hair weaves and beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to own a beauty parlor within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate all her children. This is her first  loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the anticipated profits to open a cosmetics shop.

loans.use: to buy hair weaves and beauty products for use in the salon

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn is from Rumlech Village in the Bakan District of Pursat Province in Cambodia. She is 47 years old and married with five children, four of whom are still in school. Her eldest is married and works as a farmer. 

For more than 30 years, Soeurn has been farming rice as the primary source of her income. Her husband and children give her great support in daily farming activities. The income from farming assures her enough food and payment for home bills and other commodities.

Soeurn needs financial support to improve water and sanitation for her household. She realizes that both play an important role in healthy living conditions. The loan will be used to dig a well of concrete rings to ensure enough water for daily consumption. The remaining funds will be for the construction of a latrine. 

Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited, Soeurn is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a well and proper latrine for her household.

loans.name: Norma Araceli

texts.es:
Norma de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado; es casada su esposo es albañil, tiene 6 hijos, la primera de ellas es comerciante de frutas y verduras, la 2da está acompañada ya vive aparte de ellos, la tercera estudia 1er año de bachillerato, la 4ta trabaja de doméstica,  la 5ta estudia 5to grado y el ultimo estudia tercer grado, por el momento solo ellos viven en su casa.

Norma trabaja comprando y vendiendo frutas y verduras, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, a ella desde pequeña le gusto el comercio y no encontraba que vender luego una amiga le animo que se dedicara a esta actividad. Antes se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos, sale a vender camina hasta kilómetro y medio a modo de terminar su venta, en la venta le colaboran sus hijas y el esposo que le proporciona el dinero para comprar las frutas.

 Con el financiamiento comprara yuca, sandía, melón, jícama, pepino, papaya. El crédito Mejorara su calidad de vida, ya que obtendrá más ganancias.

Ella pretende construir su casa de adobe, ayudar a que sus hijos sigan estudiando,  diversificar  los productos de su negocio y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Norma, 40, studied up to fourth grade.  She's married and her husband's a bricklayer.  They have six children: the oldest sells fruits and vegetables, the second one is married and lives on her own, the third is in the first year of her degree program, the fourth works as a housekeeper, the fifth is in fifth grade, and the youngest is in third grade.  At the moment only the family lives in their own.

Norma has worked buying and selling fruits and vegetables for three years.  She has enjoyed commerce since she was young.  She didn't know what to sell, but then a friend suggested fruits and vegetables.  Previously she worked as a housekeeper.  Norma walks 1.5 kilometers to get to work; her daughters help her make sales and her husband gives her the money to buy the fruit.

Norma's going to buy yuca, watermelon, cantaloupe, jicama, cucumber, and papaya.  The loan will improve her quality of life because she'll earn more profit.

Norma plans to build her house of adobe, help her children keep on going to school, and diversify the products in her business to earn more profit.

loans.use: to buy yuca, watermelon, cantaloupe, jicama, cucumber, papaya, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines, mayor de edad madre soltera de cinco hijos los cuales todos son mayores de edad e independientes, originaria del municipio de Chinandega, lugar que esta ubicado en el occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, con muchos deseos de superación personal, es propietaria de una pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como: aceite, pan, gaseosas, juegos, detergentes, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, productos congelados, golosinas, detergentes, papel higiénicos, cosméticos, ropa, entre otros. negocio el cual surge por la necesidad de tener un medio digno de trabajo para ayudar con los gastos del hogar y sacar adelante a sus hijos, e objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo y el de surtir su pulperia para brindarles un mejor servicios a sus clientes. maría Ines agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
María Inés is older and the single mother of five adult children who are independent.  She's from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country, and is known for being a hardworking and responsible woman with a great desire for personal self-improvement.

María Inés owns a grocery store located in her house.  She sells household items such as oil, bread, soda, games, detergent, rice, beans, sugar, frozen food, sweets, toilet paper, cosmetics, clothing, and other products.  She started the business because she needed a decent job to help with the household expenses and get her children ahead.

The loan is to invest in working capital to stock her store and give her customers better service.

María Inés is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they have sources for work.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, frozen foods, cosmetics, and other products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy drinks at wholesale.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en: Ednah is a 35 year old married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells animal feed. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of animal feed for sale. Her business goal is to have a stable business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will improve her business. This is her second  loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of animal feed for sale

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: Anne est une femme de 63 ans veuve mère de 7 enfants.Elle a aussi deux petits fils.  Elle a ouvert un restaurant qu'elle gère depuis un an. c'est grâce à lui qu'elle s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour elle. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Elle réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Anne is a 63-year-old widow and the mother of seven children. She also has two grandchildren. She opened a restaurant she has been running for a year. Thanks to it, she is taking care of her family. Since purchasing restaurant supplies at the retail level does not really result in much profit for her, this loan for her business is important for enabling her to increase her stock of foodstuff (peanuts, rice, and various necessities for cooking her dishes). This will allow her to avoid making daily trips and reduce her taxi expenses. This will also increase her profits. She will reinvest part of the profits to expand her restaurant. The other part of it will help her to meet family needs.

loans.use: to increase her stock of food supplies for her restaurant

loans.name: Borey

texts.en:
Borey is 21 years old and a freshly graduated student from a local school in Stung Treng province. He now studies Management in the Faculty of Business Management at Build Bright University. Borey’s education is subsidized by his mother who is engaged in the farming business. To help his mother cover his educational fees, Borey has a part-time job working as an assistant driver for a private company. 

He has applied for a loan to pay tuition fees for his first academic year. His education is his key to having a better job someday, which will improve his living situation and help his mother when she becomes old. He is very happy and thankful for the loan funded via a program like Kiva to enable poor students to pursue a higher level of education while contributing to the future development of Cambodia.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for his first academic year.

loans.name: Cahaya Baru Group

texts.en:
The Cahaya Baru Group is located in Sumberkima village, North Bali. 'Cahaya Baru' means 'New Light' and they hope the group will be the light for their neighborhood. 

This group consists of seven women who have similar businesses as charcoal makers. They make charcoal and sell it to the big buyers. Charcoal is usually used to roast fish, chicken, pigs or other foods in restaurants. 

The Cahaya Baru group is headed by Nur. Nur has three children, all of whom are still in school. Her husband works as a brick-maker. The group proposes to obtain a loan to purchase wood to make charcoal. Nur will also use her loan to purchase wood. 

This is Nur's first loan and she hopes that all plans will run smoothly and that she can improve the income of her family. She has a dream to renovate her house, using the income.

loans.use: to purchase wood to make charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalio

texts.es:
EL socio pertenece al banco comunal CAMINEMOS JUNTAS, él socio Roselio sigue dedicándose a brindar el servicio de taxi, el socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este trabajo el cual le trae satisfacciones  tanto económicas como personales, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, el socio trabaja por la diferentes tipos de calles de la ciudad del Cusco transportando a sus clientes que le solicitan.
EL socio solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro como en la compra de llantas.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Rosalio  belongs to the CAMINEMOS JUNTAS Communal Bank. He continues providing taxi service, and has spent some time devoted to this work. It is a job that carries with it both personal and economic rewards.

Rosalio wants to keep on working so that he can continue supporting his family. He works all kinds of different streets in the city of Cusco, transporting passengers who request rides. He is applying for the loan in order to do car maintenance including the purchase of new tires. He is grateful for the loan he has received and is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car and purchase new tires.

loans.name: Zenona

texts.en: Zenona is 59 years old from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. For ten years now she has been farming rice and raising hogs to earn a living. Zenona wants to ensure that her business will continue to flourish. She needs help in the form of additional capital through a loan. She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizer, feed and pesticides. Zenona hopes to keep her pigs healthy and get a good yield form her crops. Her income is for food and savings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, feed and pesticides

loans.name: Aloice

texts.en: Aloice is a 42 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages 10 years and 13 years. He operates a taxi business where he transports customers using his taxi. He has been involved in this business for 11 years. His primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy spare parts to service his taxi. His business goal is to be in a better position within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will have a stable business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy spare parts to service his taxi

loans.name: Angaline

texts.en: Angaline is a 43 year old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be honest and God fearing . She operates a grocery store where she sells tomatoes, collard greens, milk and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a market area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that she will have a bright future.

loans.use: buy more stock of tomatoes and other vegetables and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es:
Magali  nació el 19 de julio, desde entonces  se ha destacado como una persona emprendedora con ganas de salir adelante, a pesar de las dificultades que ha tenido en la vida por ser de una familia de bajos recursos, a pesar de ello termino la primaria en el año 2003, en el 2006 por iniciativa suya estudio en el programa de educación de jóvenes y adultos jornada sabatinaalli realizo el nivel de básica-ciclo secundaria grado sexto,séptimo, octavo,noveno validando dos grados en un año.
Realizo el primer año pero el siguiente se retira a mitad de año, ingreso a otro estudio donde quiso desempeñarse y salir mejor preparada, Allí realizo los estudios hasta el grado noveno,  demostrando siempre ser eficiente como estudiante y persona con la formación ética  de los padres y maestros, luego se inscribió en otra institución para terminar el  bachillerato, Magali ha sabido valorar los esfuerzos y apoyo que  le brindo la familia y lo ha demostrado dando de si los mejores esfuerzos para que  se sientan  orgullosos de ella, a pesar de los obstáculos a sabido salir adelante poniendo en mente las metas para seguir luchando por ellas.
Para este año ella tiene las metas muy claras, seguir con los estudios superiores, terminar los estudios de auxiliar de enfermería en el programa Técnico CAMPO ALTO, aprender  profundizándose mas en esta carrera, sacar a flote todas las capacidades para hacer de estas grandes proyecciones. 
Quiere estudiar en CAMPO ALTO porque es un programa que le brinda una mejor estabilidad económica y ahora que ofrece el  convenio con kiva le parece de muy buena ayuda por la facilidad de pago para realizar los estudios superiores , obtiene beneficios en el campo estudiantil, personal, económico, profesional  y laboral, Ya que por medio de este Magali podrá seguir brindando los servicios como profesional en alguno de los hospitales que tiene convenio con este, eso permite que el estudiante se interese en estudiar y hacer parte de este programa por los altos beneficios.
Magali sueña con esta carrera porque es algo que le apasiona, sabe que es una linda profesión dado que allí se aprende a valorar, como es una carrera que le nace y sobretodo quiere estar al servicio de los demás, sabe que esta carrera a futuro le brindara una mejor estabilidad económica , tendrá una vida mas   llevadera porque obtendrá un mejor sueldo, una profesión y podrá sacar adelante todos los proyectos personales y familiares.
texts.en:
Magli was born on July 19th and since then she has stood out as an enterprising person with a drive to get ahead despite the difficulties that she’s had in her life; being from a low-income family.
