Despite this, she finished elementary school in 2003 and in 2006 by her own initiative, she studied in an education program for youths and adults every Saturday doing basic secondary studies, grades 7, 8, 9 completing two grades in one year. She completed the first year but in the second she left half-way through the year. She registered in another school where she wanted to complete it and come out well prepared. There she completed her studies until grade 9, always demonstrating being productive as a student and person with ethics her parents and teachers taught her. Later she registered in another institution to complete high school. 

Magali has known to value effort and support which her family give her and she has demonstrated giving her best efforts so that they are proud of her. Despite the obstacles, she has managed to come out ahead keeping in mind the goals to continue striving. This year she has very clear goals, to continue with her studies, complete her studies in Nursing in the technical program in CampoAlto, learn to delve more into this profession, and to bring out all her capabilities to do these big projects. 

She wants to study at CampoAlto because it’s a program that provides financial stability and now that it has an agreement with Kiva, she sees it as a very good help for the easiness of payment to fulfil her studies, obtain benefits in the areas of student, personal, economic, professional and workplace. In the middle of this, Magali can continue offering services as a professional in one of the hospitals that has an agreement with them. This allows the students to be interested in studying and be part of this program for the maximum results.

Magali dreams about this career because it’s something that she is passionate about. She knows it’s a wonderful profession given that you learn value, how a career is created and above all she wants to help others, she knows that this career in the future, will provide a better financial stability. She will have a more stable life because she will earn a better salary, have a better profession and she can get all her personal and familiar projects ahead.

loans.use: to pay for enrollment of one semester.

loans.name: M. Ashiq

texts.en:
M. Ashiq is a 53-year old married man, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is the father of two sons and a daughter.
M. Ashiq has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy men's shoes for his shoe shop. He has been making and selling shoes for many years. He has been making and selling lady's fancy and casual shoes in his hometown. Most of his customers demand the gent’s shoes as well but, due to lack of availability of funds, he cannot purchase gent’s shoes. 
Therefore, he requested a loan so he can buy a variety of gent’s shoes for resale. In this way, he can easily cope with the demand and avoid the customers' disappointment. 
His shop is situated in the shoe market, and a lot of other shoe shops are available here for selling shoes.  This becomes the cause of tough competition. He dreams of moving his shop to another place to be away from the competitors.  Through the investment of the current loan, he can easily establish his shop and can enhance his savings so his dream can come true.
M. Ashiq thanks Kiva, honorable lenders and the field partner, Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy gent's shoes for resale.

loans.name: Cristubel

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years old and lives with his family. He is a responsible, honest and hardworking man.  Cristubel has been raising broilers for one year.  He sells them at the marketplace close to where he lives and has loyal customers that prefer his good prices.  Profits gained have been used to cover the family's daily consumption.

Cristubel is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 which will be used to buy feeds and vitamins for his business. He knows that through this amount of loan he will be able to keep his business doing well.  In addition, he can extend his help to his family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for his poultry business

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en: Maricar is 31 years old and has two children. She is engaged in raising ducks and chickens.  Everyday she wakes up early in the morning to feed her ducks and chickens.  With her determination to improve her income, she decided to request a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to buy feeds and vitamins for her business. She is a happy person and she loves to play with her kids. She hopes that someday she can achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina, 28 years of age, is married and blessed with one daughter. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost seven years and earns a net income of PHP 600 daily. Her daily net profits are usually spent on school allowances for their daughter and daily expenditures. 

Due to a lack of capital she would like to access a loan amounting to PHP 17,000 to purchase canned goods, beverages, rice grains, and biscuits to sell. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase detergent powder, canned goods, beverages, rice grains, and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Ednah

texts.en:
Ednah is a 54-year-old, married woman. She has six children, with ages ranging from 19 years to 26 years. She describes herself as being focused. 

Ednah operates a tea farm where she grows tea to sell. Her business is located in a rural area and her primary customers are small-scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be hailstones, which destroy tea. 

Ednah will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more tea leaves to resell. She hopes that she will have a bright future. 

This is Ednah's third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more tea leaves to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sports goods such as shirts, balls and more.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be confident. She operates a tea farm where she grows tea to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be pests and diseases, which affect tea. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more tea for resale. Her business goal is to be successful within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more tea leaves for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: A loan of $2,000 helped Abdulaziz to purchase raw materials and renovate his workplace .

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al trabajo de ama de casa,la socia cuida a sus nietos,la socia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora,la socia recibe un sueldo de jubilacion,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar un equipo de sonido para su casa.

La socia valora y agradece infinitamente el crédito que le otorgarán y de este modo podrá  mejorar su calidad de vida, así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The borrower continues being devoted to her work as a homemaker. She takes care of her grandchildren. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who receives a retirement pension, Her dream is to own a grocery store one day. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a stereo.

The borrower  treasures and is infinitely grateful for the loan that she will receive, which will enable her to improve her quality of life. As well, she commits to making her payments within the stipulated time period.

loans.use: to purchase a stereo system for her home.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La estudiante marisol es una persona con  muchos propósitos y metas en su vida, siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una buena estudiante, dedicada a cada labor que se le asigna, termino los estudios, en el 2007 teniendo como meta salir adelante y escalar, decidió ingresar al sena, donde hizo un técnico en en ventas, para encontrar una salida hacia el trabajo donde se desempeño con mucha responsabilidad, amabilidad, y tolerancia con los compañeros de trabajo, es una persona comprometida, respetuosa, proactiva y que le gusta tomar la iniciativa en las tareas y proyectos asignados, se le facilita la comunicación con diferentes personas, es una niña carismática, alegre y compañerista, le gusta buscar la solución de problemas que se presenten en cualquier situación. 
Tenia una niña de 2 años la cual la llena cada día de energía y moral para que ella se esfuerce y esmere para seguir con los estudios, le gusta mucho todo lo que tiene que ver con la salud y ayudar a todas las personas que lo necesitan, quiere culminar los estudios que actualmente esta haciendo, que es administración en salud, siendo comprometida y puntual, ya que quiere ubicarse laboral mente en un puesto de trabajo estable para poder estudiar talento humano, desempeñándose en el campo que le gusta en lo profesional y a si brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y seguir llenándola de muchos valores, para que ella también sea una persona llena de propósitos y objetivos con la mama, finalmente cumplir  el sueño de tener la vivienda propia, después de lograr cada uno de los objetivos propuestos y a si establecer seguridad en el núcleo familiar. 
Necesita el convenio de kiva, ya que los gastos con la hija son bastantes y ella no cuenta con todos los recursos para poder pagar el valor de la cuota mensual en el precio normal, si ella obtiene el convenio de kiva seria de una ayuda muy grande, los gastos serian  menores y la plata que se ahorra la puede invertir en los gastos del hogar o personales.
texts.en:
The student, Marisol, is a person with many desires and goals in her life.  She has always been known for being a good student who is dedicated to every assignment she is given.  She finished her studies in 2007, but with the goal of getting ahead and growing, she enrolled in Sena, where she completed a technical program in sales in order to find a way to get ahead in her career.  She worked very hard and took on a lot of responsibility, but was always kind and tolerant towards her classmates.  She is a committed, respectful, and proactive person who likes to take initiative in her homework and projects.  She has an ease for communicating with different people.  She is a charismatic, happy and friendly person.  She enjoys finding solutions to problems that she faces in any given situation.  She has a two year old daughter who fills her day with energy and spirit that allows her to strive and do her best to finish her education.

She enjoys everything that has to do with health and helping those who are in need.  She wants to complete the program that she is currently enrolled in, which is healthcare administration.  She is committed and punctual because she wants to find a job in a stable place so she can study human resources, serve in the professional field she is interested in, and provide a better quality of life for her daughter so she can continue to teach her good values.  After she reaches all of her goals, she will be able to stabilize and secure her family.  

She is need of this help from Kiva because the expenses for her daughter are very high, and she does not have the financial resources to pay the tuition at the normal price.  If she is able to receive this help from Kiva, it would be a huge help.  Her expenses would be lower, and the money that she would save could be invested in her household and personal expenses.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Nisreen

texts.en:
Nisreen is a strong, self-made woman. A 50-year-old widowed mother of three, Nisreen owns a hair and beauty salon. Since her husband passed away in 2008, she has been the sole carer and provider for their children.

Nisreen’s dream of running a salon started a long time ago but like most Iraqi women, she has faced many obstacles in making her dream come true. When she first wanted to work in the late 1970s, her brother prevented her from doing so, considering the idea of working in a salon to be ‘shameful’. Nisreen’s husband was supportive of her goals and after they married, she was able to begin working in the beauty sector. Nisreen still dreamed of opening her own salon but faced another challenge; a lack of capital. However, Nisreen didn’t give up and instead spent years working in a salon during the day and sewing at home in the evenings to save money. Over the years she saved enough money to finally open her own salon in 1986. The income from Nisreen’s salon now supports her whole family and she has even trained her daughter-in-law who works with her.

Nisreen wants to expand her business further by offering her clients laser hair removal, a service which is very much in demand in Iraq. She applied for an SME loan in the amount of $7,200 to enable her to purchase a laser hair removal machine.

As she explains in her own words: "My name is Nisreen, and I’ve been working in beauty salons for 34 years. My beauty salon is how my family and I make a living. I’m interested in joining the WLIFT program to learn. I want to succeed as a business woman like business women abroad and I would like to learn new things related to my work such as fashionable hairstyles."

loans.use: to buy a hair removal laser machine

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Benkadi vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 48 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de grains de céréales et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djelika (2ème femme debout à gauche vers la droite  dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains mil dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs de mil. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Djelika espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  37 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women from this Benkadi group all live in polygamous families. They have an average age of 48 and on average, five children. They all live in the village of N’gara in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know each other through being neighbors, relatives, in-laws and through their money-earning activities in the village. They have little businesses selling cereals and cooked food. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth solidarity loan.  

 Madame Djelika (the second woman standing left to right in the photo) sells a lot of millet in the village of N’gara and surrounding areas. She intends to use her loan to buy five sacks of millet. Her sales are made for cash and often for credit to a mixed clientele. 

 Madame Djelika hopes to make an average monthly profit of 37,000 F CFA with this loan. Her profit will be used equally to pay school fees for her children and to grow her working capital.

loans.use: to buy millet for resale

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar  tiene 28 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que sale adelante con el esfuerzo de su trabajo entonces su actividad económica principal es la trabajar para una empresa privada de compra y venta de vidrios, él es una persona responsable por ese motivo le invitaron a participar en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para la gastos como el agua y la luz, él agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Oscar is 28 years old, and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco.  He is a hardworking and entrepreneurial man who gets ahead through the effort he puts into his work.  His main job is working for a private company that buys and sells glass.  He is a responsible person, which is why he was invited to participate in the "Siempre Juntos" lending group. 

At this moment, he is in need of a loan to pay for expenses like water and electricity.  He is grateful and treasures the loan.  He is committed to responsibly adhering to the repayment schedule.

loans.use: pay for utilities like water and electricity.

loans.name: Wilikidjo Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe wilikidjo vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Daoulabougou dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce des produits cosmétiques, de la restauration et des condiments .Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er  cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Alimata (1ere femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse des produits cosmétiques dans le village de Daoulabougou et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité des produits cosmétiques pour satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Alimata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 15 000FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four members of the Wilikidjo group are married women   living in polygamous families. On the average, they are 36 years of age, with four children. They all live in the Vilalge fo Daoulabougou in Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali).
They know each other as neighbors or relatives by blood or marriage as well as through their work. They sell cosmetic products, cooked dishes and condiments. With the goal of increasing their working capital, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Alimata (the first one standing from left to right in the photo) is a well-known vendor of cosmetic products in the village of Daoulabougou and nearby. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of cosmetic products to meet customer demand. She sells for cash and often on credit, mainly to female customers. Thanks to this loan, Mrs. Alimata hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 15,000 West African francs, which will be used to pay school expenses for her children and also bolster her working capital.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Adán Baltazar

texts.es:
Adán de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta  tercer grado, debido a que le quedaba lejos la escuela, es casado  y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos , tiene un niño que aún no asiste a clases por le edad, con él solo vive su esposa y su niño.


Adán se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, también se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, tiene 12 años se dedicarse a esta actividad, su padre es agricultor y desde pequeño lo llevaban al campo fue así como se creó en su mente ser agricultor paso el tiempo y siempre siguió trabajando en lo mismo hasta el día de hoy, por el momento no tiene otra actividad que le genere ingresos. Siempre ha sido jornalero, en la actividad se involucra su esposa llevándole alimentos y  su padre que le ayuda a trabajar, su horario laboral es de 6:00 am a 12 md.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 300 tejas y 100 varas para mejorar el techo y 5 libras de clavos. El crédito mejorara su calidad de vida, porque comprando todo el material de una vez  ahorrara y podrá vivir más cómodo.
texts.en:
Adán is 28 years old, and has a third grade education because the school was very far away.  He is married, and his wife is a homemaker.  They have one son who is not yet in school given his age.  He lives alone with his wife and son.  Adán works growing basic grains such as beans and corn.  He also plants vegetables.  He has worked in this sector for 12 years.  His father was a farmer and from a young age, he would take him to the field, which is how he decided he wanted to be a farmer.  Time has passed, and he has continued to work in the same field.  To this day, he does not have any other activity that generates income.  He has always been a day laborer, an activity that his wife is involved with as she brings him food, and his father also helps him with the work.  His work schedule is from 6am to 12pm.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to purchase 300 shingles and 100 rods to repair his roof, and 5 pounds of nails.  The loan will improve his quality of life because by purchasing all of the materials at once, he will save and be able to live more comfortably.

loans.use: purchase 300 shingles and 100 rods to repair his roof, and 5 pounds of nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Diega

texts.en: Diega is a 61-year-old woman from Sikatuna, Bohol. She has been raising pigs for four years now. Diega has a pig pen near her house. In addition to this, Diega also farms rice and other root crops. She is asking for a loan to buy feed and supplements for her hogs. She hopes that she can make her business bigger and have it generate more profit for her food and savings for old age.

loans.use: to buy feed and supplements

loans.name: Linah

texts.en:
Linah lives in Mombasa Kenya. She is 26 years old and single.  She sells charcoal at the local market and has been doing so for two years.  Linah started her business with her personal savings.

Linah knew Milango through friends and now she seeks a loan to buy ten bags of charcoal. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and she hopes to become a wholesale in the next five years. 

The challenges that Linah faces in business include price changes and government regulation.  She wants to use the extra income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy ten bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover tuition fees for his son.

loans.name: Oun

texts.en:
Oun, a mother of six children, is 56 years old and a local villager from Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She is a rice and pineapple farmer on two hectares of land.  It is her main source of income.  She has been a farmer for many years.

Oun is the former borrower who has taken three past loans with VisionFund( Kiva’s partner) with a successful repayment history.  

Now, Oun is seeking 2,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer for her pineapple plantation and to buy more pineapple seedlings for growing.  Oun hope she will gain a good yield, better than in the past.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pineapple seedlings.

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина в возрасте 39 лет. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Сабохат живёт в сельской местности. Сама Сабохат закончила педагогическое училище и сейчас работает учительницей в местной школе. Она очень любит детей, и старается обучать их от всего своего сердца, потому что она желает видеть образованных детей. Но зарплата, которую она получает в школе, недостаточна для покрытия всех имеющихся нужд в семье. Поэтому вместе с мужем они имеют дополнительный бизнес. 

Сабохат, начиная с 2007 года сотрудничает с Арванд. Она получала кредит на потребительские нужды, а также на развитие своего бизнеса. Сабохат рассказывает, что после того, как она  начала сотрудничать с Арванд, качество её жизни стало постепенно улучшаться. В данное время Сабохат вместе со своим мужем хотят построить  дом, где будут хорошие условия для проживания. Для этого Сабохат обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Sabohat is 39, married, and has three children. She is a cheerful and conscientious woman and lives in a rural area. She has a degree in education and teaches at the local school. She loves children and tries to teach them with all her heart because she wants them to have a good education. However, her salary is insufficient to cover her family's needs, so she and her husband started a business for additional income.

Sabohat has been a client of MDO Arvand since 2007. She has received both a consumer loan and a business loan. Sabohat says that her quality of life has been slowly improving since she began working with Arvand. Sabohat and her husband now want to build a house to provide good living conditions for the family. She applied for a loan to buy construction materials to build the new house. She hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Yisell Maria

texts.es: Yisell es originaria de la ciudad de León, casada y madre de una niña. Tiene 26 años de edad. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva para adultos y niños. Inicio su negocio hace cuatro años con capital propio y poco a poco ha aumentado sus ventas logrando salir adelante. Solicita el crédito para la compra de: Uniformes escolares como pantalones, camisetas, camisolines, shorts, también útiles escolares como cuadernos entre otros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá ofrecer una amplia variedad de productos a sus clientes. Su plan futuro es establecer una tienda propia de ropa en general en su casa de habitación.
texts.en: Yisell is originally from the city of León. She is married and a mother to one daughter. Yisell is 26 years old. She is a businesswoman, making a living selling new clothing for adults and children. Yisell started this business with her own, small amount of capital four years ago and, little by little, her sales have increased. Yisell is applying for this loan in order to buy school uniforms, such as trousers, shirts, dickeys, shorts, and also school materials such as notebooks. Yisell believes that this loan will be of great help to her as she will be able to offer a great variety of products to her customers. Her future plan is to have her own clothes shop in her home.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms, such as trousers, shirts, dickeys, shorts, and also school materials such as notebooks.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Danaya vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 32 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce  de farine de blé, de grains de céréales et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce  les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Korotoumou (1ère femme assise devant dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de pâté et de farine sucrée dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité suffisante de farine de blé pour satisfaire de plus en plus sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Korotoumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  10 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce aider souvent son mari.
texts.en:
The six women of this Danaya group all live in polygamous families. They have an average age of 32 and on average five children. They all live in the village of N’gara in the region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali.)

They met because of coming from the same neighborhood, being related or in-laws, and through their money-earning activities in the village. They sell wheat flour, cereals and cooked food. Wishing to grow their working capital, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan. 

 Madame Korotoumou (the woman sitting on her heels at the front of the photo) sells a lot of pastry and sweets made of flour in the village of N’gara and its surrounding area. She intends to use her loan to buy a large quantity of wheat flour, enough to manage to satisfy the needs of her clientele. Her sales are made for cash and often for credit to a mixed clientele. 

 Madame Korotoumou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 10,000 F CFA with this loan. Her profit will be used to pay school fees for her children, grow her working capital,  and in equal measure, often to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour

loans.name: Francisco Jose

texts.es: Francisco Jose mayor de edad casado con cinco hijos todos mayores de edad, originario del municipio de chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Francisco se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado, responsable en su forma de pago,se dedica a la  venta de frutas y verduras como: yuca, quiquisque, ayotes, entre otros verduras que el mismo cultiva, al igual que se dedica a la compra venta de cerdos en pie, los cuales compra a buen precio en comarcas aledañas a su hogar, sus compras son al contado, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales entrega sus productos muy accesibles para sus clientes, Francisco poco a poco ha logrado salir adelante junto con su familia, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie que le están ofreciendo a buen precio, Francisco agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Francisco Jose is married and has five children, all of whom are adults. He is originally from the Chinandega municipality, in the west of Nicaragua. Francisco is hard-working, honest and responsible with his repayments. Francisco makes a living selling fruits and vegetables, such as yucca, quiquisque, pumpkins and more. He grows these products himself, and also makes a living selling live pigs, which he buys for a good price in the neighbouring area. He buys the pigs in cash. Francisco has regular and one-off customers to whom he sells his products. Little by little Francisco has been able to get ahead alongside his family. This loan will be used to buy live pigs, which are currently being sold for a good price. Francisco is grateful for this support that Kiva investors are providing to poor people.

loans.use: to buy pigs and other items.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia también se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar leche, azúcar entre otros.
La socia valora el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Celestina continues to dedicate herself to her business, a grocery store. She sells products of primary necessity such as rice, sugar, and milk, among other items. Celestina has dedicated herself to this business for a long time, during which it has gone well, due to the effort she expended daily on her business. She wishes to continue working in this manner in order to continue helping her family.

Celestina is requesting a loan to purchase milk, sugar, and other items of merchandise. 

Celestina values the loan and is committed to complying with her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: buy milk and sugar to sell among other items.

loans.name: Fidelina Lisseth

texts.es:
Fidelina de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, es acompañada su esposo es agente policial, tiene dos hijos, una de ellas estudia 3er grado y el segundo que aún no estudia por su edad. Con ella solo viven  su esposo y sus hijos.


     La señora tiene un pequeño cafetín, donde vende productos de la canasta básica. A esta actividad tiene 2 años de dedicarse, desde pequeña le gusto ser comerciante siempre ayudaba a su tía en la tienda a medida paso el tiempo decidió abrir  su negocio; fue así como fue obteniendo  más experiencia en la actividad.  Antes de este negocio no tenía otra actividad productiva, solo se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos, su negocio le queda aproximadamente a unos 100 metros de su casa, en la compra de mercadería le ayuda únicamente su esposo.


Manifiesta que con el financiamiento comprara 2 cajas de aceite que cada caja trae 12 bolsas, 50 libras de arroz pre cosido, una caja de salsas rancheras, una caja de sodas. Cubrirá la necesidad de comprar la mercadería de una vez,  ya que tendrá un ahorro.  

Con las ganancias pretende ampliar su negocio, lo hará vendiendo productos helados que hasta hoy no tiene a la venta, el crédito ayudara a dar   un mejor servicio a los clientes y obtener más ganancias, espera que sus hijos sean grandes y que puedan ingresar a la universidad y ser profesionales y que en un futuro puedan defenderse solos.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 28 years old. She studied through high school. She has a partner and her husband is a police officer. She has two children; one attends third grade while the other is too young for school. She lives alone with her husband and two children.

Fidelina has a small cafe where she sells basic food. She has had this business for two years. Since she was small she enjoyed being a merchant; she always used to help her aunt in her store and then over time she decided to open her own business. That was how she gained experience in the job. Before this business she did not have any other productive work and was only devoted to domestic tasks. Her business is approximately 100 meters from her house. Her husband is the only one who has been helping her to purchase merchandise for her cafe.

She notes that with the financing she will buy two cases of oil, with each case containing 12 pouches, 50 pounds of pre-cooked rice, a container of salsa ranchera and a case of sodas. She will be able to buy the merchandise all at once and will save money.

She wants to expand her business with any profits. She will do it by selling frozen products which until now she has not offered for sale. The loan will enable her to provide better service to her customers and to make more profit. She hopes her children grow up and are able to enroll in the university and become professionals so that in the future they will be able to take care of themselves.

loans.use: to purchase two cases of oil (with each case containing 12 pouches), 50 pounds of pre-cooked rice, a case of salsa ranchera and a crate of sodas.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Saroeurn is a father in his early 30s with two little kids who are not yet old enough for schooling. The main sources of his income are from three and half hectares of rice farming and a paid job which he works during his spare time. Nowadays, he is able to generate about 30,000 KHR per day from the business that he has put effort into for 10 years. 

Saroeurn is not a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). His past two loans, which he repaid completely, have enabled him to gradually improve his living conditions. Now, he is leading a group of two to get a new loan. Sareoun's loan portion is 1,000,000 KHR out of 1,500,000 KHR total loan amount and he will spend his loan portion to buy potash, insecticide, and gasoline for irrigation for his crop. He hopes that he can earn more income than last year.

loans.use: To buy potash, insecticide, and gasoline for irrigation

loans.name: Soeurm's Group

texts.en: Soeurm is 27 years old and a mother of three kids, residing in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. To support her kids who still rely on her, she does paddy rice farming and pineapple planting. She has engaged in her current business for 11 years, earning about 21,000 KHR per day. This is the original loan for Soeurm with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and also for her co-borrower. She and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR and 800,000 KHR respectively. Soeurm is the group leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can keep improving her lifestyle and making it better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Yolanda pertenece al banco comunal RENOVACION,la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de venta de materiales de escritorio como papeles,libros,lapiceros entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia vende su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como papeles, gomas entre otros.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Yolanda belongs to the "Renovación" communal bank, and continues working in her business selling office supplies, such as paper, books, pens and other items. She has had her business for some time, and it brings her satisfaction, both financial and personal. 

She sells merchandise to her customers on request. She wishes to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family in this way. She is requesting a loan to purchase supplies such as paper, erasers and other items. The member feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as paper, erasers and other items.

loans.name: 3.4.960.06.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future. Thanh is 37 years old and she is married with two children. Thanh is the group leader of the 3.4.960.06.Thiệu Phúc  solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Thanh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thanh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thanh hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a 46 year-old married woman. She has three children, with ages ranging from 6 years to 15 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are small scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be small returns. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food for selling. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 52-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father with two sons and one daughter. All of them are university students. For the past seven years, Khaled has been working in his blacksmith workshop. It is a good business and he earns a good income. Khaled would like to improve his work and expand it.

Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more raw iron for his work. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more raw iron for his work

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
A mother of three dependent kids residing Kampong Cham province, Lon is 44 years old and one of the breadwinners in the family who strives to earn a living via a pig-raising business and grocery-selling business. She has been involved in her current businesses for 15 years. 

This is the seventh loan for Lon with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loans have been fully repaid with success with the positive impact of improving her lifestyle and keeping her kids in school, as well as providing decent meals for the entire household. 

For this cycle, her requested loan amount is 2,000,000 KHR which she will be using to buy more pigs to raise. She hopes to earn double her previous income so that she can expand her business to a larger scale.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for two calves, fertilizer and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y continua perteneciendo al banco comunal "Siempre Juntos", ella alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño en su labor. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas. Ella agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Teresa lives in the city of Cusco in the south of Peru. She continues as a member of the "Siempre Juntos" communal bank. She alternates her daily activities with her business of raising small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. It has now been a number of years that she has done this and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work.

At this time she needs a loan to buy more small animals like guinea pigs and chickens. She is grateful and values the loan and promises to comply with the payment of the installments of her loan with great responsibility.

loans.use: to buy more small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en:
Nidal is a 28-year-old, married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife in a small, simple house. Nidal works as an employee in the public sector, with a low income. This income is barely enough to cover all the family's needs. Nidal tries to find another source of income to improve the family's living conditions. 

Nidal took a USD Murabaha loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for work purposes. By taking this loan, Nidal will be able to transfer goods to the local traders. This will increase the family's income and improve their living conditions. 

Nidal appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for work purposes.

loans.name: Hory's Group

texts.en: Hory, 44, is a resident of Battambang province where rice cropping is the popular business in the area. As with others from her neighborhood, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland as her main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. The decent income that she has received from her business mainly supports the daily food consumption as well as education costs of three kids out of her six children.  Hory, the former borrower who has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for the past two cycles with successful repayment, leads a group of four to get a new loan. Now, her living condition is getting better than before. The total requested loan amount of her entire group is 3,200,000 KHR, of which 1,400,000 KHR is her portion.  Hory, will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better yield  than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Nip's Group

texts.en:
Nip is 30 years old and a mother of three kids. Her residential area is in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. Their one and half hectares of farmland and her husband's occupation as a construction worker are the main sources of her family’s income. 

Nip has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, and she has formed a group of two to get a new loan. Nip is the leader, and she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good income in return so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Nadeem

texts.en:
Nadeem is taking out a loan to buy cosmetics products such as facial creams, face powders, lipsticks, nail polish, etc.He is a 35-year-old married man, living with his family in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He newly started this business; he is hopeful for the warm support of Kiva lenders because his financial progress depends upon this loan amount. His shop is situated near beauty parlors and this is the reason he has a lot of demand for beauty products. For that reason, his stock of beauty products is quickly sold out and he has to refuse his worthy customers. 

Therefore, Nadeem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he will be able to buy additional cosmetics products such as facial creams, bleach creams, nail polish, hair color, lotions, etc. In this way he can easily generate income to cherish his family and can put aside some savings to meet sudden incidents. 

Nadeem feels proud when someone appreciates his efforts and devotion to his newly started business. Nadeem thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy beauty products for resale.

loans.name: Mavjigul

texts.ru:
Мавчигул жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. Мавчигул имеет среднее образование, и работает в государственном учреждении. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. Муж Мавчигул работает председателем дехканского хозяйства.

Для того, чтобы иметь дополнительный доход на проживание Мавчигул вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Мавчигул выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса Мавчигул получает хороший доход.  Их совместного дохода хватает на проживание среднего уровня. И пока у них недостаточно средств, чтобы покрывать все имеющиеся нужды. В данный момент Мавчигул с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Мавчигул заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Mavjigul is a cheerful and hard-working woman. She is married and has three children. She lives in a small rural village. Mavjigul has secondary education, and works at a state institution. Together with her husband she strives to do all possible to provide her children with all things necessary. Mavjigul's husband works as a chairman for a dekhan farm. 

In order to have an additional income for living, Mavjigul and her husband together started their own business. They work with livestock breeding. Mavjigul breeds cattle and then sells the meat and milk from the cattle. Mavjigul receives a good income from this business. Their joint income is enough for expenses of average level residence, however it is not enough for covering all their needs. 

Currently Mavjigul and her husband would like to purchase additional heads of cattle to fatten. Therefore Mavjigul turned to Arvand and would like to take a loan to purchase cattle. Mavjigul thanks Arvand in advance for the support, which will improve life quality for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 43-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is a father with four sons and two daughters. For several years, Khaled has been working at selling candy and simple toys on his cart. A lot of school students buy from him. Khaled would like to improve his business and maybe rent a small stall to work in, instead of the cart.

Khaled took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more candy and toys to resell in the local market using his cart. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more candy and toys to resell in the local market, using his cart.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 22 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 1 дочь. У Нургул - среднее образование, она ответственная, целеустремленная, умеет вести хозяйство. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Нургул занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нургул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 20 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нургул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом - на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Нургул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 22 years old, married and raising a daughter together with her husband. Nurgul has secondary education. She is responsible, purposeful and knows how to manage a household. 

As a main source of income for her family, Nurgul works with livestock breeding, after having started 6 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Nurgul's persistent work, her farm currently has four dairy cows, two calves and 20 sheep. The monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS).

With an aim to further develop her business, Nurgul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase sheep to increase the number of livestock. Nurgul plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for refurbishing her home.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Chanseng

texts.en:
Chanseng is a 33-year-old hardworking married woman with six children, living in Ou Ta Nov village, Mien, Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. She practices farming as her major source of income while her husband works as a construction foreman to earn a living for the family. Having been a farmer for nearly 15 years, Chanseng is able to earn a daily income of USD 4. 

Her challenge is the shortage of capital to invest into her farming business. To solve this matter, Chanseng would like to acquire a loan amounting to USD 1,000 to pay for renting land for farming rice and buying farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. She hopes that her business will improve to better her standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for renting land for farming rice and buying farm inputs like seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 35-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of 6 children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by trade. Over the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly and because of that, he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore Razia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Razia is very much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing their rickshaw.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан 59 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей, все взрослые, имеют свои семьи, проживают отдельно, только самый младший живет с родителями и помогает по хозяйству. У Анаркан - средне-специальное образование, в данный момент находится на пенсии, до этого долгие годы работала лаборанткой в ветеринарной лечебнице. В настоящее время в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Анаркан занимается животноводством, хозяйство достаточное для разведения скота, во дворе дома есть помещение для скота, запасы сена и кормов. Супруг работает в местной организации водителем, имеется стабильный доход. Благодаря упорному труду Анаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 1 лошадь, 2 теленка, 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Анаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство нового дома.
texts.en:
Anarkan is 59 years old, married and has 6 children together with her husband. The children are all adults and have their own families, lives separately, only the youngest lives together with the parents and help them with their farm. Anarkan has vocational secondary education. 

Anarkan is currently a pensioner. Before this she worked many years as a laboratory assistant in a veterinary hospital. Currently, as a main source of income for her family, Anarkan works with livestock breeding. Their farm is sufficient for breeding livestock; in the yard there is room for livestock, hay and forage supplies. Anarkan's husband works as a driver for a local agency, and he has a stable income. Thanks to Anarkan's persistent work, her farm currently has four dairy cows, one horse, two calves and 15 sheep. The monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). 

With an aim to further develop her farm, Anarkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan to purchase calves to increase the number of livestock. Anarkan plans to invest the income from the loan in further increasing the number of livestock. She also plans to save money for building a new home.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Махбуба домохозяйка, проживающая в районе Спитамен. Ей 24 года. Она замужем. Махбуба по профессии швея и у себя дома принимает заказы на пошив женских платьев. Ее семья занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур, в частности выращивает кукурузу. Махбуба, чтобы улучшить уровень жизни семьи собирается начать еще один бизнес. Ее интересует животноводство. У нее есть опыт в выращивании скота. Она просит кредит в размере 1500 долларов США чтобы приобрести двух голов крупнорогатого скота и корма для скота. У нее созданы все условия для содержания скота. Ей нужна финансовая поддержка, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en:
Mahbuba is a housewife, living in the Spitamen region. She is 24 years old and married. Mahbuba is a seamstress by profession and she takes orders for sewing women's dresses at her home. Her family works with sowing field crops, in particular sweet corn. 

In order to improve the family's living standard, Mahbuba has decided to start yet another business. She is interested in livestock breeding. She has experience in breeding livestock. She requests a loan in the amount of 1,500 US dollar in order to purchase two heads of cattle and fodder for them. She has established all conditions for keeping livestock. She needs financial support in order to start the new business.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of cattle and fodder for them

loans.name: Yasin

texts.en:
Yasin is a 35-year-old internally-displaced person (IDP). He is married and has two daughters. The family has lived in an IDP settlement for a long time. Yasin is a farmer and has 11 years of good experience in this field. He raises seasonal vegetables such as greens, beets, spinach, turnips, celery, cucumbers and zucchini, and sells them at the local bazaar. His monthly income is 150 AZN.

People like eating fresh vegetables and using them to prepare national dishes such as bughlama, sadjh ichi, kuku, dovgha, lobya chighirtmasi, etc. These are recipes that have remained from ancient times and they are still very famous. Local restaurants are permanent customers of Yasin’s greengrocery.

Although there is high demand for fresh vegetables, unfortunately this business isn’t profitable enough to cover Yasin’s family’s needs. He decided make an innovation in his business. He applied for 2,000 AZN in order to buy additional seeds of vegetables and fruits which do not depend on season and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds of vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Turan

texts.en:
Turan is 25 years old, single, and he lives with his parents. He is engaged and in the spring, he wants to get married. 

Turan is a master. He builds stone walls, constructs concrete foundations of houses, etc. He learned this profession from his father and he has been in this business for four years. They are living in the Balaxani settlement of the Baku region. 

Turan needs a loan and, therefore, he has applied to Komak Credit Union for a loan in amount of AZN 1,800 (Azerbaijan New Manat), to buy new materials which will be useful in his business, such as cement and bricks. Turan says thanks to the Kiva organization and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy new materials for his business, such as cement and bricks.

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Mr. Nyamdavaa  is 29 years old, married, and lives with his wife and two children in a Ger (Mongolian Yurt) in Arkhangai  Province, Mongolia. His wife Batchimeg helps him with his business. His son is now four years old. His daughter is two years old. They stay at home. He runs a wholesale clothing retail business in a rented place in local trade market. He is a diligent and hardworking guy. His selections of clothes are highly fashionable and inexpensive. Over the years, he has gained many reliable, regular suppliers and customers. His monthly income is between 550,000 and 650,000 MNT. 

Mr. Nyamdavaa is requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase new season clothing and supplies to sell at her rental stall.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for clothing retail business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en: Juma is a 26 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages 1 year and 5 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a brick selling business where he makes bricks to sell. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located within a residential area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy a motorcycle to enable him start a transport business whereby he will be transporting  customers from one place to another for a fee. This will enable him earn extra income. His business goal is to be the best within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he can expand his business. This his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle to enable him start a transport business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna lives in Sisian town with her father (in the photo) and 9-year-old sister. Ruzanna herself is 20 years old and studies at Goris State University. Together with her studies, Ruzanna also works at a local store as a seller. She works hard to help her father with family's costs and takes care of her little sister.

Now, by applying for this loan, Ruzanna asks Kiva lenders to help her with university tuition. 
Ruzanna will be very grateful to lenders if they help her cover tuition costs and continue her studies. She hopes for your support.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing inventories to sell at her rental counter

loans.name: Delia

texts.en: Delia, 59 years of age and earning PHP 3,000 in her hog raising business, is married to a farmer and blessed with one child. Due to insufficient fund to invest in her hog raising business she would like to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hog feed to supplement the needs for her pigs. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can sustain the needs of her pigs to gain more income.

loans.use: To purchase hog feed to supplement the needs of her pigs.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Мамлакат жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина, она является пенсионеркой. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй Мамлакат живёт в сельской местности. Дети Мамлакат живут со своими семьями вместе с ними. Она очень любит своих внуков, и старается помогать своим детям воспитывать их хорошими людьми. Муж Мамлакат и её сыновья также зарабатывают на частном предприятии, работают мастерами по ремонту. 

Мамлакат уже давно сотрудничает с Арванд. Она получала кредит на потребительские нужды. Мамлакат рассказывает, что после того, как она начала сотрудничать с Арванд, качество её жизни стало постепенно улучшаться. В данное время Мамлакат вместе со своим мужем хотят построить дом, где будут хорошие условия для проживания. Для этого она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для построения дома. Она надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Mamlakat is a cheerful and hardworking woman. She is retired. She is married and has three children. Mamlakat lives in a rural village together with her family. Mamlakat's children and their own families live together with them. Mamlakat loves her grandchildren very much and tries to help her children raise them to become good people. Mamlakat's husband and her sons work in private companies, as masters of construction. 

Mamlakat has collaborated with Arvand for a long time already. She received a loan for private use. Mamlakat says that after she started collaborating with Arvand, her life quality has gradually increased. Currently Mamlakat and her husband would like to build a house with good living conditions. For this they turned to Arvand and would like to receive a loan to purchase building materials for building a house. She hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build a new house

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq femmes du groupe Djiguisseme vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 47 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative  de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce des grains riz. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 5ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Fatoumata (2ème femme debout de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains de riz dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de grains de riz pour la satisfaction sa clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Madame Fatoumata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   17 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et également pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The five women of the Djiguisseme group all live in polygamous families. They are on average 47 years old with 4 children each. They all live in the same village of N'gara in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali.) The women came to know each other through neighbors, family, marriage, and through their businesses in the village.

The women are in the rice business. In order to increase their business funds, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fifth group loan. Fatoumata (the 2nd woman pictured standing from left to right in the photo) is a big reseller of rice in the village of N'gara and the surrounding area. She plans to use her loan to purchase 3 bags of rice to meet her customers' needs. She makes her sales for cash and often for credit to a customer base made up of men and women.

Fatoumata hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 17,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use for her chidren's education costs and also to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase grains of rice

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel de 43 años de edad,  vive junto a su compañero de vida quien es pescador artesanal, junto con ellos están 2 hijos adolescentes quienes dejaron de asistir a la escuela por problemas económicos.

Ella se ha dedicado desde hace muchos años al comercio,  es una persona que siempre le ha gustado comercializar especialmente con mariscos. Anteriormente, tenía un pequeño comedor en su casa de habitación.


Los fondos serán utilizados para fortalecer el cafetín que administrar y poder ofrecer una mayor diversidad de productos que vender a sus clientes. El fuerte de su negocio es la comida rápida y refrescos naturales.

El sueño de Mabel a un corto plazo, es tener nuevamente su comedor ya que es apasionada de la cocina y ve que en su lugar de residencia no existe un lugar donde se brinde dicho servicio.
texts.en:
Mabel, 43 years old, lives together with her life partner who is an artisnal fisherman. With them are 2 adolescent children who stopped attending school because of economic problems.  

She has worked for many years in business. She is a person who has always liked to commercialize especially seafood. Previously, she had a small eatery in her house.

The funds will be used to boost her small café that she runs and to be able to offer larger diversity of products to sell to her clients. The strength of her business is the fast food and natural soft drinks. 

Mabel's dream in the short term is to have her eatery again because she is passionate about the kitchen, and she sees that in her area a place that offers such a service does not exist.

loans.use: to boost the small café that she runs and to be able to offer a larger diversity of products to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 46-year-old married man from Gaza city. He is a father with one small son. For the past year, Khaled has been working in his sewing workshop. He sews several types of clothes and sells them to wholesalers. It is a good business and he earns a good income. Khaled would like to improve his work and expand it

Khaled took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy an additional sewing machine for his work. By taking this loan, Khaled will be able to increase his productivity and also his income.

Khaled appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy an additional sewing machine for his work

loans.name: Kankelen Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Kankelen  vivent dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de cosmétique, d’habillement et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Sali  Issa (1ère femme assise devant à droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse des produits cosmétiques dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une  grande quantité  des produits cosmétiques. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à domicile et en ambulant  à une clientèle majoritairement féminine.
 Madame Sali Issa espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   19000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The seven women of the Kankelen group live in polygamous households. They are on average 42 years old with 6 children each, and all live in the same village of N'gara in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali.) The women came to know each other through neighbors, family, marriage, and also through their small businesses in the village.

The women are in the business of selling cosmetics, clothing, and cereals. In order to increase their business capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their third group loan. 

Sali Issa (the first woman pictured seated on the right in the photo) is a large reseller of cosmetics in the village of N'gara and its surroundings.She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of cosmetics. She makes her sales for cash and often for credit from her home and door to door, to a mostly female customer base.

Sali Issa hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 19,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to provide for the needs of her children and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 42 year-old married man from Deir el balah city. he lives with his wife and five kids; two sons and three daughters. Mohammad works as an employee in the public sector where he receives a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad would like to improve himself and take a higher education degree so he can find a better job. Mohammad is a master's student where he studies Elementary Education.
Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan Mohammad will be able to do his home work and easily write his reports. 
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia, age 36, is a mother of five children. Her husband is an excellent tailor by profession. He owns a tailoring school in which he provides training in tailoring techniques. 
He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for the school, including threads, needles, clothing etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nazia, as a member of two person lending group is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the things he needs with the help of loan. Nazia is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring machine and a variety of tailoring materials for tailoring school.

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
This is Feliza, 25, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jhon Boy, her business partner, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Feliza is a dried fish vendor. She buys different kinds of dried fish from her suppliers then sells it in the market. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more dried fish needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Feliza dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes that her children will finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more dried fish needed in her business.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Deir el Balah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Mohammad's father works as a teacher in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Elementary Education.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking out this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Ingrid Beatriz

texts.es:
Ingrid es una joven emprendedora que tiene 23 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijas, solamente estudió hasta séptimo grado, ya que no tuvo la oportunidad  de continuar sus estudios por dedicarse a los oficios de la casa. 

Tiene un año de trabajar en la crianza de pollos de engorde, actividad que aprendió por la misma necesidad de subsistencia y la falta de empleos en su país, para criar sus pollos ha construido una galera con láminas y madera en el patio de su casa, sencilla pero muy adecuada, con sus bebederos y comederos, todos los días alimenta a los pollos y les provee de agua limpia con su antibiótico y vitaminas, para asegurase que no se le enfermen, sus pollos los vende a comerciantes mayoristas en los mercados de la ciudad y otros los llegan a traer hasta su casa. 

Ingrid, para comprar los pollos, viaja en un autobús, el cual pasa por su comunidad, el viaje tarda casi una hora, siempre compra en una agroservicio, ya que le venden pollitos de calidad y a buen precio. 

Esta joven, solicita $650.00 a CrediCampo, para comprar 200 pollitos de engorde y 15 sacos de concentrado para alimentarlos, vitaminas, antibióticos y otros.   

El crédito le ayudará a Ingrid, pues podrá conseguir precios mas bajos comprando los pollos al por mayor, también se evitará tantos viajes a la ciudad ya que son dificultosos y tendrá siempre pollos en existencia para suplir las demandas de sus clientes. Al tener su galera siempre llena de pollos, la joven estará segura de sus ingresos, lo que ayudará a ir creciendo en el negocio y a la subsistencia de su familia

Ingrid sueña con expandir su negocio, para que sus hijas puedan tener estudio y una casa propia.
texts.en:
Ingrid is an enterprising young woman, 23 years old.  She has a partner and two daughters.  She only studied through the seventh grade. She didn’t have the chance to continue her studies because she worked around the home.

For one year now she has worked raising and fattening chickens.  She learned this type of work because she needed a means of support and there weren’t jobs available in her country.  She built a chicken house out of metal sheeting and wood on the patio of her house in order to raise her chickens.  It is simple but adequate, with drinking and feed troughs.  She feeds her chickens everyday and gives them clean water.  She also gives them antibiotics and vitamins to make sure they don’t get sick.  She sells her chickens to wholesale dealers in the city markets, and others come to her house.

To buy the chickens, Ingrid travels in a bus that passes through her community.  The trip lasts almost an hour.  She always makes her purchases at an agrobusiness store because they sell high quality chicks at a good price.

This young woman is asking for a loan of $650 to buy 200 chicks to fatten, as well as 15 sacks of concentrate to feed them.  She’ll also buy vitamins, antibiotics, and other items.
The loan will help Ingrid because she will be able to get low prices by buying the chickens wholesale.  She can also avoid making numerous trips to the city, because those are difficult.  She will always have a supply of chickens to meet the demands of her customers.  By having her chicken house always full of chickens, this young lady will be assured of her income, which will help her to grow her business and support her family.

Ingrid dreams of expanding her business so that her daughters can study and they can have their own house.

loans.use: to buy 200 chicks to fatten and 15 sacks of concentrate to feed them, as well as vitamins, antibiotics, and other items.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 44-year-old married man. He has eight children with ages ranging from 4 years to 18 years. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located within a shopping centre and his primary customers are regular ones. 

Joshua describes his biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more shoes to sell. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This his fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent is a first-time borrower applying for a loan of two million shillings (UGX.2,000,000), He is married with two children who are in school. He and his family live in a trading center along a busy road. He has a small retail shop/canteen in a school which he runs with his wife. Innocent says he has customers with a ready market of over 1,070 students. He wants to stock his business but lacks capital so he is applying for a loan.
Innocent expects a cash inflow increase by UGX 800,000 every month from boosting his business. He expects to pay off this first loan and get subsequent loans.

loans.use: To buy soda to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 49-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 6 years to 20 years. She describes herself to be ambitious.
