She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive place and her primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. 

Rosemary describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more maize to sell. Her business goal is to be  a wholesale supplier within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to a higher level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more maize to sell

loans.name: María Esperanza

texts.es:
María de 36 años de edad,  es una mujer con muchas ganas de seguir adelante, a pesar de haber estudiado educación básica, ella busca la manera de superarse, su mayoría de tiempo la pasa en su casa cuidando a su abuela, pero en su tiempo libre brinda sus servicios en una tienda,  para obtener ingresos y así  poder abastecer sus necesidades prioritarias, ya que vive solo con su  tía y su abuela.

María desempeña sus oficios domésticos muy bien, ya que dejo de estudiar para dedicarse a sus quehaceres  del hogar, apoyando a su tía y ayudándole a su abuela que por su avanzada edad se le hace difícil movilizarse fácilmente de un lugar a otro o realizar actividades pesadas.

El préstamo lo utilizara para reparar su pequeña casa, debido a que en la época lluviosa se moja por dentro, lo que deteriora los muebles que con mucho esfuerzo ha obtenido. Sumándole a esto que su abuela es bastante vulnerable a las enfermedades virales. Por lo que,  María solicita el crédito para satisfacer su necesidad prioritaria. 

María en un futuro sueña con tener una buena casa,  donde pueda estar tranquila sin pasar malos momentos en la época lluviosa, el préstamo le ayudara a cumplir su sueño, además ella espera en un futuro poder establecer una tienda de donde pueda obtener ingresos que cubran sus necesidades.
texts.en:
María is 36 years old. She is a woman with a strong desire to get ahead; despite having a ninth-grade education, she looks for ways to improve herself. She spends the majority of her time at home, taking care of her grandmother. In her free time, she offers her services in a shop in order to earn income so she can meet her basic needs, as she lives on her own with her aunt and her grandmother.

María carries out her domestic role very well; she left school to dedicate herself to her household duties, supporting her aunt and helping her grandmother. Her grandmother's advanced age makes it difficult for her to move from one place to another and to perform strenuous activities.

She will use the loan to repair her little house, because in the rainy season, moisture comes in and deteriorates the furniture that María worked very hard to obtain. In addition, her grandmother is very vulnerable to viral illnesses.  María is requesting the loan to meet this basic need. 

In the future, María dreams of having a good house where she can be at ease without having trouble during the rainy season. This loan will help her to realize that dream. She also hopes to be able to establish a shop someday from which she will be able to earn income to meet her needs.

loans.use: to repair her little house.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is 40-year-old married woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is has three children and her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been providing this transport service for 1 year. Shahida's husband wants to repair of his rickshaw, because the current condition of  his rickshaw is not working properly it needs proper maintenance so that he can provide better transport facilities to the general public.
This loan will help him to make the payment of maintenance and this will also help him to earn maximum profitable income.
Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en:
Kausar is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of 4 children. She has had a business of wooden beds manufacturing. Kausar is doing this business with the help of her husband and they operate the business at home. They manufacture different types of bed structures and then they use bright, traditional colors on the legs of beds, which looks very beautiful. She offers various types of wooden beds in different colors and is famous in providing good quality material in her community. 

Kausar is trying hard to provide basic necessities like food, health, clothing and education to her children.  She has been working with Kashf for the last 6 years with a very good credit history. Now she has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase good quality wood along with some colors and cutters to make the wooden beds. In that manner, she can cater to the demand of the clients which will lead to an increase in her revenue.

loans.use: to purchase good quality wood along  with some colors and cutters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new line of items and renew her store’s stock.

loans.name: Rani

texts.en:
Rani is 55 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of three daughters and a son. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession and her son has worked as an auto mechanic for the past 10 years. Both her husband and son contribute their income to support the household.
Rani's son wants to purchase different kinds of tools and equipment for his business, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to. Therefore Rani has applied for a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, she will help her son's business. This loan will help her son expand his business and earn more profit. Rani is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and equipment for her son's business

loans.name: Jesus Antonio

texts.es: Jesús Antonio mayor de edad, soltero, originario de unos de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, donde predomina el comercio, el turismo. Jesús Antonio es un micro empresario con deseos de superación, que se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general  el cual sale de su casa desde muy temprano a ofrecer sus productos  de manera ambulante tales como: cosméticos, ropa nueva, zapatos, entre otros. Las compras la realizan al contado en mercados de mayoreo y empresas distribuidoras de este municipio; las ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales. Él solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio de mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa, cosmeticos, zapatos entre otros  y así poder satisfacer con las demandas de los clientes, Jesús Antonio agradece a los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brinda a personas de bajos recursos y a países pobres como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Jesús Antonio is a single adult who is originally from one of the towns in Chinandega, which is located in the western part of the country. The predominant trades are retail and tourism.

Jesús Antonio is a micro-entrepreneur who has the drive to succeed. He buys and sells general merchandise. Jesús leaves his house very early so that he can begin offering his products as a street vendor. He sells cosmetics, new clothes, shoes, and other items. His purchases are made in cash at the wholesale markets and with distribution companies in town. Jesús sells his merchandise either for cash or on credit to both established and occasional customers.

The loan he is requesting will invested in his general merchandise business. He will buy clothing in a variety of styles, cosmetics, shoes, and other products so that he can meet the demands of his customers. Jesús Antonio appreciates the Kiva lenders for assisting people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, shoes, plastic goods, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Sabet

texts.en:
Sabet is a 60-year-old widowed woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 25 years to 40 years. She describes herself to be ambitious and patient. 

She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy and competitive place, and her primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be scarcity of products. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more maize and beans to sell. 

Her business goal is to have a big store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 25 años de edad, tiene un nivel académico de bachillerato general, vive junto con su mamá y dos sobrinitos de 13 y 10 años de edad, ellos estudian en nivel de secundaria y primaria siempre apoyado de la  mano de francisco; quien desarrolla  la actividad de pesca artesanal en la laguna de la comunidad.

Francisco se dedica a la pesca de mariscos en la laguna que lleva el mismo nombre de la comunidad, en la que le dedica un promedio de 8 horas laborales a dicha actividad  y lo ejerce desde hace 8 años, después que curso su nivel académico, Francisco comenzó esta actividad de la mano de un amigo quien desarrollaba dicha  actividad como negocio, fue así que Francisco se preocupó por aprender  muy bien ese rubro que le permite dar el sustento diario a su familia. 
 

Francisco está solicitando un crédito,  para la compra de un equipo de pesca, ya que  cuenta con uno muy deteriorada,  para la actividad que desarrolla, también comprara unas redes para la misma actividad, Francisco pretende que con un mejor equipo obtendrá mejores resultado en la pesca.

Francisco planea tener un negocio que le sea rentable y le permita darle una mejor oportunidad de desarrollo de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco is 25 years old and his education level is general high school. He lives with his mother and his two young nephews aged 13 and 10 years. They attend primary and secondary school, always with help from Francisco, whose business is artisanal fishing in the lagoon of his community.

Francisco harvests shellfish in the lagoon that is named after his community. He does this type of work for an average of 8 hours a day. He got into this line of work 8 years ago, after he completed high school. Francisco started this business with the help of a friend who did this kind of work as a business, and that's how Francisco took it upon himself to learn this trade very well. It allows him to support his family on a daily basis.

Francisco is requesting a loan in order to purchase fishing equipment for his business, since the one he has is very damaged. He'll also purchase a few fishing nets for his business as well. Francisco intends to use the upgraded equipment to obtain better results in his fishing.

Francisco plans to own a business that is profitable and that allows him to provide more opportunities for his family to get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment and a few fishing nets.

loans.name: Sumaria's Group

texts.en: Sumaria is 31 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. His rickshaw has not been working properly and so he is unable to generate any income. He wants to purchase a new auto rickshaw to continue his work as soon as possible. Due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore Sumaria, as a member of a two-person lending group, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Sumaria is so thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a new auto rickshaw so her husband can continue his work.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Rehana lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a restaurant in the market which is the only source of income for the family. He delivers delicious food to his customers. All of his customers love the food of his restaurant.

Presently he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife, Rehana, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of food items, including rice, spices, sugar and a variety of vegetables to cook food and sell in the restaurant. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. Rehana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food items, including, rice, spices, sugar and a variety of vegetables to cook food

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gypsum board, ceramic tiles, and cement.

loans.name: Las Divinas Group

texts.es: Socias exitosas microempresarias de éxito son mujeres que forman el grupo, una de ella es Martha tiene 38 años de edad es viuda  y con un hijo a cargo su negocio es la venta de frutas y verdura ambulante en las calles de su comunidad, este negocio tiene 4 años consecutivos y lo inicio vendiendo chinelas, este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosechas de tamarindo y mejorar su vivienda. Con el crédito anterior compro más productos y mantiene en inventario, Francisca tiene 51 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras y Petrona tiene 55 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de verduras y frutas.
texts.en:
The women who formed this group are successful micro-entrepreneurs. One of them is Martha. She is 38 years old, widowed, and has a dependent child. Her business involves selling fruits and vegetables as she travels the streets of her community. This business has been in operation for four consecutive years. Martha started out selling slippers. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of harvested tamarind and improvements to her home. Her previous loan was used to buy more products and maintain her inventory.

Francisca is 51 years old and has business of selling fruits and vegetables. Petrona is 55 years old and also has a business of selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy harvested tamarind and to pay for home improvements.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta 3 grado y por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo continuar con sus estudios y se dedicó mejor al cuido de animales domésticos, los cuales son cerdos, vacas y gallinas, su esposo hace 4 meses viajo para estados unidos y él le manda un poquito de dinero para parte de su alimentación y el cuido de sus animalitos,

Sofía tiene 20 años de experiencia en lo que es el cuido de sus animalitos, ya que ella cuando ya no siguió sus estudios se dedicó mejor a realizar este trabajo, ella  ha decidido dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que a través de este, ella  obtiene sus ingresos cuando vende sus animalitos o cuando vende la lechita de sus vacas.


El préstamo para que esta solicitando, es para hacer una pequeña construcción de una galera,  para que pase el agua el ganado en la época de invierno, ya que eso le afecta mucho en lo que es la producción de leche y también comprara alimentación para sus vacas.

Ella a futuro desea tener una galera para su ganado que le permita darle una mejores condiciones, y darle un buen manejo, así podrá obtener más rentabilidad en la producción de leche.
texts.en:
Sofía is 33 years old and completed school through the third grade. Due to a lack of financial resources, she was not able to continue her studies. She has devoted her time to the care of domesticated animals such as pigs, cows, and chickens. Her husband left for the United States four months ago and he sends her a small of money that helps pay for her food expenses and the care of the animals.

Sofía has 20 years of experience in caring for her animals. When she was no longer able to continue her studies, she decided that it would be best to begin working. She chose to pursue this line of work because she is able to generate an income upon selling the animals and by selling the milk produced by her cows.

The loan she is requesting will be used to build a small stable where her cows can drink water during the winter season. This will affect the quantity of milk that they produce. Sofía will also buy food for her cows.

In the future, Sofía would like to have a completed stable so that her cows can have better conditions and she will be able to take better care of them. As a result, the milk production will become more profitable.

loans.use: to build a small stable and buy feed for her dairy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: M. Shahbaz

texts.en:
M. Shahbaz is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He owns a car rental business in which he provides motor cars on rent to the general public, especially for wedding ceremonies. He also provides services as a guide for tourists and shows them the historical places by driving a motor car in Lahore, city. He has been doing this work for many years. To carry out his work, he has to stay at the shop to deal with the general public. He has only one car to provide services; he wants to buy another new car to cope with the demand but due to the high cost he is unable to purchase one.

Therefore, M. Shahbaz has requested a Kiva loan through BRAC Pakistan, so he can buy an additional car with the contribution of his savings. In this way he will be able to provide better services and can generate sufficient income to cherish his family members.

This will be his first loan with Kiva, and he hopes that with your cooperation he will be able to carry out his plans. He promises to make his payments on time.

M. Shahbaz thanks to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a car for car rental services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Nelyn

texts.en:
Nelyn is a 20 –year old college undergraduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 5.Her father is a jeepney (public utility vehicle) driver and her mother a housewife. Nelyn has 2 siblings, and they are still studying in the public high school.
Nelyn is a former sales clerk for a retail company, and she’s earning Php 6,000.00 ($133) per month, but this was only for her personal needs. Nelyn would like to earn more for herself and for her family. Now that she has passed BagoSphere’s selection process, she needs assistance to finance her tuition so she can help her parents  and send her siblings to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Alaa Eddin

texts.en:
Alaa Eddin is a 29-year-old married man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his wife and three kids, two sons and one daughter, in a small simple house. Alaa works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Alaa is also a student in a local university where he studies press and media. He would like to finish his study and find a job in the media field.

Alaa took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Alaa will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Alaa appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Jameela's Group

texts.en:
Jameela is a responsible mother of six daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for twenty-five years. He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the entire family. 

Her husband needs to do maintenance of his vehicle because the current condition of his vehicle is not good. It requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to do maintenance of his vehicle. 

Therefore, Jameela has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, Jameela's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. 

Jameela also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.

Jameela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to meet the expenses for her husband's taxi maintenance.

loans.name: Jeronima

texts.en: Jeronima and Cesar live in Totolapan, Morales and have been living in the same house for almost 28 years. The couple have 4 children who help around the house and with the work. The oldest son, Cristian, is soon having a baby and the new family will be moving in. Right now the house is perfect for the family except for the lack of a complete bathroom. Jeronima works hard selling mexican food at the local market and Cesar as a farmer, to make sure the family lives well. Everyone is excited with the new addition to the family but know that the brothers will not be able to share the room and one bathroom will not be enough for everyone. This is why Jeronima has been saving to buy the materials needed to build a new room and a bathroom so the whole family can live better.  Jeronima and Cesar together make around USD 550 a month, so the house that they have today is the result of years of work and savings. Since no one in the family has a formal job and their income is low and variable, they do not have access to credit from banks or other organizations. Jeronima is now asking for a loan to complete the payment of materials needed. Cesar and his sons will work on the construction, they will receive supervision visits from certified technicians to monitor the quality and progress of the construction. The new room will give the new family their own space to grow and the new private bathroom will make live better for all the family members.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bathroom and a room

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en:
Petronilla, a 34-year-old married mother of four children between the ages of two and five, describes herself as ambitious and patient. For six years now she has operated a retail business selling cereals. Located in a busy and competitive area, her primary customers are walk-ins and permanent patrons. Scarcity of products and price fluctuations are her biggest challenges.

Petronilla will use this Kes 20,000 loan, her first with SMEP DTM, to buy more maize and beans for resale. Her business goal is to be a supplier within five years.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Charina

texts.en:
Charina is a 19-year old high school graduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. She belongs to a family of 11. Her father is a sugarcane farmer and her mother a housewife. Charina has 9 siblings. Her eldest brother is working as an automotive mechanic and her sister works as a sales clerk. The rest are still studying in Bago City College and the public high school and elementary.

Charina worked as a housekeeper in a nearby city for 9 months. She earned Php 2,000.00 ($44) per month but this income was not even enough for her own needs. Charina would like to earn more for herself and for her family, and she believes that the training at BagoSphere might make her realize this goal.

Charina's short term goal is to be a call center agent, so she can earn enough money to help her parents and send her siblings to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en: Roberto is a young man who lives in Totolopan, Morelos and works as an independent contraction worker. Roberto lives with his two younger brothers since their parents passed away. They have always lived in this house and value all their parents did to give them what they have. Roberto makes around USD $500 a month through an informal job so access to credit is impossible for him. He has been saving for the last couple of months to build two bedrooms so each brother can have his own space, and a service patio where they can do laundry, cook and dry their clothes because the stick structure they have today is falling apart. Roberto is asking for a loan to finish paying for the materials he needs. Roberto has the skills to complete the work and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets all the safety and quality standards. Roberto is now the head of the family and as such wishes to give her young brothers a better home where they can make a happy life.

loans.use: to buy materials to build bedrooms and a service patio

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida, 23 years old, lives with her husband and young child in a small, simple house located in the city of Deir Al-Balah. Her husband is employed by a local firm but earns a low income. Fida studies Educational Sciences at a local university and hopes to find a job to help her husband when she completes her education.

Fida has requested a loan from FATEN to help her buy a new laptop for her studies. The computer will enable her to more easily complete her homework and write reports.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies.

loans.name: Kotankegne Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe kotankegne sont toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative  de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce des grains de riz. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 12ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Djelika (1ère femme assise à gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de grains de riz dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de grains de riz. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Madame Djelika espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   35 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour es frais de scolarisation des enfants et  augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four members of the Kotankegne group are married women who live in polygamous families. They average 41 years of age and four children each. They all live in the village of N’gara in the region of Ségou (4the administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship and marriage, and through the income-generating activities they conduct in the village. They work in small trade, selling rice.  

To bolster their working capital, the group members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. This is their 12th group loan. Mrs. Djelika (sitting first from the left) is a leading reseller of rice in the village of N’gara and adjacent areas. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of rice. She sells to a mixed clientele for cash, often on credit.  

With this loan, Mrs. Djelika expects to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 FCFA, which she will use to pay for her children’s tuition fees and to bolster her working capital.

loans.use: to buy rice for resale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 19-year-old single young man from Dier Al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. Mohammad's father works as an employee in a local firm, where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Humanitarian Science. He would like to finish his study and find a job to help his family in their expenses.

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily. 

Mohammad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is 40-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two children. 

Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market; this is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested to offer more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. 

Therefore, his wife, Razia, has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Razia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, solo estudió primer grado, su esposo trabaja en estructuras metálicas, tienen 4 hijos que actualmente están estudiando y los cuatro dependen de ellos.

 Ella tiene una tienda de productos básicos, la cual tiene 4 años de dedicarse a este negocio. Desde pequeña, le ha llamado mucho la atención el comercio, pues vendía con su mamá. Dicho negocio está ubicado en su casa en el cual colaboran todos los miembros de su familia.


La clienta necesita surtir más su tienda, ya que cuenta con bastante demanda de clientes, pues estos buscan a diario productos que ella no posee en su negocio, y es por ello que la señora María quiere satisfacer dicha necesidad de sus clientes. 

Ella espera que sus hijos aprendan bien este negocio, su sueño es apoyarles, para que el día de mañana sean personas preparadas, con éxito y profesionales.
Las ganancias serán invertidas para brindarle una vida merecedora a su familia.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old and only attended first grade. Her husband works making metal structures, and they have 4 children who are currently studying and are dependents. 

She has a general store, to which she has dedicated four years. Since childhood, she has paid much attention to commerce, selling with her mother. This business is located in her home in which all family members live. 


The client needs to fill her store because it has much demand from customers. She seeks necessities/general products that she does not have on your business, but she wants to meet her clients' needs.

She hopes that her children will learn from this business. Her dream is to support them so that they are prepared for the future, are successful and are professional. 
Proceeds will be invested to provide a deserving family life.

loans.use: to buy products for her store like drinks, toiletries, etc.

loans.name: Mirna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mirna es una mujer humilde que tiene 45 años de edad, solamente pudo estudiar hasta sexto grado pues sus padres eran muy pobres y ya no podían curbirle los gastos de la escuela, está casada y su esposo al igual que ella se dedidcan a la agricultura, tienen 4 hijos a los cuales con mucho esfuerzo y arduo trabajo, logró darles el apoyo para que estudiaran hasta la educación media.

Mujer trabajadora, son las palabras que definen a Mirna, ella tiene muchos conocimientos en la agricultura, ya que desde la edad de 10 años, acompañaba a sus padres a las algodoneras a trabajar, además sembraban yuca y maiz. 
Hoy en en día, ella siembra 2 hectáreas de maiz y también tiene 3 animales (bovinos) a los cuales cuida todo el tiempo y los lleva a los potreros para que se alimenten con pastos verdes.

El préstamo que ella está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita muchísimo para invertirlo en la produccion de 2 hectáreas de maiz, de esta manera podrá cancelar el alquiler del terreno, los gastos del trabajo del arado, comprar semillas, fertilizantes y hervsidas para el control de plagas.

Mirna tiene un gran sueño, tener un terreno propio donde cultivar y mantener su ganado además, tiene muchos deseos de superarse y aprender otro oficio como corte y confección y también el de panaderia.
texts.en:
Mirna is an unassuming 45-year-old woman. She could only complete her studies up to the sixth grade because her parents were very poor and couldn't afford the school costs. She's married and her husband works in agriculture, as does she. They have four children, and with a great deal of effort and hard work she succeeded in supporting them so they could complete high school.

A hardworking woman would be the words to define Mirna. She's very knowledgeable about agriculture, since at the age of 10 she already used to go out to work on the cotton crops alongside her parents. In addition, they grew yucca and corn.
Nowadays she grows two hectares of corn and she also owns three animals (cattle). She constantly tends to the animals and takes them out to the meadows so they can feed on green pastures.

The loan she's requesting from CrediCampo is very much needed, and she'll invest it in growing two hectares of corn. That way she'll be able to pay the rent on the farm land and pay for the ploughing costs. She'll also purchase seeds, fertilizer and herbicides for pest control.

Mirna has a big dream of owning her own plot of land where she can keep her cattle and sow. Besides, she has a great deal of drive to succeed and learn another trade such as dressmaking as well as baking.

loans.use: to pay the rent on the farm land, to pay for ploughing, and to purchase seeds, fertilizer and herbicides for growing corn.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo lives in Totolapan with his wife Petra and their two children. The house they live in is the hard work and savings of almost 5 years. They thought not having a proper cement floor as well as proper doors and windows wouldn't be a problem, but after these years they now know that winters can be very cold and summers very hot without these things. They have also seen that their youngest son has developed respiratory diseases and has a lot of trouble to breathe normally during winter. Eduardo works with livestock and makes around USD $500 a month. He has been saving for the last couple of months but is asking for a loan to finish buying the materials he needs to install a proper floor, doors and windows to his house. Eduardo's job is informal with no way of proving his income, so accessing credit is a challenge. Eduardo will work in the house and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets the quality and safety standards. Eduardo and Petra look forward to the day their kids can play on the floor and they can lock the doors at night.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish the floor of the house

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en: Maribel lives with his husband Luis, their three kids in Totolapan. Luis works in the field growing corn and Maribel sells pizza at a stand in the local market. Recently Luis's parents came to live with them since they are getting old and living alone is not only expensive but also dangerous. Maribel is happy to have them home because she knows they will be taken care of. Luis and Maribel built a room for them to move in but soon they ran out of money and materials. They have been saving to complete the work and install proper doors so they can move out from the kids room and into their own. Moving like that would be a mistake because her in-laws' health could worsen under these conditions. To finish buying the materials they are asking for a loan so they can complete the work. Since Maribel and Luis make around USD $450 through informal jobs, they do not have access to credit. Once they buy the materials Luis will help finish the construction and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets quality and safety standard. Maribel and Luis are excited to give Luis's parents a comfortable and easier life.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building bedroom and install doors

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en: Aurea is a hard working mother of three. She bakes and sells sweets and desserts at the local market. She has always been well known for her cooking and a couple of years ago when things started getting tight at home she decided to launch her business. Jeronimo, her husband, works as farmer. Aurea's oldest son is 20 years old know and sharing a room and a bed with her teenage sister has become a problem. Aurea has been working hard and saving her money to build a new room where the bed they bought would fit and the two boys can sleep there. Since Aurea and Jeronimo have no formal jobs, getting credit is a problem. Aurea is asking for a loan to finish buying the materials she needs to build the bedroom. Her son and husband will work on the construction and a certified technician will supervise the work to make sure it meets the quality and safety standards. Aurea is excited because this will be the first tangible contribution she makes to her house all from her own work and money, she contributes with everything but this will be a first for her.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a bedroom for her oldest son

loans.name: Rocky John

texts.en: Rocky John is a 26 -year old college undergraduate living in a rural village in Pulupandan. He is single and the eldest of 4 siblings. Two of his younger sisters are studying at the local town high school. Rocky’s father is a fisherman earning an average monthly income of Php 1,500.00 ($33), his mother stays in the house to take care of their household needs. Rocky used to be a working student. He was a helper at one of the retail stores and was earning a monthly income Php 3,000.00 ($66.) This lack of resources has motivated Rocky to find means to increase his income, so he underwent the selection process of BagoSphere and passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Your help in funding his loan will help Rocky have a better income and help his family send his sisters to school.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Elias

texts.es: Elías mayor de edad casado,  y propietario de una sorbeteria, el cual él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sorbetes de leche con sabores como: galleta, vainilla, banano, piña, ron con pasas, caramelo y otros; desde muy temprano el realiza su jornada de  trabajo de manera ambulante sale a ofrecer su producto a diferentes lugares, repartos y barrios del municipio de  Chinandega. El inicio el negocio por iniciativa propia desde hace más de veinte años, él es un hombre trabajador con deseos de superación y de esa forma sacar adelante a su familia. Él solicita el préstamo para invertir en su negocio en la compra de materia prima de insumo como: vainilla, azúcar,  galletas entre otros y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Elías agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas Kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en: Elías is a grown, married man, and the owner of a sorbet shop in which he makes and sells milk sorbets in flavors like cookies, vanilla, banana, pineapple, rum raisin, caramel, and others. He starts his work day very early by going door-to-door to offer his product in different places and neighborhoods in the city of Chinandega. He started the business by his own initiative  more than twenty years ago. He is a very hardworking man with dreams of succeeding and supporting his family. He is requesting this loan to invest in his business for purchasing raw materials like vanilla, sugar, cookies, among others, so that he can offer better service to his customers. Elías appreciates the help that Kiva lenders offer to people with scarce resources, and poor countries like Nicaragua, to have opportunities to work.

loans.use: to buy supplies for making sorbet like milk, vanilla, sugar, cookies, among other things.

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouman sont mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République  du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments et de grains. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 6ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Oumou (1ère femme assise à gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments de toute sortes dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de condiments de tout genre. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à domicile et en ambulant  à une clientèle composée majoritairement  de femmes. Madame Oumou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de   38 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé dans la prise en charge des besoins des enfants et pour augmenter son fonds de commerce.
texts.en: The four women of the Sabougnouman group are married and live in polygamous households. They are on average 42 years old and have four children. They all live in the N’gara village in the Ségou region (4th administrative region in the republic of Mali). They know each other through connections between neighbors, family, and marriage, as well as through their businesses in the village. They are in the small business of seasonings and grains. In the goal of increasing their business funds, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their sixth group loan. Mrs. Oumou (first woman seated on the left) is a big seller of all sorts of seasonings in the N’gara village and its surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy a large quantity of all kinds of seasonings. She sells for cash and often for credit from home and traveling to a clientele composed mostly of women. Mrs. Oumou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 38,000 FCFA with this loan, which will be used to pay for the needs of her children and to increase her business funds.

loans.use: to buy seasonings

loans.name: María Florentina

texts.es:
María de 51 años de edad, lastimosamente solo estudió hasta sexto grado, ella es viuda ya que su esposo falleció recientemente, tiene dos hijos que están en Estados Unidos, y dos que actualmente viven con ella. La señora manifiesta que los 2 hijos que viven con ella, la apoyan en los quehaceres de la casa y del campo.


Ella se dedica a la crianza de gallinas indias,  para luego venderlas cuando estén lo suficientemente grandes, además vende huevos que también es resultado de dicha crianza.  
Este trabajo lo heredó de su madre, pues fue algo que le enseñó desde muy pequeña.

El crédito  lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos de engorde, ya que su sueño es venderlos a muy buen precio cuando estén grandes y de esta manera lograr mejores ingresos y ofrecerles una vida mejor su familia.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and unfortunately has only studied up until the 6th grade. She is older, and her husband died recently. She has two children that are in the United States and two that actually live with her. She said that the two that live with her help her with chores and in the field.

She works breeding cornish hens to later sell when they are big enough. She also serve eggs that result from her breeding. She learned this work from her mother, so she has done this since she was young.

She now seeks a loan to help her buy pigs to fatten. It is her dream to sell them at a good price when they are big in order to provide her with a better income and to allow her provide a better life to her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Smail

texts.en: Smail known under the name of "Pastor Smail." He is the minister of a local church in a small community named "Fond Blanc" about 2 hours from Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti. He is also the school principal of a school within the community. In this community there is no access to electricity so the people use "lamp tèt gridap, candles, etc," which are not good for their health. Pastor Smail realizes that the Eneji Pwop products are not only better for the people's health, but also save the people money. So he wants to help his community by selling the Eneji Pwop products (Lanp Eneji Pwop, Powapak, Sunking Pro & Recho Gaz blan), but he also will improve his economic situation.

loans.use: To sell solar systems to his teachers and the community he lives in (Fond Blanc)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Elton John

texts.en:
Elton John is an 18-year old high school graduate and lives in a rural village in Bago City. He belongs to a family of five. His father is a fisherman and his mother is a housewife. Elton has 2 siblings, and all of them are studying at the local school.

Their total monthly family income is Php 2,000.00 ($44) and this poverty has forced Elton to stop school and instead help his aunt sell vegetables in the city’s market. Elton John is motivated by his situation to find means to help the family have more income that’s why he took the step in undergoing the selection process of BagoSphere. He passed it to qualify for the 2-month training program that could lead to a call center job. 

Apart from helping his family, Elton John also dreams of having his own variety store and barber shop once he saves up enough money from being a call center agent. Your generosity in funding his loan will help Elton john have a better income soon.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Maila Jean

texts.en:
Maila Jean is a 24-year old high school graduate and single mother living in a rural village in Bago City. She belongs to a family of six.Her stepfather is a motorcycle mechanic and her mother sells packed snacks in schools. Maila has three siblings. Her two brothers drive pedicabs and help in providing basic needs of the family while another sibling is still in high school.

Maila Jean is currently working for a telecommunications company as a sales agent earning Php 4,200.00 ($93) per month, but this income is only enough for her personal needs. Maila Jean’s short term goal is to become a call center agent and earn enough money to provide for her family’s basic needs, and she believes that training in BagoSphere might make her realize this goal

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get her a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Eberto Antonio

texts.es: El señor Eberto es un hombre visionario preocupado por el desarrollo de su familia y de los niños a los que le brinda el pan de la enseñanza, ya que él es maestro de educación primaria con 12 años de ejercer dicha profesión, tiene un relación estable con 3 hijos a los que le está brindando todo el apoyo , actualmente está presentando  unas necesidades que solo con ayuda del financiamiento oportuno puede resolver, por eso visito la oficina de ceprodel para ser beneficiado y lo utilizaría  en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como: bloques, cemento, hierro, arena, piedrín, tablas, clavos, zinc, golosos y pago de mano de obra agradeciéndole a ceprodel por la oportunidad de lograr su sueño.
texts.en:
Eberto is a visionary man, concerned with the development of his family and the children to whom he offers the gift of education, as he is a primary school teacher with 12 years experience. He is in a stable relationship with three children who he gives all his support to. 

Currently he has some necessities that only the help of a loan can resolve, and this is why he visited CEPRODEL’s office, to take out a loan. He will use it to purchase building materials such as blocks, cement, iron, sand, gravel, boards, nails, zinc, bolts and payment for the manual labor.

He is thankful to CEPRODEL for the opportunity to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement, iron, sand and nails.

loans.name: Argentina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Argentina es una señora soltera, no tiene hijos a su cargo porque ya son independientes, se desempeña como  maestra de educación primaria, con 20 años de ejercer esta profesión. Con este crédito es el numero 7 y a través de estos créditos ha venido mejorando su vivienda.
 
Actualmente esta señora tiene una necesidad de construir  un cuarto y por tal razón  se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el cual lo utilizara en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como hierro de 3/8, hierro de ¼, perlines 4x2, perlines de 3x1, bloques, cemento, zinc y pago de mano de obra. Agradeciéndole a Ceprodel por el apoyo que le ha brindado cuando más lo necesita
texts.en:
Argentina is a single lady with no children in her care because they are all now independent. She is a primary school teacher with 20 years of experience. This will be her seventh loan; through these loans she has been improving her home and educating her children. 

She currently needs to build a room and for this reason she went to the office of CEPRODEL to request a loan, which she will use to purchase building materials, such as 3/8ʺ rebar, ¼ʺ rebar, 4x2 purlins, 3x1 purlins, cinder blocks, cement, and corrugated iron, as well as to pay for labour. She is grateful to CEPRODEL for the support they have given her when she most needed it.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as 3/8" rebar, 1/4" rebar, 4x2 purlins, 3x1 purlins, cinder clocks, cement, and corrugated iron, and pay for labour

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Les huit  femmes du groupe Sebeke sont toutes mariées dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative  de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce d’oignons, de sel et des grains riz. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Massitan (1 ère  assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’oignons et sel dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité d’oignons et de sel de cuisine pour la grande satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La revente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit à une clientèle mixte.
Madame Massitan espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  9 500 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et également pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et aider souvent son mari.
texts.en:
The eight women of the Sebeka group are all married in polygamous households. They are on average 38 years old with 4 children each. All of the women live in the village of N'gara in the Ségou region (the 4th administrative region of Mali) and came to know each other through neighbors, relatives, marriage, and through their businesses in the village.

The women are in the business of selling onions, salt, and rice. In order to increase their business capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth group loan.

Massitan (the first woman sitting from left to right in the photo) is a large reseller of onions and salt in the village of N'gara and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of onions and cooking salt to meet her customers' needs. She makes her sales for cash and also often for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women.

Massitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 9,500 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use for her children's education costs and also to increase her business capital and often to help out her husband.

loans.use: to purchase onions and cooking salt

loans.name: Union De Trabajadores Group

texts.es: Grupo formado por tres socias emprendedora, una de ella es Maria tiene 45 años de edad, soltera, tiene 4 años de vender cosméticos de diferentes marcas, ella misma atiende el negocio, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de cosméticos tales como shampoo, maquillajes, cremas faciales, cremas para el cuerpo, perfumen de dama, perfumen de varón, colonias etc. Ileana es otra socia de 38 años su negocio es la venta de ropa usada y Aura tiene 53 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de ropa usada también.
texts.en:
The group is made up of three enterprising members, one of whom is Maria, 45.  She's single and has been selling different brands of cosmetics for four years.  She looks after the business herself.

Maria will invest the loan in buying cosmetics such as shampoo, make-up, face cream, body lotion, women's perfume, men's perfume, cologne, etc.

Another member, Ileana, is 38 years old and sells used clothing. Aura, 53, also sells used clothing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Fida

texts.en:
Fida is a 23-year-old single lady from Jenin city. She lives with her family in a small simple house. Her father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. Fida is a student at a local university where she studies Geography Sciences. She would like to finish her studies and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses

Fida took a USD loan from FATEN to help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Fida will be able to finish her studies and earn her BA degree. 

Fida appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay university fees for this semester.

loans.name: Heidy

texts.es: Heidy, tiene la edad  de 32 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. El con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de ropa y artículos personales para abastecer de productos nuevos y variados para que los clientes tengan varias alternativas de escoger artículos para comprar, y de esta manera poderle ofreces a los clientes una mayor cantidad de productos para el uso de toda la familia. Con esta compra pretende tener mejores ingresos para invertir más en su negocio y cumplir algunas metas que en el futuro le mejorará su calidad de vida para ella y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Heidy is 32-years old.  She is married and lives with her husband and children, who are her first priority.  With the loan, she plans to purchase clothing and personal items to stock up her business with new and varied products.  Her customers will then have various alternatives to choose from for their purchases, and she will be able to offer her customers more products for the whole family.  With her purchase, Heidy plans to earn a greater income, to invest more in her business and meet some goals that will, in the future, improve her quality of life and that of her family.  This is the first loan that Heidy has received from FUDECOSUR.  She had never before taken out a loan from a state bank, but FUDECOSUR offered her the loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to sell clothing.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Les six  femmes du groupe Tiessiri vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 50 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de N’gara dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce de condiments de grains et de la restauration. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 9ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Mayama (1ère femme assise devant à droite dans la photo) est une restauratrice dans le village de N’gara et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter une grande quantité de riz qui sera transformé en galette. La revente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Mayama espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  37 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The six women of the Tiessiri group all live in polygamous families. They are on average 50 years old with 5 children each. They all live in the village of N'gara in the Ségou region (the fourth administrative region of Mali) and came to know each other through neighbors, relatives, marriage, and through their businesses in the village.

The women are in the business of selling spices, grains, and catered foods. In order to increase their business capital, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 9th group loan cycle. 

Mayama (the first woman sitting in front, from left to right in the photo) is a caterer in the village of N'gara and its surroundings. She plans to use her loan to purchase a large quantity of rice which she will turn into pastries. She resells these for cash and often for credit to a customer base made up of both men and women. Mayama hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 37,000 francs CFA with this loan, which she will use to pay for her children's education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 54-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 19 to 26 years old. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a shoe repair business. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a busy place and his primary customers are walk-ins and permanent customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of purchasing repair materials. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy threads, leather and other shoe repair materials. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy threads, leather and other shoe repair materials

loans.name: María Celestina

texts.es:
Celestina de 55 años de edad,  es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora a pesar que solo estudio hasta segundo grado debido a la falta de recursos económicos de su familia,  ella ha podido salir adelante está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y el cuido de ganado ella junto a su esposo procrearon 7 hijos;  pero a los doce años una hija falleció, fue un golpe muy duro para ellos pero han sabido superarlo, actualmente solo viven dos hijos con ellos que son quienes les ayudan en el trabajo de cultivar la tierra y el cuido del ganado,  ya que los demás formaron sus propias familias.

Ella se dedica al cuido y cría de ganado prácticamente toda su vida,  ya que sus padres también tenían este habito  y ella lo aprendió,  vende los productos que saca como cuajada y leche con esto ella tiene una pequeña ganancia. Celestina también se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 20 años,  ella comenzó trabajando este negocio debido a que el esposo tubo una enfermedad y no podía trabajar como era habitual esto le género que ella buscara la forma de obtener un ingreso extra para su familia y fue así como inicio con el negocio el cual le ha dejado muy buenos ingresos y ella aun a pesar de su edad sigue ejerciéndolo para tener un ingreso a su familia que le ayude a salir adelante con los gastos, ella hace los tamales en su casa y sale a vender por la tarde ya que es muy reconocida en la zona. 

Con el crédito ella comprara una vaca y el alimento para ella así como para las demás, ya que hoy que su hijo menor ha salido de estudiar considera que tiene más tiempo,  para dedicarse más de lleno a trabajar y poder regresarles a sus padres mucho del esfuerzo que ellos han realizado a lo largo de su vida.  Su vida mejorara grandemente ya que con la compra del nuevo semoviente,  reportaran un ingreso más con la venta de los productos que salgan. así como también aprovecharan la temporada que el ganado se lo venden barato esto le generara tener un poco más de ahorro.

Su principal sueño a futuro es poder tener más ganado y que sus hijos terminen de formarse académicamente, así como que formen sus propias familias, con la ayuda del crédito ella considera que puede tener más ganancias y salir adelante con todos los compromisos que como madre y familia tiene con ellos y en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Celestina is 55 years old. She is a determined and enterprising woman. Despite the fact that she only studied through the second grade due to her family's lack of economic resources, she has been able to support herself. She is married, and her husband works in agriculture, raising cattle. She and her husband had seven children, but one of their daughters passed away at twelve years old. That was a very tough blow for them, but they have managed to move on. Only two of their children currently live with them; they are the ones who help with the farming and livestock work, since the others have started their own families.

Celestina has worked in raising and caring for livestock practically all her life, as it was her parents' livelihood as well, and she learned it. She sells the goods that she produces, like "cuajada" [a soft fresh cheese] and milk, so she has a small income. 

Celestina has also worked selling tamales for twenty years. She started working in that business when her husband became ill and couldn't work like he usually did. This led to her looking for a way of obtaining extra income for her family; that's how she started the business, which has given her a very good income. In spite of her age, she still continues running this business to have income for her family that helps her stay on top of expenses. She makes the tamales at her house and goes out selling in the afternoon, as she is very well-known in the area.

With this loan, she will buy a cow and feed for all her cattle, since now that her youngest son has finished school she feels that she has more time to dedicate herself more fully to this work; then she will be able to give back to her parents much of the effort that they have put in throughout her life. Her life will improve greatly because with the purchase of new livestock, they will have more income from the sale of the goods they produce. They will also take advantage of this season, as cattle are sold cheaper; that will allow her to save a little more.

Her main dream for the future is to be able to have more livestock and for her children to finish their educations so that they can form their own families. With the help of the loan, she thinks that she will have more earnings and will be able to take care of all the commitments she has as a mother with her family and in the community.

loans.use: to buy a cow and cattle feed.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 23-year-old single young man from Deir al-Balah city. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. Yousef's brother works as a teacher in the public sector and earns a low salary. This is the only source of income for the family. Yousef is a student at a local university where he studies Elementary Education.

Yousef took a USD loan from FATEN to help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Yousef will be able to do his homework and write his reports easily.
 
Yousef appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Yeredon Group

texts.fr:
Les six femmes du groupe Yeredon vivent toutes dans des familles polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Massala dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la Républiques du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, de mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le village. Elles font le petit commerce d’habillement, de restauration et de produit cosmétique. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 4ème cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Bintou (2ème femme debout  de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’habillements dans le village de Massala et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 pièces de wax pour la satisfaction de la demande clientèle. La vente se fait au comptant  et souvent à crédit une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Bintou espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de  36 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour  des frais de scolarisation de ses enfants et augmenter également son fonds de commerce et aider souvent son mari.
texts.en:
The six members of the Yeredon group are women who live in polygamous families. They average 45 years of age and five children each. They all live in the village of Massala, in the region of Ségou (4th administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

They know one another as neighbors, through ties of kinship and marriage, and through the income-generating activities they conduct in the village. As a group, they sell clothing and cosmetic products, and they provide restaurant services. 

To bolster their working capital, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance organization. This is their 4th group loan.

Mrs. Bintou, standing 2nd from the right, is a leading reseller of clothing in Massala and surrounding areas. She plans to use her loan to buy 5 pieces of wax pagnes to meet customer demand. She sells to a mixed clientele for cash, though often on credit.  

With this loan, Mrs. Bintou expects to earn an average monthly profit of 36,000 FCFA. She will use this profit to cover her children’s tuition fees, to bolster her working capital, and to help her husband.

loans.use: to buy wax pagnes.

loans.name: Aurora  De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Aurora de 55 años de edad, soltera con un hijo menor de edad, es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar estudios básicos por falta de recursos económicos,  en la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarle un fuero mejor a su hijo.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  vta de cosméticos, como rubor, sombra de ojos, lápiz labial, lápiz de ojos, crema desmaquilladora, vanidad, perfumes, body. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación y ambulante. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 8 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de cosméticos para que en un futuro obtener mejores ingresos. Aurora agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un  medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Aurora is 55 years old, is single and has a young son. She is a native of Leon located in the west of the country. She is hard-working, responsible and wants to improve herself. Unfortunately she could not finish her basic studies due to lack of financial resources. Currently she struggles day to day to provide a better future for her son.Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead she works selling cosmetics like rouge, eye shadow, lipstick, eyeliner, cleansing cream, cases, perfume and body cream. She sells from her house and door-to-door. She works 8 hours a day offering her product. 

The aim of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store purchasing cosmetic products so she can obtain more revenue in the future. Aurora thanks the lenders at Kiva who offer support to people of low resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have dignified work.

loans.use: to invest in stocking her business buying cosmetics like rouge, eye shadow, lipstick, eyeliner, cleansing cream, cases, perfume and body cream.

loans.name: Siriam

texts.es: Siriam vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que se dedica a la impresion de documentos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar papel y tinta, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Siriam lives in the city of Cusco, which is in southern Peru. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who produces printed documents. Siriam has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy paper and ink. Siriam is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy paper and ink.

loans.name: G.s La Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El g.s. La Fortaleza está conformada por tres, mujeres, madres solteras con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son  originarias de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal.  Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar para ayudar a sus familias con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la cordinadora es Ada y tiene por actividad económica  la venta de gaseosas de lata de botella, fanta coca cola, mirinda, uva, fresca. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, de forma ambulante, ella recorres las calles de su comunidad ayudada con un carretón y un termo donde lleva las gaseosas.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de gaseosas, bolsas, hielo, pajillas para la venta del producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  El g.s. la fortaleza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The La Fortaleza communal bank is comprised of three women.  They are single mothers with seven children under their care.  They are from Leon, which is in the western part of the country.  They are known for being hard-working and responsible women with the desire for personal improvement.  Sadly, due to lack of financial resources, they could not go to school.  They needed to work in order to help their families with the household expenses.

The coordinator of the group is Ada. Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, she sells soft drinks.  She spends ten hours a day in her business selling her product in an itinerant manner.  She travels the streets of her community, and her cart and thermos help her transport her soft drinks in tin cans like Fanta, Coke, Mirinda, grape juice, and Fresca.

The objective of the loan is to have working capital in order to stock her business.  She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, bags, ice, and straws in order to sell her products.  She will do this in order to be able to get better income in the not so distant future.

The La Fortaleza communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people with scarce resource in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have a decent way of working.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soft drinks, bags, ice, and straws

loans.name: Sugey

texts.es:
Sugey
Puntarenas


	Sugey tiene 33 años y vive con sus hermanos y su padrastro,  Se presenta como una persona trabajadora, responsable y con metas trazadas, ante la muerte de su madre, ella se ha responsabilizado por la educación de su hermano menor, apoyando así a su padrastro quien trabaja de día en el comercio y en la noche se dedican a atender el negocio familiar, que es una venta de comidas rápidas.

	 La clienta  es independiente y tiene su negocio de comercio vendiendo perfumes, ropa y además administra  una oficina de pago de servicios y recarga de celulares. Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio, crecer y tener distribución de productos por toda la zona de Puntarenas. 

	Inició en el comercio con un préstamo de la empresa Cruz de Amor (quien la recomienda como una excelente vendedora), al ir adquiriendo capital ha mantenido su negocio y diversificando sus actividades, después de la muerte de su madre, su tía le ha apoyado y ha aumentado su clientela en la zona. También es recomendada por una de las integrantes del Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas quien es clienta de la solicitante.

 	La actividad cuenta con una clientela fija, tiene recuperación semanal en lo que respecta a la ropa y perfumes, y diaria con el pago de servicios, que le ha venido a contribuir más para el apoyo a la familia. 


	Tiene experiencia en la actividad y una clientela consolidada que ha depurado en sus 2 años de trabajo, ofrece mercadería de moda y uno de sus proveedores la refiere como una de las mejores vendedoras. Apoya a su familia (educación de hermanastro) y busca la forma de diversificar y ofrecer otros servicios que le generen ingresos para el núcleo familiar. Inclusive en la noche labora en la soda de su padrastro y comercializa gaseosas que es un negocio muy común en Puntarenas.

La solicitante presenta muy buenas referencias, su negocio le permite apoyar  a su familia, después del fallecimiento de su madre. Los vecinos y familiares reconocen su esfuerzo Cliente con perspectiva de crecimiento y buenos antecedentes de trabajo y responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Sugey 
Puntarenas 
 

Sugey, a 33 year old woman, lives with her brothers and stepfather, and is a hardworking and responsible person with set goals. Since the death of her mother, she has been responsible for the education of her younger brother and for supporting her stepfather, who works in the trade day and night and is dedicated to serving the family business, selling fast foods.

She is independent, and her trading business sells perfumes and clothes. She also manages an office for the payment of services and recharging cell phones. Her dream is to keep building her business, expand it and distribute products throughout the Puntarenas region. 

She started her business with a loan from the Cross of Love company (who endorses her as an excellent seller), and, after acquiring capital, has maintained the business and diversified her activities after the death of her mother. Her aunt has supported her and has increased her customer base in the area. She is also recommended by one of the members of the Bank Women Growing Together client who is the applicant. The activity has a steady clientele, has weekly recovery with respect to clothing and perfumes, and the daily service charge, which has come to her to contribute more to support the family. 

Her experience in the business as an established clientele has refined in its 3 years of work, offers fashion merchandise and one of its suppliers referred to as one of the top sellers. She and her family (brother specifically) seeks ways to diversify and offer other services that will generate income for the family. Even at night she works in her stepfather´s markets and is very common doing business in Puntarenas. 

The applicant has very good references, her business allows her to support her family after the death of her mother. Neighbors and relatives recognize her efforts with customer growth perspective and a good record of work and responsibility.

loans.use: To buy perfume, clothing and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Shama

texts.en:
Shama, age 49, is a mother of six children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery materials to resell. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that reason, his wife Shama is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. Shama is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase an embroidery machine and embroidery materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials.

loans.name: Rana Nasir

texts.en:
Rana Nasir is age 38, a young and energetic man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He has been working in this business for many years and generating income for his family. His sibling is too young, and his father has grown old and does not do any job. His efforts are for providing comfort to his parents and sibling as well.

He is a milkman by profession; he sells milk in his community and bull calves to the butcher. He has few buffalo, and he produces milk two times in a day. He delivers milk in the market and door-to-door. For delivery purposes, he uses his motorbike. He loads milk cans on his bike and delivers them early in the morning. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he delivers. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs. Therefore, Rana Nasir has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that he would be able to buy an additional buffalo for getting more milk to sell.

Rana Nasir wants to increase his herd by purchasing more buffalo so that he can care for his whole family well. Rana Nasir thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy an additional buffalo for producing milk.

loans.name: Hayrapet

texts.ru:
Hayrapet is 29 years old and he lives in the village Nor Astghaberd in Syunik region. Hayrapet is seeking for his second Kiva loan. His first Kiva loan he needed for making the repayment of his tuition fee. Hayrapet is married and he has a one year old son.
