Both Hayrapet and his wife are still students of Goris State University at the paid division. His wife unlike Hayrapet does not manage to work simultaneously since she takes care of their son. Hayrapet works as a locksmith.  Of course he does his best to support his young family with good living conditions, but soon it is time to pay for their education and it is really a great hardship for him.
Hayrapet asks a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams in order to pay for his and his wife’s tuition fees for the second semester.
texts.en:
Hayrapet is 29 years old and he lives in the village of Nor Astghaberd in the Syunik region. Hayrapet is seeking his second Kiva loan. He used his first Kiva loan to repay his tuition fee. 

Hayrapet is married, and he has a one-year-old son. Both Hayrapet and his wife are still students at Goris State University at the paid division. 

His wife, unlike Hayrapet, does not work simultaneously since she takes care of their son. Hayrapet works as a locksmith.  Of course he does his best to support his young family with good living conditions, but soon it will be time to pay for their education, and it is really a great hardship for him.

Hayrapet asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to pay for his and his wife’s tuition fees for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay for his and his wife’s tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Melissa

texts.en:
Melissa is 26 years old, and from Panglao, Bohol. She has two children, ages seven and nine. 

For three years now, she and her partner have been operating a transportation business using her motorcycle (called "habal-habal"). Habal-habal is  commonly used by people to reach remote places not accessible by bus, or if passengers are in a hurry. Melissa usually earns 9,000 PHP per month from this business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, a spare tire, and to pay for vulcanizing of her motorcycle. 

She hopes that in the future, she will have other businesses to uplift her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice, a spare tire and to pay for vulcanizing

loans.name: Las Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS VENCEDORAS” iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Valeria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido a máquina, costura de pantalones, tejido de mantas, servicio de amplificación, tejedoras de chompas, artesanos, limpieza, venta de pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Valeria es integrante, ella indica que es el cuarto año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de mantas; da a conocer que estos negocios los emprendió hace veinte años empezando con poco capital y de forma ambulante en la ferias de la ciudad de El Alto poco a poco logro establecer un capital amplio más su puesto de venta. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de tejer) que adquirirá de las tiendas y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar, ya que ella tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de salud y crédito que le ofrecen en la institución.

En la imagen se observa a dos personas ausentes ya que se fueron a consulta médica
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Las Vencedoras” (The Winners) is starting its sixth loan cycle as part of the Panamericana Community Center. This group consists of 10 members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Valeria serves as the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as producing knitted products with the use of a machine, producing trousers, weaving blankets, providing disk jockey services, knitting sweaters, making handicrafts, providing cleaning services, and selling trousers.

This loan will benefit small businesspeople such as Sra. Valeria. She says that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter of the organization who came to visit her at her house. Valeria currently has a business of selling blankets. She has become more knowledgeable about her business since she started it 20 years ago with a small amount of capital. Valeria began selling as a traveling vendor at the fairs in the city of El Alto and gradually built up more capital so that she could acquire a vending stall.

The loan she is requesting now will be used to increase her capital for buying a knitting machine. She will acquire this piece of equipment at a store and then use it to make the products she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for sustaining her household. Valeria has five children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Valeria said that she enjoys the training seminars about health and credit that are offered by the organization. In the photo, there are two people who were absent because they had medical appointments.

loans.use: to buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food products, such as rice, oil, carbonated beverages, and sweets.

loans.name: G.s. Unidas En Cristo Group

texts.es:
El g.s Unidas en Cristo, está conformado por tres integrantes dos mujeres y un hombre,  madres y padres jefes de familia que en la actualidad tienen a nietos menores de edad  bajo sus responsabilidad. Estas personas son originarias del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Ellos se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente  y por las condiciones de vidas,  y el bajo nivel económico en el que Vivian no les permitió estudiar, y tal situación los comprometió a trabajar desde muy temprana edad para ayudar a sus familias con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus nietos  y proporcionarles mejores condición de vida, y sobre todos fórmalos profesionalmente.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es  Santos  de este G.S. tiene por actividad económica la venta de ropa de segunda mano como: pantalones, jeans, faldas, blusas, short, ropa de cama, ropa de niño. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. EL negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es surtir su negocio con unas pacas de ropa de segunda mano de buena calidad, y de esa forma brindarle un buen servicio a sus clientela, y a la vez en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. G.S. Unidas en Cristo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y  países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Unidas en Cristo" communal bank is composed of 3 members, two women and one man. All of them are heads of families with young grandchildren under their responsibility. They are natives of Sauce, a place in the north of the country. They are hard-working responsible and want to get ahead. Unfortunately due to their living conditions and low economic situation they couldn't study so they had to work from a very early age to help their families with the household expenses. Today they struggle day to day to offer a better future to their grandchildren, give them better living conditions and help them become professionals.

Thanks to her effort and desire to progress Santos is the coordinator of the group. She sells second hand clothing  like pants, jeans, skirts, blouses, shorts, bedding and children's clothes. She spends 10 hours a day selling her product. Her business is located in her home. The aim of the loan is to stock her business with a few bales of good quality used clothing, in this way providing good service to her clients and in the near future she can generate more revenue. The "Unidas en Cristo" communal bank is grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders who help people of low resources and poor countries like Nicaragua to enjoy dignified work.

loans.use: to stock her business with second hand clothes like pants, jeans, skirts, blouses, shorts, bedding and children's clothes.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es:
Viviana es una mujer con 27 años de edad, casada y madre de dos niños. Vive en una comunidad rural pero sobre la carretera principal. Es muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. Su esposo trabaja como chofer recibiendo un salario mínimo. Debido a ésto ella tiene la actividad principal de hacer repostería y salir a vender a su comunidad sin descuidar a su familia.  Su plan de inversión es comprar materia prima como harinas, frutas y más para hacer su repostería y también pollos y cerdos para criar y luego vender, con el fin de ayudar en su hogar a los gastos familiares, ya que uno de sus hijos está cursando la primaria y ella de los ingresos de su negocio le da para los gastos escolares. Cuenta con varias actividades para que en las temporadas bajas de la repostería, siempre tenga ingresos para ayudar a su familia y poder hacer frente al financiamiento otorgado por tercera vez por la Fundación. Cuenta con el apoyo de un hijo y esposo para el cuido de los animales en los tiempos libres. Su meta es superarse, crecer y mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y la de su familia.
Viviana, Rosa, Doris, Marcia, Emilce y Marjorie son las 6 socias que conforman el banco mujer y van a invertir an diferentes actividades tales como hacer repostería, criar pollos y cerdos.
texts.en:
Viviana is a 27-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of two children.  She lives in a rural community, but on the main road.  She is very hardworking and dedicated to her family.  Her husband works as a chauffeur and earns minimum wage.  Because of that, her main business is pastry-making and going out into her community to sell without neglecting her family.  Her plan is to buy raw materials like flour, fruit, and other things to make her pastries and also chickens and pigs to raise and later sell in order to help out with the family expenses, as one of her children is in primary school and she provides for his school expenses from her income.  She has several businesses so that when her pastry-making business is slow she always has income to help her family and be able to meet her third financial obligation with the Foundation.  She has the help of one son and her husband, who care for the animals during their free time.  Her goal is to better herself, grow, and improve living conditions for herself and for her family.  

Viviana, Rosa, Doris, Marcia, Emilce, and Marjorie are the six members who make up Banco Mujer and they are going to invest in different businesses, such as pastry making and pig and chicken raising.

loans.use: to buy flour, fruits, and raisins to make pastries and also pigs and chickens to raise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
When Mary’s son was diagnosed with a developmental disorder, she had a hard time finding the right training for him through the Department of Rehabilitation. The government training just seemed too standardized and incongruent with the unique learning styles of the individuals who were seeking rehab treatment. She decided to utilize her background in education and entrepreneurship to start a business that could be used as a platform for training people with developmental disabilities.

Mary created "Cobblestone Foods" by combining her love for her son with her passion for organic, healthy and top-quality foods. Inspired by recipes from her aunt, an organic farmer in Northern California, Mary began producing nutritious ready-made soups – perfect for those with health challenges such as diabetes and child obesity. She hired her son as a part-time employee to help cook, manage the farmers’ market, and help with bookkeeping. This not only gave her son real-life work experience but also helped him become a productive member of society.

Cutting back on her job as a teacher to develop Cobblestone Foods, Mary needed to seek out financing to help fund her endeavor. This loan of $5,000 from Kiva will be used to perform High Pressure Processing (HPP) testing to test the longevity of the product as well as to allow Mary to seek out non-GMO certification, giving customers assurance that no GMO (genetically modified organism) ingredients were used to make her delicious soups. Both the HPP testing and GMO certification will positively affect the production and overall image of the company, therefore, increasing sales. 

In the future, Mary wants to be able to train and employ more people with developmental disabilities. She hopes to provide them with training through personable lessons and interactions. One of her life mottos is “All boats float,” meaning that if we all help one another, everyone can succeed. 

Interested in trying some of Mary’s delicious soups? Purchase online at: www.cobblestonesoups.com

loans.use: to perform high pressure processing testing and receive non-genetically modified organism testing

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is aged 58, married to a carpenter, and blessed with eight children. She has been cooking and selling rice cakes in their village for almost fifteen years and earning a net income of 675 PHP daily. Her net profits are usually spent on their daily food expenses. Due to lack of capital she would like to obtain a loan of 11,000 PHP to purchase sugar, cooking oil, and coconut to use for rice cake vending. She is hoping that her business will continue to grow and earn more income.

loans.use: To purchase sugar, cooking oil and coconut to use for rice cake vending.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años de edad, solo alcanzó a estudiar hasta tercer grado en la escuela, actualmente está casada y su esposo es jornalero, tiene 4 hijos y dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando quinto grado y  kínder, nadie más vive con ellos.

Desde hace dos, Ana se ha dedicado al destazo de animales, trabajo que aprendió de su pareja, el trabajo lo hace un su casa en un periodo de 8 ó 15 días y se levanta desde muy temprano para llevarlo a cabo. 

Este crédito le será de mucha ayuda a Ana, pues lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y terneras, para reproducirlas y destazarlas cuando estén grandes. 

Entre los objetivos que ella tiene están, ver a sus hijos convertirse en excelentes profesionales, que el negocio siga creciendo para percibir mayores ingresos, además cubrir las necesidades básicas del hogar y por supuesto, pagar el préstamo sin dificultades para tener abiertas las puertas de CREDICAMPO.
texts.en:
Ana is 41 years old. She was able to study only up to the third grade. Currently she is married, and her husband is a day laborer. She has 4 children, and two of them are in school, in fourth grade and kindergarten. The others do not live with them. 

For the past two years, Ana has worked butchering animals. She learned this work from her husband. She works at home over a period of 8 to 15 days. She gets up very early to carry out this work. 

This loan will be of great help to Ana, since she will invest it in buying pigs and calves, to raise them and butcher them when they are grown. 

Among her goals are to see her children become successful professionals, to keep her business growing in order to obtain a better income, to cover the basic necessities of her household, and of course, to pay off the loan without difficulties, to keep the doors of CREDICAMPO open.

loans.use: to buy pigs and calves to raise and butcher when they are grown.

loans.name: Levon

texts.en:
Levon is 36 years old and he lives in the village of Khotanan in Syunik region. Levon has a vocational education and a specialty of tractor driver. He is married and has a son (seven years old, school-aged) and a daughter (four years old). His wife is busy with the sale of different household items at a rented shop. Levon works at the Kajaran Combine once every three days. He uses the time off from his job to take care of his farm, where he has three cows, three heifers, two calves and fifteen chickens. On his plot of land he cultivates wheat. From his farm he sells milk, meat, eggs and wheat, which helps him to earn a good income for his family.

Levon is requesting a loan of 200.000 AMD in order to surprise his son by buying a computer for him.

loans.use: to surprise his son by buying a computer for him

loans.name: Maysara

texts.en:
Maysara is 40 years old. She is a widow and has two children. Her son is an adult. He is 20 years old, and he is in Russia. Her daughter is a schoolgirl. She studies in the ninth grade. 

Maysara’s husband has been dead since 1998. Since then, she has been the only breadwinner for her family. She works in an institute. Also, she is a student. She studies at the National University of Tajikistan. She studies at the faculty of biology in absentia. 

Maysara must pay for tuition, but she does not have enough money. She is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni to pay for tuition. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows, which produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a fertile place, and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of sufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. 

Her business goal is to expand within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Afshan Malik's Group

texts.en:
Afshan Malik is a 40-year-old married woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three sons and one daughter. 

Her husband is a vehicle mechanic by profession. He has been providing services to the people in the form of vehicle repair. He has been running a vehicle repair shop in the market where he performs his services. He has spare parts in his workshop for replacing in vehicles during repair.  

He needs to purchase some equipment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the needed items. 

Therefore his wife, Afshan Malik, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, and brake shoes. 

Afshan Malik is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tires, tubes, axles, and brake shoes.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Angel es un cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia.
El señor Ángel es una persona responsable, padre de familia de 2 niños. Le gusta mucho su trabajo y pasar tiempo con su familia. Tiene un negocio de venta de comida corrida y antojitos mexicanos. Pide este préstamo para comprar una carpa para mi negocio, ya que vienen las temporadas de calor y es necesario que el negocio tenga ese tipo de sombra para que los clientes estén más cómodos.
Mi principal logro es haber mantenido mi puesto de comida por más de 15 años, mi reto es abrir un local más.
texts.en: Angel is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story. I am Angel, a responsible person, father of a family with two children. I like my work and being with my family. I have a business selling hot lunches and Mexican snacks. I am asking for a loan to buy an awning for my business, as the hot weather is coming and it is necessary for the shop to have this type of shade, so it is more to the customers' liking. My main achievement is having kept my food stall for more than 15 years, my goal is to open one more shop.

loans.use: to buy an awning for my food stall.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 49-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four sons. Her husband owns a clothing business. He purchases a variety of clothes from different areas and sells them at a profitable price in the main market.
 
Presently, she needs to purchase some clothes to resell. However, due to the lack of finance, she is facing a problem. For that, she is requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Aline

texts.en:
Aline is a 37-year-old married mother of two children who has been working as a hairdresser and make-up artist for eighteen years. In 2012, Aline established her current business to support her family in their living and accompanying her husband in covering their children's increasing needs.
Her long experience in this domain gave her customers trust and support. Aline is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to change her salon's interior design, to buy new make-up tools, and newly released collections that are highly requested to develop her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

Aline is very anxious and excited about this loan, and she will work hard to keep on developing her business to make sure that her beloved children will benefit from the best education and living needs.

loans.use: to change her salon's interior design, to buy new make-up tools, and newly released collections that are highly requested to develop her business and satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Zaynura

texts.en: Zaynura is 32 years old. She is married and has three children. Zaynura has a medical education. She is midwife. She works at a local maternity hospital. She is one of the best workers. Zaynura always tries to educate her children. Her daughter studies at the lyceum. Zaynura must pay for her daughter’s education in lyceum but she does not have the money. She is asking for a loan to pay for her daughter’s education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education in lyceum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and to pay for rent for her new business office.

loans.name: Joselyng Scarleth

texts.es: La joven Joselyng es comerciante, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su casa, de esos ingresos mantiene a su hijo de tres añitos de edad. Solicita el crédito para invertir en la pulpería con productos de granos básicos, carne, pollo, golosinas, gaseosas, lo que enriquecerá el negocio para una mayor afluencia de clientes, así mejorar los ingresos diarios.
texts.en: Joselyng is a merchant, she has a small convenience store located in her house, she supports her three-year-old son from that income.  Joselyng requests the loan to invest in her convenience store with basic grains, meat, chicken, snacks and sodas, which will bring more clients in and this way improve daily income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, chicken, snacks and soda.

loans.name: Varditer

texts.en:
Varditer is 42 years old and lives in Kapan in the Syunik region. She is married and has two daughters. She lives with her smaller school-aged daughter. 

Her elder daughter is a student at Yerevan State University, Department of Philology, so she temporarily lives in Yerevan. 

Varditer’s husband is in the Russian Federation and works there in construction. He transfers money to his family, and from a distance, he tries to take care of them. 

Varditer has vocational education and for some time she used to work as a librarian. Now, she works at a bread factory as a packer. 

Her daughter asked her to buy a computer. Varditer does not have enough money, but she wants to make her daughter’s wish come true. She asked for a loan of 300,000 AMD to buy a computer and a special table for it.

loans.use: to buy a computer and table.

loans.name: Vân Anh

texts.en:
Mrs. Vân Anh is 31 years old and married with two children. She lives in Thieu Hoa district; a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials, such as sand, cement, brick, and equipment for toilet to build a new toilet. Vân Anh and her family are using an unhygienic latrine.

In 2014, Vân Anh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. This is Vân Anh's first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Vân Anh has a business raising cattle and poultry. Vân Anh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Vân Anh has two dependents. 

One of the most critical business difficulties that concern her is the lack of capital. In the future, Thơ hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials, such as sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Xojolá Group

texts.es:
Juana (primera de izquierda a derecha en la  fotografía) es una señora de 36 años de edad, casada, tiene  dos hijos, ella vive junto a su familia en Nahualá, Sololá.
Ella es una joven entusiasta, visionaria y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, se dedica a la producción y venta de banano, esto bonita actividad lo realiza en la comunidad donde vive; esta actividad la heredó de sus padres, quienes se dedicaban a lo mismo y fue asi como le transfirieron todo el conocimiento y experiencia. Esta labor le genera a ella los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella comenta que le gusta esta actividad porque es honesta y con ella le sirve a su comunidad. Tiene más de 25 años de experiencia en esta actividad.
Con el objetivo de contribuir a su comunidad ella decidió organizar un grupo para ayudarse mutuamente con su compañeras y asi mejorar sus niveles de vida. Utilizará el préstamo para la compra de insumos (fertilizante y pago de mano de obra) para mantenimiento de las  plantaciones de banano.
Juana sueña con incrementar sus ingresos a través de la siembra y producción de más banano y con ello lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en: Juana (first on the left in the photo) is a 36-year-old woman, married, with two children. She lives with her family in Nahualá, Sololá. She is an enthusiastic and visionary woman, with many hopes of succeeding. She works in the production and sales of bananas, and she does this lovely job in the community where she lives. She inherited the work from her parents, who worked there as well and that is how they transferred all their knowledge and experience to her. This work has generated enough income to sustain Juana's family. She says that she likes the job because it is honest, and with it she can serve the community. She has more than 25 years of experience doing this work. With the goal of contributing to her community, she decided to organize a group that would mutually help herself and her associates to have a better quality of life. She will use this loan to buy supplies (fertilizer and payment for manual labor) for the maintenance of the banana plantations. Juana dreams of increasing her income through planting and production of more bananas, and that way she can help her children to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy supplies (fertilizer and payment for manual labor).

loans.name: Abdul Majeed

texts.en: Abdul Majeed is a 38-year-old married man, and he has four children. He is living in a populated area, and he knows about the requirements of the people in this area.  He is a market vendor and sells seasonal vegetables from his place in a central bazaar, and also from his home. Abdul Majeed has 15 years of experience in this field. He knows customers' needs and he has reliable providers. He chose this business because it is profitable and brings stable income. People use fresh vegetables everyday, consider them healthy, and many national dishes are made of vegetables. He wants to increase the stock on a daily basis, so that he can maximize selling the vegetables until evening, and can get the most reward for his efforts.  Abdul Majeed applied for a loan to purchase more vegetables and thus increase his monthly turnover. This will be his first loan; he hopes that he can easily repay the loan through generated income, and can improve his poorly conditioned shop as well.

loans.use: to buy fresh and seasonal vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials like cement, sand, and iron

loans.name: Nadya

texts.en:
Nadya is 30 years old. She lives in Jinen with her husband and her eight children. With this big family, she thought to do something to contribute to the family income, as her husband’s income alone is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of the family members.

She sells various kinds of foodstuffs such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many others in her grocery store. Nadya is requesting this loan to expand her business and purchase goods to sell so she can increase her stock, which will increase her customers and increase her income, which will help her to improve the financial conditions of her family. All the neighbors prefer to buy from her because of her good treatment and good staff. Nadya is very grateful to everyone who helps her achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina, is married to a labourer, and blessed with four children. She's has been into vegetable vending and production in their village for almost thirty years and earns a net income of PHP 200 daily. Her net income is usually spent on their food expenses and school allowances; she also raises hogs to sell, to generate additional income. Due to insufficient capital to run her business, she would like to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 12,000 to purchase vegetable seedlings such as string beans, eggplant, and squash for her vegetable production.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seedlings such as string beans, eggplant, and squash for her vegetable production.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a retail business where he repairs and makes shoes to sell. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are area residents.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more materials for making and repairing shoes, i.e threads, leather, etc. 

His business goal is to own a big business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a happy life. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more materials for making and repairing shoes. i.e threads, leather, etc.

loans.name: Felix Antonio

texts.es: Don Félix es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar los insumos que necesitaba para realizar la siembra de la cosecha anterior. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar: Semillas de Maíz y Frijoles, y dos rollos de Alambre. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda para lograr terminar la cosecha y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Félix is from the city of Boaco. He works as a farmer, planting corn and beans. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito, because he was able to buy the supplies he needed to plant his previous harvest. He is applying for a new loan to buy seeds to plant corn, beans, and two rolls of wire. He believes that this loan will be of great help to him to finish his harvest and to earn a better profit.

loans.use: to buy seeds to plant corn, beans, and two rolls of wire.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a traditional oven.

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en: Nabeela is a 38 year-old married woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of two sons and two daughters and her husband is a vehicle repair mechanic by profession. Her husband  has been providing vehicle repair services and has been running a vehicle repair workshop in the market. He also keeps spare parts in the workshop to use on vehicles during repair. He needs to purchase some eqiupment for his workshop. This will help him to continue his work and to work more efficiently and professionally. He does not have enough funds to purchase the required items. Therefore his wife, Nabeela is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. This loan will help him to buy workshop items like tires, tubes, axles, brake shoes, etc. Nabeela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy vehicle workshop items like tyres, tubes, axels, brake shoes, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To develop 2,000 grafting cacao seedlings

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani is a member of a two-people lending group. She is a very hard-working woman. She is a mother of four children. Her husband is a milk seller by profession. His monthly net income is insufficient to fulfil the family needs. He has a bicycle on which he delivers milk. 
Presently he is planning to purchase one more buffalo to get more milk to sell. This would be helpful for him to increase his net income. Rani dreams of providing a quality education to her children. She hopes that the loan would be helpful for her husband business. She is thankful to KIVA and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase one buffalo to sell milk.

loans.name: Ana Aracelys

texts.es:
Ana de 35 años de edad, solo estudio hasta cuarto grado. Es acompañada su esposos es jornalero,  tiene un hijo que aún  no estudia porque esta pequeño.


Ella trabaja elaborando pan y tamales y luego sale a vender, tiene 2 años de dedicarse a esta a actividad, su abuela era tamalera y ella le ayudaba y le gusto porque es algo que se vende rápido fue como decidió seguir con esta actividad. A donde sale a vender le queda a 2 kilómetros de su casa y viaja a veces en bus o a pie, generalmente es por las tardes que sale a vender.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar 300 tejas para terminar de arreglar el techo, también comprara 2 quintales de concentrado para los cerdos.  El crédito le ayudara porque ya podrá vivir bajo techo y tendrá más salud para ella y su familia.


El sueño de Ana es ampliar su porqueriza,  fraguar el piso para que sus cerdos estén mejor, también ampliar su vivienda y lo hará construyéndole un corredor en la parte del frente, todo esto lo lograra con esfuerzo y dedicación en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana is 35 years old and married. She studied up to Grade 4. Her husband is a day worker. They have a son who is still too young to go to school.

Ana has worked making bread and tortillas for the last two years. Her grandmother made tortillas and she helped her. She liked it as it is a product that  sells quickly so she decided to continue with this activity. The place where she sells is two kilometers from her house. Sometimes she goes there by bus sometimes on foot. She generally sells in the afternoons. 

The loan that Ana is requesting is to buy 300 tiles to finish repairing her roof and also to buy 2 quintals (200 pounds) of concentrated feed for her pigs. The loan will help her as she will have a roof over her head and that will be healthier for her and her family. Ana's dream is to expand her pig raising and to harden the floors of her pig pen so they have better conditions. She also wants to expand her house by constructing a corridor along the front, accomplishing all this with effort and dedication in her work.

loans.use: to buy tiles to finish repairing the roof and buy concentrated feed for pigs.

loans.name: La Bendicion De Dios 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Aleja is one of the members of the group La Bendicion de Dios 1, 2 & 3. This group is located in one of the rural communities surrounding Santo Domingo. They are 15 borrowers who are businessmen and businesswomen. Aleja makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their their children. Her business is based on a miscellaneous products store where she sells cosmetics, shoes and clothing. 

Aleja is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza. She has had her business for almost two years. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by purchasing clothes, shoes and women's accessories (jewels, perfume, etc). She will use her profits to invest in her business and to save. Her group is located in Santo Domingo. All of them are working together to develop their batey (or slum neighborhood) into a better place to live, with the main services and different stores.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes, cosmetics, women's accessories, etc.

loans.name: Africa Romano 2 Group

texts.en:
Nereida is the coordinator of her group Africa Romano 2 (Roman Africa). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to make her small business a successful one. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying her family moments. 

Nereida is excited to be taking her 11th loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. Her business, which she started more than five years ago with some savings, is selling different local fruit and vegetables. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying yucca, plantains, bananas, sweet potatoes, carrots, potatoes and others goods. 

Her group is located in the rural area surrounding El Seibo, an agricultural area. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water, none of which is potable, and unreliable electricity. Nereida thank you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of pork pies and salted shredded meat to better satisfy her customers. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of pork pies and salted, shredded meat to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Monica De Los Angeles

texts.es: Mujer emprendedora es Monica exitosa, empresaria tiene 20 años de edad y su negocio es la hecha y  venta de pan nueva desde hace varios años, es soltera con un hijo, el crédito lo invertirá en  la compra de materia prima como harina, leña, levaduras, azúcar, huevo, queso, mantequilla, etc. tiene dos empleados quienes le ayudan en el proceso productivo del pan, luego  se encarga de comercializarlos.
texts.en: Monica is a successful, enterprising businesswoman.  She is 20 years old and she has had her business making and selling fresh bread for several years.  She is single and has a son.  She will invest her loan in raw material, such as flour, firewood, yeast, sugar, eggs, cheese, butter, etc.  She has two employees who help her with the bread-making process, then she takes care of sales.

loans.use: to buy raw material, such as flour, firewood, yeast, sugar, egg, cheese, butter, etc.

loans.name: Gail

texts.en: Gail is a 30-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious and opportunistic. She operates a beauty salon where she offers hair dressing services. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a centralized place with a ready market and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds and theft. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy hair weaves and add beauty products for use in the salon. Her business goal is to prosper within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will achieve her goals. This her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy hair weaves and add beauty products to use in the salon

loans.name: Ngan

texts.en:
Ngan would like to take a further loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to resell in her stall. 

Ngan's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her
income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nghin

texts.en: Nghin would like to take a further loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell from her stall. Nghin's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen would like to take a further loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell from her stall. Yen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Dehkon

texts.en:
Dehkon was born in year 1962. He is a kind man. Dehkon is married and has four children. Three of the children are non-adults. Dehkon’s wife grows vegetables. Dehkon is a taxi driver. He has been in this business for more than five years. He services to local people. Thanks to the good service, he has regular customers. 

He is going to buy a new car because his car is in bad condition. He is asking for a loan of 2,500 Somoni (TJS) to buy new car. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy a new car.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 44-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days, his rickshaw has not been working properly, because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore, Nasreen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him continue his business. Nasreen is so much thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Damian

texts.en: Damian, 52 years old, is married and blessed with three children. He's been engaged in hog-raising business for almost ten years. Due to insufficient funds, he is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to buy additional piglets for his hog-raising business. He really loves to raise hogs and wanted to earn more income in this business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets for his hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for the land's rent and buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Sáu

texts.en:
Mrs. Sáu is 48-years-old and she is married with three children. She lives in Thieu Hoa district in a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.  She is requesting a loan to purchase materials such as sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. Sáu and her family don't have latrines and they now use a neighbor's latrine.
 
In 2014, Sáu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Sáu has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Sáu has a business raising cattle. Sáu has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. Sáu has no dependents.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. In the future, Sáu hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet

loans.name: María Guadalupe

texts.es:
María es vendedora de tomates en el mercado, ya tiene varios años de realizar esta actividad, pues la necesidad de tener ingresos para sostenerse la obligaron a dar inicio  al negocio, siendo este el único al cual se dedica. La señora hace un recorrido de 5 km diarios desde su casa hacia mercado, nadie más de su familia se involucra en el trabajo, y las ventas las realiza de 6:00 AM a 9 AM.

Ella necesita este crédito para invertirlo en el negocio de tomates, con lo que comprará más mercadería, esto le permitirá vender más y obtener  mayores ingresos,

María sueña con seguir con su trabajo y aumentar las ventas, tener una mejor calidad de vida y además desea ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
Maria sells tomatoes in the market and has been doing this for several years because she needed an income to meet her obligations.  This is her only activity.  Maria travels 5 km daily to the market and no one else in her family is involved.  She works from 6:00 am to 9:00 am.

She needs this loan to buy more merchandise that will allow her to sell more and increase her income.

Maria wants to continue working, increase her sales, and have a better quality of life.  She also wants to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael de 57 años  de edad,  vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos  mayores en su casa de habitación, se dedica desde hace 25  años al negocio de venta de maíz, leña, fertilizantes por libra y por quintal, insumos, para la agricultura.
Don Rafael es un hombre serio, trabajador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de leña seca y maíz,  está muy contento por el apoyo que Prisma le ha dado atravez de los préstamo es su segundo préstamo que solicita su sueño es mejorar sus ingresos en este nuevo año y también su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Enero del 2014.
texts.en:
Rafael is 57 years old. He lives with his wife and their two grown children in their house. For 25 years he has worked selling corn, firewood, and fertilizer by the pound and the quintal, as well as farming materials. 

Rafael is a serious, hardworking man who really wants to get ahead. He is asking for the loan to buy dry firewood and corn. He is very happy with the support that Prisma has given him through the loan. This is the second loan that he has asked for. His dream is to improve his income in this new year and also his house. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - January, 2014.

loans.use: to buy dry firewood and corn for his business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo y su esposa se dedican a la elaboración de quesos, lo que vende en distintas ferias de la población de Achacachi. Ademas, Alfredo trabaja como profesor en el área rural. Vive en casa propia, tiene tres hijos, que se encuentran en etapa escolar en Warisata, población  del municipio de Achacachi, a dos horas y  media de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz, cuenta con  pocas cabezas de ganado  las cuales le proporcionan leche para su elaboración de queso.
El credito requiere para compra de una vaca lechera y forraje para comida de sus vacas; asi, incrementara su produccion, y sus ingresos.

El sueño de Alfredo es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, aumentando la producción  de leche en su comunidad y la de quesos.

Es la Primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Alfredo and his wife make cheese, which they sell in different markets throughout the municipality of Achacachi, and he also works as a professor in a rural area.  

He has three school-age children, and he lives in his own home in the village of Warisata, which lies within the Achacachi municipal district, about one and a half hours’ journey from the city of La Paz.

He has a few head of cattle which provide him with the milk that he uses for his cheese making.  He needs a loan for the purchase of a dairy cow, and  forage for feeding, so that he can increase his production and his income.

Alfredo’s dream is to expand the size of his herd and increase the production of milk and cheese in his community.

This is his first loan with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to increase his production of milk and cheese.

loans.name: Binta's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe  créé le 27 Juin  2008 lors de l’inauguration leur banc villageois. Il compte en son sein des femmes qui habitent toutes dans le même village. Elles partagent des valeurs de solidarité et entre aide qui caractérisent leurs actions et relations entre membre du groupe. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce accompagné de la culture sous pluie.

Madame Binta (assise à la septième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont 01 garçons et 04 filles. Elle est vendeuse de condiments et divers produis alimentaires tels que l’huile de palme, bouillons en cube, divers légumes et des produits de consommation courante : savon et autres.

Avec ce prêt, elle compte s’approvisionner en sacs de feuilles de bissap pour une dizaine et divers produits pour la revente au marché hebdomadaire.

Les bénéfices lui servent d’une part à épargner, d’autre part à aider son mari dans la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: This group was created June 27, 2008, at the time of the inauguration of their banc villageois. They count amongst themselves the women who all live in their village. They share the common values of solidarity and mutual assistance, which characterizes their actions and the relations between the members of the group. As their principal moneymaking activity, they run small businesses, accompanied by rain-fed crop cultivation. Ms. Binta (sitting in the seventh position towards the right, with her hand raised) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of five children, of which one is a boy and four are girls. She is the saleswoman of spices and vegetables for sauces and various other food products, such as palm oil, bouillon cubes, various vegetables and commonly used items like soap and others. With this loan, she expects to stock up on bags of hibiscus leaves for a dozen, as well as various products for resale at the weekly market. The profits will allow her to use a portion for savings and another portion to help her husband in the care of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to stock up on bags of hibiscus leaves for a dozen and various other products for resale at the weekly market.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.es:
Florencio es una persona muy trabajadora vive en un su casa con su señora esposa en La Paz.  Se dedica principalmente a la cocina desempeñando funciones en un Hotel, actualmente vive junto a su pareja la cual se desempeñan mucho para poder fromar un buen patrimonio juntos. El comienza sus actividades desde las 8 de la Mañana y termina a las 15:00 en la localidad de Nor yungas de la ciudad, El Sr. Florencio necesita el credito para poder acondicionar un almacen y acondinacion de tierras para poder maximisar su produccion con mucha calidad y asi tener mejor ingresos.

El sueño de Florencio es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una vejez tranquila, espera  contar con un salario de vejez que le permita vivir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Florencio is a a hardworking individual. He lives in a house with his wife in the city of La Paz. His job at a hotel consists primarily of kitchen duties. Florencio and his wife work very hard so that the can accumulate joint assets. He begins his activities at 8:00 A.M. and finishes at 3:00 P.M. in the Nor Yungas section of the city.

Sr. Florencio needs a loan so that he can set up a store and prepare the land so that he can maximize his production to the greatest degree and generate more income. He dreams of having more income since he must sacrifice for his family. He wants to retire peacefully and hopes to have a pension that will enable him to experience a better quality of life.

loans.use: to set up a store and prepare the land around it.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria vive en casa propia en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El oficio que desempeña comerciante. Maria necesita el crédito para la compra de material de construccion, comprara cemento, escuco y otros y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
El sueño de Maria es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home constructed of brick with a cement floor in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. She works in commerce. Maria needs the loan in order to buy construction supplies, to buy cement, plaster, and more, so that she can improve her quality of life.

Maria’s dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for repairs to her home.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio tiene 41 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Morropon, conocida como la capital del Tondero, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería , ubicada en la provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos reciclados desde hace 5 años, junto a su esposa se dedican también a la crianza y venta de animales menores cerdos, gallinas, patos, Elio ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlos a un mejor precio, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Elio is 41 years old, and he lives with his wife in the district of Morropón, known as “The Capital of Tondero.” The people here work in agriculture, trade, and livestock raising.  Morropón is located within the province of the same name, which belongs to the Piura Region on Peru’s northern coast. 

He has been selling recycled products for five years.  Also, he and his wife work raising and selling small animals such as pigs, chickens, and ducks. 

More has requested a loan of 1,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of feed to fatten up his animals, in order to offer them for sale at a better price, generating more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase feed in order to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Faroizkhon

texts.en:
Faroizkhon is a young and hardworking woman. She is married and has two little children. Her husband works in a computer center. She is going to organize her own business with a beauty salon. Her mother has a beauty salon. Faroizkhon always helped her mother. Now, she is going to open her own beauty salon. 

With this aim, she took part in a course ‘To Get Ahead’ of a women's organization. She is asking for a loan of 1200 Somoni to buy beauty salon supplies and cosmetics. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies and cosmetics for organizing a new business

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 36-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a small firm in which he has set up a few compression molding machines. He takes orders for manufacturing plastic accessories; he appointed laborers on daily wages to use the molding machines. For the manufacturing of different plastic accessories he needs different categories and qualities of raw materials. This time he has taken a much bigger contract than earlier but does not have enough cash to buy an additional molding machine and crushable raw material to continue his manufacturing.
 
Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy crushable plastic raw materials for use in the molding machine. She has to look after a big family, she has to take care of each of her children--their school fees, their diet, and about their health. For these purposes she has need of a lot of income and her husband is the only person who is responsible for covering the household expenses. 

Farzana is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for manufacturing plastic accessories to sell, using a molding machine

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is aged 51 and widowed. She lives in a rural community with her five children. To have an additional source of income, she runs a small variety store in her village. Due to the high cost of goods, she aims to improve her business in order to earn a higher income. Having limited capital, she is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, assorted candies, snack foods, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to sell. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted to further improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, assorted candies, snack foods, seasonings, beverages and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a 24-year-old single man. He describes himself to be determined and confident. He operates a retail business where he sells soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for four years. His primary customers are small-scale customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be that he pays rent for his business premises. 

Anthony will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more soft drinks for resale. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that he will have a bright future. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more snack foods, soft drinks, assorted candies, laundry soaps, noodles, canned goods, beverages and seasonings to sell.

loans.name: Ayni Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “AYNI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Poroy, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Veronica ella es soltera y tiene 29 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia vende todo tipo de zapatos para mujeres, varones y niños, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.
 
 
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de lavandería, negocio de internet, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de restaurant.




La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Communal Bank “Ayni” which is in the District of Poroy in Cusco Province, Department of Cusco.

Sra. Veronica is a member who is 29 years old and single. She works at her business of selling shoes. Veronica sells all types of shoes for women, men, and children. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Veronica has been in this business for seven years and is doing very well. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell shoes.

Veronica is requesting a loan in order to buy shoes. The other members engage in businesses such as providing laundry services, providing Internet services, managing a grocery store, and managing a restaurant.

Veronica would like to thank those who have helped to fulfill her dream in this manner. She promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 37 años de edad, estudió hasta séptimo grado, está casada y su pareja trabaja en la panadería de su suegro, tiene 2 hijos que viven con ella, una hija va a la escuela y el otro no, siendo sus hijos los únicos que dependen de ella.     

Sandra es una mujer emprendedora que quiere iniciar el negocio de venta de panes con pollo, tortas, pasteles etc. Ya cuenta con bastante experiencia, pues anteriormente que vivía en otra ciudad, esa era su fuente de ingreso permanente, pero ahora la necesidad de tener más ingresos de dinero, la llevó a tomar la iniciativa, no realiza otras actividades excepto de ama de casa, el negocio lo pondrá enfrente de su casa y planea  atender de 8:00 AM a 6:00 PM.

Ella necesita de este crédito, para comprar de los utensilios que necesitará en el negocio, como lo son una cocina de gas, sartenes etc. Ya que en cuanto tenga las herramientas necesarias podrá dar inicio al negocio que planea emprender.

Sandra sueña con crecer rápido en las ventas y tener más clientela, espera que el negocio dé resultados, ya que necesita darle todo lo necesario a sus hijos y que no les falte nada.
texts.en:
Sandra is 37 years old and went to school until the seventh grade. She is married, and her husband works in her father-in-law’s bakery. Sandra has two children who live with her and are dependent on her – a daughter who goes to school and a son who does not.

Sandra is very enterprising. She would like to start a business selling “panes con pollo” [a warm chicken submarine-style sandwich], pies, cakes etc. She already has quite a bit of experience, because when she lived in another city, this business was her permanent source of income. Now she needs to increase her income, so she is going to start her business again while at the same time looking after the house. She plans to locate her business in front of her house and will be open from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.

Sandra needs this loan to buy the equipment she will need in her business, such as a gas stove and frying pans. As soon as she has the tools she needs, she will be able to start her business.

Sandra dreams of increasing her sales quickly and having many customers. She hopes her business will show results, because she wants to give her children all they need so they do not lack anything.

loans.use: to buy the equipment she needs to start her business, such as a gas stove and frying pans.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en: Irshad is a very hard working woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of five children. Her husband owns a general store. He sells a variety of goods in his shop, including sugar, rice, flour, biscuits, candies, etc. Presently he wants to purchase cooking oil cans to sell. However, he finds it difficult due to the lack of money. Therefore, Irshad has requested a loan from Kiva field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband. With the help of the loan, her husband will purchase oil to sell. Irshad hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's work. She wants to provide all facilities to her children. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil cans to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Susana tiene 60 años, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, los cuales ya no depende de ella. Se dedica al comercio desde hace 35 años, inició vendiendo mariscos en un local dentro de un mercado y ahora vende productos esotéricos desde hace 12 años.

Ella vende todo tipo de velas, veladoras, inciensos, lociones, cirios por peso, velas decorativas, macetas, bases de herrería, plantas, hierbas, semillas y tés. Pide este préstamo para comprar mercancía, ya que sus ventas van bien y necesita estar surtida.

Con el esfuerzo puesto en su trabajo Susana busca continuar apoyando a su familia, invertir dinero en su hogar y en general gozar de estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Susana is a micro-entrepreneur, a client of Kubo Financial, and this is her story. 

Susana is 60 years old, single, and has 5 children but none of them are still dependent upon her. She has been in commerce for 35 years. She began selling seafood in a local market and and has been selling esoteric products for 12 years now.

She sells all types of candles, incense lotions, candles by weight, decorative candles, vases, iron bases, plants, herbs, seeds and teas. She is asking for this loan in order to buy merchandise as her sales are good and she needs to be well stocked.

Through the effort she puts into her work Susana is seeking to continue supporting her family, to invest money in her home and in general enjoy economic stability.

loans.use: to stock merchandise in order to have more items to offer her customers

loans.name: Antelma

texts.es:
Antelma es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Antelma tiene 55 años, es  casada y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales son independientes; uno es ingeniero y otra estudia administración de empresas. Es casada desde hace 27 años y su esposo se llama Trinidad.

Ella tiene un negocio grande, maneja un club nutricional y prepara productos nutricionales; también realiza venta directa de estos productos. Pide este préstamo para surtirse con mercancía, para tener una mayor variedad de productos para sus clientes.

Antelma considera un gran logro continuar vendiendo estos productos, ya que la misma empresa la ha reconocido. A su vez, la motiva ser una mejor persona y vivir mejor con su familia.
texts.en:
Antelma is a client of Kubo.financiero and this is her story:

Antelma is 55 years old, married, and has three children, who are now all independent. One is an engineer and another is studying business administration. She has been married for 27 years, and her husband’s name is Trinidad.

Antelma has a big business. She manages a nutritional club and prepares nutritional products. She also sells these products directly. She is requesting this loan to stock up on merchandise, so that she can have a greater variety of products for her customers.

Antelma considers it a great achievement to continue selling these products, and the company has recognized her work. At the same time, she is motivated by a desire to be a better person and to have a better life with her family.

loans.use: to stock up on merchandise, so that she can have a greater variety of nutritional products to offer her customers.

loans.name: Ela Isabel

texts.es:
Ela de 51 años de edad, no tuvo el privilegio de estudiar, debido a la falta de recursos económicos que tenían sus padres, ella ha tratado ya adulta de aprender en programas realizados por personas altruistas en la comunidad donde alfabetizan a los adultos y de esta manera ha podido aprender muchas cosas que antes no podía. Actualmente,  está casada viven en su casa con su esposo, él se dedica a trabajar en una finca aporcando, cortando, limpiando y abonando el café. Han procreado tres hijos de los cuales ya están todos acompañados y no viven con ellos, todos estudiaron hasta bachillerato y cada uno de ellos se sostiene solo con la actividad económica que realizan para poder darles una buena vida a sus familias.

Ela se dedica a los oficios del hogar, durante toda su vida se ha dedicado a este oficio, además tiene 4 años de estar al frente de una pequeña tienda,  la cual está en su casa. Esto a ella le ha servido para llevar un ingreso extra a su familia. Ella al crecer en una familia de escasos recursos tuvo que aprender a desempeñar oficios tanto de hombre como de mujer, con ello ha podido trabajar en proyectos que son impulsados por la Alcaldía y ONG, últimamente estuvo trabajando en la construcción de un adoquinado en la calle de su comunidad y cuando trabaja de esta manera una hija de ella es la que se encarga de cuidar de su tienda, ya que los horarios en este tipo de trabajo son de 6:00 am hasta las 2:00 pm pasa casi todo el día fuera de la casa.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar arroz, frijoles detergentes, artículos de cuidado personal, entre otros. Con el crédito ella podrá comprar más mercadería, para aumentar más su tienda, comprando todo lo que ella necesita para hacer que su negocio tenga más ingresos. Podrá obtener más ganancias y un ahorro al momento del traslado a su casa ya que el transporte es escaso tiene que pagar un vehículo que le haga el viaje de la mercadería, la principal necesidad satisfecha será que comprara más volumen de mercadería y tendrá mejores ganancias.

En el futuro desea que su tienda crezca mas, para tener mejores ingresos de dinero con las ganancias esto lo lograra poniendo más empeño en tener lo que sus clientes necesitan en su tienda, desea poder ver crecer a sus nietos verlos jugar en una comunidad libre de delincuencia.
texts.en:
Ela is 51 years old. She didn't have the opportunity to study because her parents lacked financial resources. Once she became an adult, she sought to learn from programs conducted by selfless people from the community who teach literacy to adults. That way she was able to learn several things that she couldn't learn before. She's currently married and lives in a house with her husband. He works in farming by hilling, harvesting, hoeing and fertilizing coffee. They have three children who already have partners and no longer live with them. They all completed high school and each one of them supports themselves only through their businesses so they can provide a decent living for their families.

Ela does household chores, a work she has been doing her entire life. Besides, for the past four years she has run a small store located in her house. This has allowed her to bring in an extra income to her family. Since she grew up in a family of scarce resources, she had to learn how to do both male and female chores. Because of that she has been able to work on projects that are launched by city hall as well as NGOs. Lately she has been working on laying pavement on the streets of her community. While she's working on that, one of her daughters is the one in charge of running the store, since the hours in this kind of work are from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. She spends almost the entire day away from home.

The loan she's requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase rice, beans, detergent, personal care products, etc. With this loan she'll be able to buy more merchandise so she can expand her store. She'll buy everything she needs in order to increase the profits in her business. She'll obtain higher earnings and she'll save money in terms of bringing the merchandise into her home, since transportation is scarce and she has to pay for a vehicle to carry the merchandise for her. The main necessity that she'll fulfill is that she'll purchase merchandise in bulk and make higher profits.

In the future she wishes that her store expands further so that she can obtain better profits from her proceeds. She will achieve this by working harder towards having the items her customers need in her store. She wishes to see her grandchildren grow and play in a community that is safe from crime.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, detergent, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock for her store and fertilizer for her rice crop.

loans.name: De

texts.en:
De is a 67-year-old, married man living in Ho Chi Minh City. He has one son. His wife earns a living running a general store. De supports his family by running a business of renting rooms to boarders, which he has done for 14 years. 

De would like to take a loan to upgrade his rooms for rent. He hopes this will enable him to better meet the needs of his customers and to increase the turnover of his business. He also hopes that, through the loan, his business will generate a higher income and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and enable him to set aside some savings.

loans.use: to upgrade his rooms to rent to boarders.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a 32-year-old married man who has one child. When asked, he described himself as ambitious and honest.

For the past two years Paul has operated a cyber café where he offers internet browsing services and sells computer accessories. His business is located in an advantageous spot where he has regular customers. He identifies low internet speed as a challenge to his business.

This will be Paul's second loan with SMEP DTM; his previous loan of 10,000 KES was repaid successfully. He is now applying for a 20,000 loan to buy more computer accessories to sell. His five-year-plan is to open more branches, and he is looking to earn ever greater profits.

loans.use: to buy more computer accessories to sell.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Her retail business is the primary source of income for Marietta. She is 53 years old, widowed and has four children. As she said, being a single parent is very difficult, but she is doing her best just to meet her children's daily needs. As of now, Marietta needs additional capital. For this reason, she is taking out a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy canned goods, noodles, beverage, condiments and curls to sell. She hopes that she can obtain her requested loan to further improve her sari-sari (variety store) business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, beverages, condiments and curls to sell.

loans.name: Muhtasar

texts.en:
Muhtasar was born in 1960. She is a very hardworking woman who is married and has three children.

For the past four years Muhtasar has been in the business of producing and selling plastic doors and windows. Her husband and son also work managing the business. It is going well and has regular customers.

Muhtasar is applying for a 7500 TJS loan through IMON International to buy more materials for producing the business’s plastic doors and windows. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy more materials for producing plastic doors and windows.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. Her loan helped not just in her business but also in the education of her children. Her income from her business is assisting with their everyday household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Janet dreams that her business will last longer and hopes that her children will finish their education. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru:
Зулфия позитивная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 43 лет. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Живёт она в небольшом сельском посёлке. Зулфия закончила медицинское училище и сейчас работает медсестрой в местной больнице. Зулфия никогда не сидит без дела. Она вместе с мужем стараются делать всё возможное, чтобы обеспечивать своих детей всем необходимым. Зулфия сотрудничает с Арванд с 2009 года, первый свой кредит она получала на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта дома. 

Для того, чтобы иметь постоянный дополнительный доход на пропитание Зулфия вместе со своим мужем начали свой бизнес. Они занимаются животноводством. Зулфия выращивает скот, затем продаёт полученное от скота мясо и молоко. От этого бизнеса они получают хороший доход. В данный момент Зулфия с мужем хотят купить ещё несколько голов скота для откармливания. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет взять кредит на покупку скота. Зулфия заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку, вследствие которой  улучшится качество жизни её семьи.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a positive and hardworking woman who is 43 years old.  She is married and has five children.  She lives in a small rural village.  Zulfiya finished medical school and works as a nurse at a local hospital.  Zulfiya never sits idle.  Together with her husband she tries to do everything possible in order to provide her children with everything necessary.  Zulfiya has worked with Arvand since 2009, she used her first loan to buy building materials to make repairs to her home.

In order to have a regular additional income for subsistence Zulfiya and her husband started their own business. They raise livestock.  Zulfiya raises livestock, then sells the meat and milk from the livestock.  They earn a good income from this business.  At the moment Zulfiya and her husband would like to buy several more heads of cattle to raise.  This is why she turned to Arvand and would like a loan to purchase cattle.  Zulfiya thanks Arvand in advance for its support, as a result of which her family's quality of life will improve.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Khojigul

texts.ru:
Хожигуль проживает в предгорном районе Хуросон. Ей 45 лет. Она верная жена и заботливая мать пятерых детей. У нее четверо сыновей и одна дочь. Муж Хожигуль водитель, он предоставляет услуги такси жителям района. Двое старших сыновей уехали на заработки в Россию, а младшие сыновья и дочь учатся в школе. 
Вот уже 8 лет как Хожигуль занимается разведением крупнорогатого и мелкорогатого скотов. Она выращивает телят и козлят, а также в ее хозяйстве имеется дойная корова. Она любит ухаживать за животными, ей нравится кормить, поить и доить их. Сейчас Хожигуль обратилась за кредитом, чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Она собирается закупить несколько маленьких телят и козлят для откорма и перепродажи. Хожигул ожидает поддержки.
texts.en:
Khojigul lives next to the mountains in the Khuroson area.  She is 45 years old.  She is a loyal wife and caring mother of five children.  She has four sons and one daughter.  Khojigul's husband is a driver, he provides taxi services to the residents of the area.  Two older sons moved to earn money in Russia and the younger sons and daughter go to school.

Khojigul has been raising large and small livestock for 8 years now.  She raises bulls and goats and she also has a dairy cow.  She likes to take care of animals, she likes to feed them, give them water and milk them.  Right now, Khojigul applied for a loan in order to increase her livestock count.  She plans to buy several young calves and goats in order raise them and resell them.  Khojigul waits for your support.

loans.use: to buy young calves and goats for resale

loans.name: Anjelika

texts.en:
