Anjelika, who describes herself as determined, operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps livestock. Her main family challenge is a lack of clean water. 

A first-time borrower with SMEP DTM, Anjelika will use this Kes 6000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit three family members. She hopes to have a bright future.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 40-year-old married father of three children who has been working as a bus driver for five years. In 2013, he bought his current bus, but he still has to pay the remainder of the bus' price in order to register it officially to expand his working zone and increase his income. Today, Mohamad is acquiring a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to pay the remainder of the bus' price, which will help him expand his working zone to a wider area and increase his income. Mohamad is working hard to expand his business to make sure that he can cover almost all of his family's needs and requests.

He dreams of opening a transportation company in the future where he can provide several services to customers in the region.

loans.use: To make the remaining payments on his bus

loans.name: Liliam Zulema

texts.es:
La señora Liliam es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su familia. Su negocio es la venta de ropa clasificada, desde hace 6 años.
Doña Liliam su negocio funciona en su casa de habitación en el municipio donde vive y también sale a vender a diversos lugares aledaños. Necesita el préstamo para la compra de más productos como blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc. para seguir realizando su trabajo.
Doña Liliam con el préstamo espera que sus ventas aumenten y que este le sirva de mucho ya que no cuenta con los productos necesarios para cubrir los pedidos solicitados por sus clientes  y a su vez poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Liliam espera en un corto plazo hacer crecer su negocio y  con esto poder seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos tengan los estudios necesarios, para que puedan tener mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del  2014
texts.en:
Lilliam is a very hardworking and responsible person who lives with her family in a community in the southern part of Honduras. She's had a business selling used clothing for 6 years.  

Liliam operates her business from her house in the town where she lives, and she also goes out to sell in a variety of surrounding places.  She needs this loan to buy more products, such as: blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc., so that she can continue with her work.

With this loan, Liliam hopes to increase her sales.  This will help her a lot, because she does not have the products she needs to fill the orders that have been made by her customers.  In addition, she will be able to improve her family's living conditions with the additional income she earns for the household.  

Liliam hopes that in the short run she can grow her business and continue to support her family with it, so that her children will have the education that they need in order to have better opportunities in life.


Choluteca, Honduras – January 2014

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan would like to take a further loan to buy more materials for the production of iron braces. Her previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. 

She hopes that another loan will assist her in further increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. She hopes she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing more materials for the production of iron braces.

loans.name: Khinh

texts.en: Khinh, 39, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living by making shoes. Khinh started this business 12 years ago to cover her expenses and to generate income to cover her family expenses. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying more leather materials and accessories to make shoes. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more leather materials and accessories to make shoes

loans.name: Ho

texts.en:
Ho is a 56-year-old widow who lives with two children in Ho Chi Minh City. For thirteen years she has sold soft drinks and coffee to the people in her community.

Ho would like a 10,000,000 VND loan through CEP to buy some good quality food to sell to her customers. She hopes this new offering will meet with approval by her regular customers and attract new ones.

Ho hopes that through the help of her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to add food to her offerings.

loans.name: Khanh

texts.en:
Khanh, 52 years old, lives with her four children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a construction worker, while for 20 years Khanh has been running a general store that sells a variety of products in her community.

Khanh is requesting a loan to purchase a better quality and variety of products such as soft drinks, cup cakes and shampoos. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality and variety of products such as soft drinks, cupcakes and shampoos

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar es un joven campesino de 23 años de edad, humilde y trabajador, aprendió el oficio y las tareas del campo por medio de las enseñanzas de sus abuelos y padres, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de fríjol, arveja y papa criolla cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y vendidas en el mercado del pueblo, adicionalmente posee dos vacas productoras de leche con lo que logra complementar los ingresos para aportar a la economía familiar. Actualmente, su mayor desafío es la lejanía entre sus cultivos y el casco urbano de la región, sumado al mal estado de las vías, por lo que se incrementan los costos de transporte de sus productos, para ser vendidos; sin embargo, ha logrado salir adelante, con empuje y dedicación.
El crédito que solicita actualmente será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas al por mayor (abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas), con el fin de reabonar sus cultivos y lograr obtener una cosecha más productiva, para poder vender a mejor precio en el mercado y generar mayor nivel de utilidades.
Edgar manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener una parcela propia en la que pueda continuar con sus cultivos, pero garantizando una mayor rentabilidad para poder brindar oportunidades de empleo y tener la estabilidad económica favorable para dar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Edgar is a 23 year old farmer who is humble and hardworking. He learned the trade and tasks of farming through the teachings of his grandparents and parents. Thanks to it, today he has bean, peas and potato crops. The harvests are collected and sold in the town market. He also has two dairy cows with which he is able to add to his income to support the family. Right now, his biggest challenge is that his crops are at a distance from the center of town. On top of the poor condition of the roads, the cost of transporting his crops to be sold goes up. Nonetheless, he has been able to get ahead with drive and dedication.

The loan he is asking for now will be invested in buying agricultural materials wholesale (fertilizer, pesticide) in order to re-fertilize his crops and have a more productive harvest so he can sell at a better price in the market and generate a higher level of profits. Edgar says that his biggest wish is to have his own parcel of land where he can continue with his crops, guaranteeing better profits to be able to offer employment opportunities and have favorable financial stability to give his family a better well being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his beans, peas and potatos

loans.name: Oimkhol

texts.ru:
Оимхол добродушная и жизнерадостная женщина, которая живёт в небольшом селе. Она замужем и имеет детей, которые очень любят свою мать. Сама Оимхол не имеет высшего образования, и с молодости у неё была тяга к предпринимательству. Она всегда хотела вести какой - либо бизнес, чтобы самостоятельно получать доход и тратить его на свои нужды. На сегодня она ведёт бизнес торговли. Оимхол имеет торговую точку возле своего дома, где она продаёт продукты питания, а также некоторую одежду для детей и женщин.

Оимхол начинала свою деятельность с 2006 года. В настоящее время она имеет около 15000 сомони оборотного капитала. Также муж Оимхол приносит в семью дополнительный доход. Он работает преподавателем в техническом колледже. Старший сын помогает развитию бизнеса матери. Сейчас Оимхол хочет отремонтировать дом, в котором живут, но все денежные средства она расходует на ежедневные нужды. Поэтому она обратилась в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Оимхол очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд
texts.en:
Oimkhol is a good-natured and cheerful woman who lives in a small village.  She is married and has children who love their mother very much.   Oimkhol does not have a higher education and has wanted to be an entrepreneur since she was young.  She has always wanted to have some sort of business in order to earn an income independently and to spend it on her own needs.  Today she has a sales business.  Oimkhol has a sales location near her home where she sells groceries and also some clothing for children and women.

Oimkhol started her business in 2006.  Right now she has about 15,000 somoni in working capital.  Also, Oimkhol's husband earns an additional income for the family.  He works as an instructor at a technical college.  The eldest son helps his mother grow the business.  Right now Oimkhol would like to make repairs to her home where they live but she spends all of her money on daily needs.  This is why she turned to Arvand and would like to take out a loan for the purchase of building materials to make repairs to her home.  Oimkhol hopes for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Diana Milagros

texts.es:
Gracias por apoyar a Diana con su anterior credikiva, el cual aplicó a su negocio, pues logró aumentar su volumen de compras en ropa, calzado, correas y productos de bisutería, los cuales  vendió; su clientela ha aumentado gracias al crédito, porque este surtido llamó la atención de los compradores y hoy tiene mayores utilidades, que le han permitido comprar artículos personales y estudiar diseño de modas para la industria, también ha apoyado mucho a su cónyuge en el bienestar de su familia. 
Ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva lo siguiente: “Gracias a sus  aportes, me he capitalizado y tengo la oportunidad de abrir un nuevo negocio,” 
En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprara ropa, calzado, exclusivamente, porque aprovechará la temporada y sus clientes esperan por estos artículos, lo que hace de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Thanks for supporting Diana with her previous Kiva loan, which she used for her business.  She managed to increase her volume of purchases of clothing, shoes, belts, and other accessories, which she then sold.  Her customer base has increased thanks to the loan, because her well-stocked business attracted the attention of buyers.  Today she has greater profits, which have enabled her to buy personal items and to study fashion designs in the industry.  In addition she has provided her husband with a lot of support for the well-being of their family.

Diana says the following to the Kiva lenders," Thanks to your support, I have capitalized my business and I have the opportunity to open a new business."  At this time, she is applying for a new Kiva loan that she will use to buy clothing and shoes exclusively, because the fall is approaching and her customers are looking for these items.  This will make her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en: Thuy is a 35-year-old married woman living in Ho Chi Minh City. She has two children. Her husband is a driver. Thuy earns a living running a general store, which she has done for 14 years. Thuy would like to take a loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and enable her to save money to meet any future difficulties.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Savy's Group

texts.en: Savy is 38 years old and a married mother blessed with two kids. She is a villager from Kampong Cham province where her two hectares of paddy rice  is grown. To help her to earn a decent income for her entire household, her husband works at a construction site as the main source of their income. She has been engaged in her current business for 21 years. Savy, who has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before, leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group’s representative, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a better income than before so that she can expand her farmland to grow more paddies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Tham

texts.en:
Tham, 34, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her son and  husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a construction worker.

Tham has been in her business for six years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, materials and a hair stretching machine. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new hairdressing tools, materials and a hair stretching machine

loans.name: Feliks

texts.ru:
Feliks is 43 years old and he lives in the village Davit-Bek in Syunik region. Feliks is a father of three children; two daughters and a son. Feliks has no higher education and since his very young age he is engaged in farming and agriculture. He simultaneously works as a forester three days in a week. Feliks during these years has become very skilled and rather clever farmer. He has a rich farm, where he breeds tree cows, two calves, eight piglets, a horse and forty five chickens. He also has a plot of land of his own and also he rents a land.  He mainly cultivates wheat and some vegetables but only for his family use. As he says the main income that the family has, is from the sale of milk, meat and eggs to his loyal customers from city and to his villagers as well.
Feliks asks a loan of 800.000 Armenian drams since he is going to get prepared for coming spring season and needs to buy grain seeds, diesel fuel for sowing activities and he also wants to buy animal fodder for farm cattle.
texts.en:
Feliks is 43 years old and lives in the village of Davit-Bek in Syunik region. Feliks is a father of three children: two daughters and a son. Feliks has no higher education and since he was a very young age, he has been engaged in farming and agriculture. He simultaneously works as a forester three days in a week. Over the years, Feliks has become very skilled and a rather clever farmer. He has a rich farm, where he breeds 3 cows, 2 calves, 8 piglets, 1 horse and 45 chickens. He has a plot of land of his own and he rents additional land.  He mainly cultivates wheat and some vegetables but only for his family's use. As he says, the main income that the family has is from the sale of milk, meat and eggs to his loyal customers from the city and to his villagers as well.

Feliks is asking for a loan of 800.000 Armenian drams since he is going to get prepared for the coming spring season and needs to buy grain seeds, diesel fuel for sowing activities and animal fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy seeds, diesel fuel and animal fodder

loans.name: Rizqinisso

texts.ru: Ризкиниссо 39 летняя жительница района Хуросон. Она воспитывает двоих детей. У нее 17 летний сын и 14 летняя дочка. Ее муж  работает за рубежом и воспитанием детей занимается Ризкиниссо. Она уже 6 лет занимается животноводством, выращивает крупнорогатых скотов у себя дома. Такой вид деятельности помогает ей покрывать бытовые расходы семьи. Ризкиниссо просит кредит, чтобы купить больше скотов для увеличения поголовья скота. Она считает, что с увеличением количество скотов увеличиться и доходность от деятельности. Ризкиниссо заранее благодарит Вас за помощь.
texts.en: Rizqinisso is a 39 year old woman from the Khuroson area.  She raises two children.  She has a 17 year old son and a 14 year old daughter.  Her husband works abroad and Rizqinisso raises the children.  She has been raising livestock for 6 years and grows cattle at her home.  This business helps her to cover household expenses for the family.  Rizqinisso is asking for a loan in order to buy more livestock to increase her livestock holdings.  She believes that by increasing the livestock count she will increase the earnings from her business.  Rizqinisso thanks you in advance for your help.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to increase livestock holdings

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 47 years old and married with two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a computer repairman. Dung supports her family by selling meals in the local community. She would like to borrow a loan to increase the working capital for her business, which will enable her to buy better food to sell at higher margins such as broken rice and meat. 

She hopes that through the loan, she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better food, such as broken rice and meat, to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
Maricruz es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Maricruz tiene 20 años, es soltera y estudia nutrición en la universidad. Se dedica al comercio desde hace 5 años, inició porque desde chica le gustaba cuando vendía dulces afuera de su casa con su mamá.

Ella vende dulces, frituras, fruta picada, dorilocos, chicharrones preparados, yogurt congelado, paletas de hielo y juguetes pequeños Atiende su negocio en las mañanas y parte en las tardes, cuando se tiene que ir a la escuela;  aparte de esto, en la universidad también vende aretes, pulseras y bisutería.

Pide este préstamo para comprar su mercancía al mayoreo, de esta manera tiene un ahorro importante que al comprar al menudeo. Gracias al esfuerzo de su negocio ha logrado que el mismo crezca y gozar de estabilidad económica mientras termina su licenciatura
texts.en:
Maricruz  is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Maricruz is 20 years old. She is single and studied nutrition at college. She has been a merchant for 5 years. She started because from the time she was little, she liked selling candies outside of her house with her mother.

She sells candies,  fried food, diced fruit, dorilocos, chicharrones, frozen yogurt, popsicles, and small toys. She tends to her business in the morning and a part of the afternoon, when she has to go to school. In addition, she also sells earrings, bracelets and other jewelry at college. 

She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise wholesale. This way, she has an important savings compared to when she buys retail. Thanks to her work in her business, she has been able to make it grow and enjoy her financial stability while she is finishing her degree.

loans.use: to buy her merchandise wholesale and save on the product price.

loans.name: Yat's Group

texts.en: Yat, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is 39-years-old and a married mother of three kids, one of whom is in school. For the sake of her entire family, she does cassava farming on one and a half hectare area and raises seven pigs. This business generates her about 36,000 KHR. This is the second loan for Yat and the first loan for her joint borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With a successful repayment of her original loan, her living conditions are getting better than before and she keeps her kids in school. For this cycle, she teamed up with a group of two to get a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig feed and spare some part of her loan to support her cassava farming business. She hopes to gain a good yield better than before.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Dúo La Promesa De Dios Group

texts.es: Dúo la promesa de Dios el señor Bartolome es una personas muy trabajador desde las 5 de la mañana todos los días está trabajando ya en el campo se dedica a la agricultura solo con esa actividad ha podido sobresalir pero es muy poca su ganancia porque el dinero que no les alcanza para comprar semillas y fertilizantes y por eso siembran muy poco. Ahora con este crédito que solicita  estarán invirtiendo más para  sembrar otro poco más, y mejorar sus ganacias, es su tercer credito que solicita a kiva y no a caido en mora, espera que nuevamente le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: The La Promesa de Dios Duo. Bartolome is a very hardworking person. From 5 in the morning every day he is working in the fields already. He is a farmer and with this activity alone he has been able to get ahead, but he earns very little because the money isn't enough to buy seeds and fertilizer and that is why they plant very little. Now with this loan he is asking for, they will invest more in planting a little more and improve their earnings. This is the third loan he has asked for from Kiva  and he hasn't made any late payments. He hopes that you can help him again with the loan he has asked for.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for their vegetable crop.

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Chea, a young mother of two little kids who are under-aged for schooling, is a citizen of Kampong Cham province where cassava is a well-known crop. She has two hectares of farmland to grow cassava and she works for others for a fee during her spare time to supplement her income. 

She is able to earn almost 30,000 KHR to cover her daily cost of living. Chea is a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is now forming a group of two to get a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay to lease farmland and to replant her cassava. She highly believes that she can gain a good yield with a good selling price.

loans.use: To pay to lease farmland and replant cassava

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy, a single mother, appreciates the work that the Kiva lenders are doing towards the progress of their businesses. She was able to increase her sales and profit using the loan that she acquired previously and she repaid her loan well. She is confident that she will repay this one well. She will buy a bale of used clothing using the loan funds. She is hard working and resilient. 

Her hope for the future is to buy a plot and build a house for her two children and also get building rentals for additional income.  Her challenge is the high competition in the city. She describes herself as an honest and hardworking lady.  She encourages lenders to reduced interest rates loans.  She also appreciates the work of lenders in helping business people.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Nhu

texts.en:
Nhu is a 38-year-old single woman. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Nhu supports her family by selling rolls of rice cake with meat and vegetables in the local community. She would like a loan to buy a motorbike to help her travel and carry goods to and from the local market. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to work more effectively and that she can improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport goods to and from the market.

loans.name: Gulafzo

texts.en: Gulafzo is 39 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Gulafzo began a business selling dried fruits 5 years ago. Her husband helped her to organize her business. Now, her husband is in Russia. Gulafzo nowadays manages the business alone. She sells dried fruits in a local market and has her own selling place. Gulafzo runs her business well. She is going to increase working capital. Gulafzo is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy dried fruits. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy dried fruits for increasing working capital.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a worker on interior decoration. For three years, Linh has run a business selling fish sticks for people in her community.

Linh would like a loan to purchase a better quality food to sell to her customers and pay for her sons' school fees. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan, she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a better quality food to sell  and pay for her sons' school fees

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 25-year-old married father of one child. Abdallah has been working as a barber since seven years ago. In 2010, he established his current business, in order to develop his career and improve his living.

Today, Abdallah is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to perform necessary maintenance for his shop, increase his stock of perfumes with new released products with special offers, in addition to selling prepaid mobile cards that are highly requested in his region.
Abdallah is working hard to expand his salon through establishing special facial treatment sectors that attract new customers and develop his business widely.

loans.use: to perform necessary maintenance for his shop, increase his perfumes capital with new released products with special offers, in addition to selling prepaid mobile cards

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is a new client aged 39 years. She is a divorced woman living with 2 children, and she applied for a loan of 1,000,000shs to buy more goats for trade. She has a challenge of little income to educate her children, so she decided to come to UGAFODE for a loan to expand her goat business so that it gives her enough income to pay tuition and other meet necessities for her children. She is hard working.

loans.use: To buy goats for trade.

loans.name: Farzana's Group

texts.en:
Farzana, 43, is living with her spouse and children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a milkman by profession. He sells milk in the market. His customers like the fresh and delicious milk he sells. His monthly net income is too low to meet the household needs because there are too many competitors in the market for the customers.
.
Due to the quality and reasonable rates, most of the customers like to buy milk from him. He wants to increase his stock and buy milk in large quantities to produce butter, cheese and yogurt. But he does not have enough cash on hand to buy milk in bulk.

Therefore, Farzana has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to buy more milk to sell and to use for production. 

Farzana is very happy after receiving this loan. She thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy milk in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy weaving extensions and earrings

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: Sanoat was born in 1958. She is a widow and lives with her daughter in a rural area. Sanoat is a hardworking woman. She works in her own land. Sanoat grows wheat, potatoes and other vegetables. Sanoat’s daughter helps her with growing vegetables. Sanoat sells her harvest in a local market. Sanoat uses the profit from her business to buy food items and clothes for her daughter and herself. Sanoat is going to sow crops but she does not have money to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Firuz

texts.en: Firuz was born in 1991. He is married and has 1 little child. Firuz’s wife is a housewife. He is going to organize his own business because he needs money. Firuz wants to open his own gas station. He is a hardworking man and he will manage the business successfully. He will run business alone. He is asking for a loan of 10,000 Somoni to buy equipment for a gas station. He awaits your support. This loan will help to organize one more business in Tajikistan and in this way will bring an advantage for Tajik people.

loans.use: To buy equipment for gas station for organizing new business

loans.name: Irfan

texts.en:
Irfan is a very hard working and honest person. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is the only person in the family earning an income. He loves his family and he dreams of providing all the comforts and facilities to his children. However, his monthly net income is inadequate to fulfill the basic needs of his family. 

He manufactures bike filters and sells them in the main market. This is the only source of income for his family. Presently, he has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase raw material to manufacture bike filters to sell. His customers appreciate the quality of the product he sells. Irfan promises to repay the loan on time. He is thankful for Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to manufacture bike filters to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and run one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly, aged 62, is an experienced farmer from Chrolong commune, Baray, Kampong Thom province. She is a widow and a responsible mother of three grown-up children. Ly, at her age, still works hard in her daily farming chores in order to nourish her family. To help Ly financially support the family, her children are employed in various careers.  

Ly has requested a loan in the sum of USD1,000 from Hattha Kaksekar Limited in order to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill her family’s transportation needs. This way she can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service, especially commuting to their workplaces and save more for the future business and emergency needs. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill her family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en:
Saima is a 35-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of five children; her husband is a welder and provides welding services in his community. Saima owns a small business of selling ladies' ready-made garments at home. She purchases cloths from market for a low price, sews them and sells them for a high price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothes has increased because the winter weather is going on and people are demanding warm clothes. Her husband affords all the expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings. 
She requested a loan so that she can buy more variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Saima wishes for the bright future of her children and her dream to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy ready-made garments for resale.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: María Isabel tiene 26 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de León. Es una joven soltera, estudia en una de las universidades de la ciudad. Ella a pesar de su escaso recurso económico ha salido adelante con el  valioso apoyo brindado por sus padres, ya que estudia y trabaja a la vez. Solicita el crédito para pagar sus módulos de finalización de estudios y así lograr obtener su título. Su plan futuro es seguir ejerciendo su trabajo de la mejor manera.
texts.en: María Isabel, 26, is originally from the city of León. She is single and attends one of the universities in the city. Despite having few economic resources, she has moved forward with the valuable support provided by her parents, since she studies and works at the same time. She is asking for the loan to pay for her final degree requirements so that she can get her degree. Her plan for the future is to continue working the best she can.

loans.use: to pay to finish her degree requirements.

loans.name: Sokleang

texts.en:
Sokleang is 45 years old and is married with three children. She lives in her own home with her spouse and children in the village of Trapeang Kor, Prey Chhor, Kampong Cham province. She grows and sells rice, which she has been doing for more than 16 years. This is the important source of her income.

Sokleang is asking for a loan to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill her family’s transportation needs. Before gaining access to this loan, her family doesn't have a motorcycle yet and they often experience difficulties in their transportation. This way Sokleang can prevent her family members from paying for daily taxi service, especially commuting to their workplaces and save more for the future business and emergency needs. She is very thankful to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to fulfill her family’s transportation needs.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
This is Luzviminda, 53, resident of Tondo, Philippines. She is married to Silvestre, a helper and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Luzviminda operates a meat stall. They buy meat from suppliers that deliver the meat to respective market stalls. Her products are pork, beef meat and processed meat products. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies of pork, beef and chicken needed in her business. 

Luzviminda hopes that her business will continue to grow and expand and dreams to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies of pork, beef and chicken needed in her business.

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush is from Goris town. Her husband serves in the army and she lives alone with her 3-year-old daughter. Hranush has been keeping livestock for 5 years. She sells the milk and meat and gathers income for her family.
Unfortunately it is very difficult for this young woman to run the farm and at the same time take care of the child. Anyway she does her best to run agriculture in a sustainable way. Now Hranush requests this loan to be able to purchase 15 sheep and enlarge her livestock. She will be very grateful to lenders for their support and she hopes for it.

loans.use: to pay for 15 sheep.

loans.name: Duván De Jesús

texts.es:
Duván es un campesino humilde y trabajador, a sus 34 años de edad, es casado y padre de 2 hijos a los  que ha sacado adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Desde que era pequeño, aprendió a realizar todas las labores del campo, cuando ayudaba a sus padres, gracias a ello, hoy en día posee cultivos de cebolla, fríjol, arveja y otros productos, cuyas cosechas son recolectadas y transportadas hasta el mercado del pueblo para comercializarlas, así genera los recursos económicos suficientes para brindar sustento a su familia.
Su tenacidad, empuje y perseverancia, lo impulsan para buscar alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando y, encuentra en el crédito un apoyo para lograrlo, el dinero será invertido en la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, pesticidas, fertilizantes, con los que podrá continuar cuidando sus cultivos para sacar una cosecha mucho más productiva y generar mayor nivel de utilidad al momento de vender.
Todo esto le permite a Duván continuar luchando para cumplir el sueño de adquirir una casa propia, en la que pueda brindar una mayor comodidad a su familia, velando siempre por su bienestar y calidad de vida, y tener la capacidad económica para dar una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Duván is a humble and hardworking farmer. At 34 years old, he is married and has two children, who he has advanced with a lot of effort and dedication. He learned to do field work from the time he was small, when he helped his parents. Today, thanks to this, he has fields with onion, beans, peas, and other crops, whose harvests are collected and carried to the village market to be sold. This is how he earns enough income to support his family.  His tenacity, spirit, and perseverance push him to look for alternative ways to move forward. He has found a way with this loan. The money will be used to buy farm supplies like manure, pesticides, and fertilizers, so that he will be able to continue looking after his crops, get a much more productive harvest and make a larger profit when he sells them. All of this will allow Duván to continue to work toward achieving his dream of buying his own house, where he can provide his family with greater comfort, always looking out for their wellbeing and quality of life, and give his children an education.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies like manure, pesticides, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Khursheed

texts.en:
Khursheed is the age of 59, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has to do hard work to feed her family, she is the mother of five children. Her one son has gotten marriage and living separate. She is living with her four children and spouse. To manage her household expenses she owns a small tailoring business with the help of her daughters at home. Khursheed and her daughters have been stitching clothes for many years. Her younger daughter has been helping and learning tailoring work with her and now she has gotten a lot of experience. Khursheed wants to buy a new Juki sewing machine for her daughter so that she could contribute in her income by sewing clothes.
Therefore, Khursheed has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan. She wants to make some savings so that she could arrange the marriage ceremony of her daughters. She thanks kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Fatoumata Boula's Group

texts.fr:
Ce banc villageois a été créé le 13 Décembre 2011 lors de son inauguration. Actuellement il est composé de membres qui vivent dans le même village et partagent un esprit de solidarité et d’entre aide sur tous les aspects de la vie.  Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et l’agriculture sous pluie.

Madame Fatoumata (debout à l’extrême droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont une fille. Elle s’active dans le commerce de détail : pâte d’arachide, thé vert, sucre en poudre, elle fait aussi des beignets qu’elle vend dans le village. Elle jouit d’une bonne expérience dans ses activités pour les avoir pratiqués depuis plusieurs années.

 Avec son nouveau prêt elle va acheter 05 Kg de farine ; de l’huile, du sucre et 10 Kg de pâte d’arachide pour la revente.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille surtout dans le cadre de leur scolarité.
texts.en:
This banc villageois was created on December 13, 2011. It is currently composed of members who live in the same village and share a spirit of solidarity and help each other with all aspects in life. As their principal moneymaking activity, they run small businesses and practice rain-fed crop cultivation.

Mrs. Fatoumata (standing on the far right), is the star borrower of the group. She is a married mother of four, one of whom is a girl. She is in retail: peanut butter, green tea, powdered sugar. She also makes beignets which she sells in the village. She enjoys her good experiences from her businesses, since she has been doing this for several years. 

With her new loan, she is going to buy 5 kg of flour, oil, sugar, and 10 kg of peanut butter to resell. The profits will allow her to meet the needs of her family, especially when it comes to paying for school.

loans.use: to buy 5 kg of flour, oil, sugar, and 10 kg of peanut butter to resell

loans.name: Siege De La Sagesse Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mutunzi est une vaillante commerçante depuis 22 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Siege de la sagesse». Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse souliers usagés sur la rue dans le centre commercial. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 350 paires de souliers. Son conjoint, lui aussi, fait le même commerce que son épouse. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite progresser dans son business, acheter une parcelle, scolariser, nourrir ses enfants et leur assurer soins médicaux. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en: The client, Mutunzi, has been a valiant merchant for 22 years and a member of a business group, “source of wisdom.” The senior entrepreneur, she is 36 years old and a married mother of 8, all of whom attend school. She sells used shoes on the street in the commercial center. She is seeking a loan from Hekima to grow her business. She is going to buy 350 pairs of shoes. Her husband is in the same business. She had started the business with the funds from her husband. In the future, she hopes to make progress with her business, buy a plot of land, send her children to school, feed her children, and meet their medical needs. She thanks Hekima for having chosen its goal, supporting entrepreneurial women excluded from the traditional banking system, while giving them loans with no material guarantees, especially in the post-conflict period in the region of the East Country.

loans.use: to buy 350 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to buy spare parts and accessories as well as for the maintenance of their pedicab unit. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children as well as in their personal household and business expenditures. She also has a variety store for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of their pedicab unit. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and her children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.



Rhodora dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to improve her family's living condition. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.



* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of their pedicab unit.

loans.name: Tanveer Shehzadi's Group

texts.en:
Tanveer Shehzadi’s husband has been driving a four-stroke auto rickshaw. Its engine is less powerful than the two-stroke rickshaws. He belongs to an ultra poor family and has been feeding his children. Now his children are growing old and their needs increasing as well. 

Tanveer Shehzadi has been saving for many days to buy a two-stroke auto rickshaw for her husband but at the time of purchase, she was short of money.  Therefore, Tanveer Shehzadi has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new two-stroke auto rickshaw with the help of her savings.  Tanveer Shehzadi is a 40-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Tanveer Shehzadi hopes that now her husband will be able to generate more income because he can easily pick up and drop off the passengers at their destination on time. She is very happy after taking this loan and thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a two-stroke auto rickshaw

loans.name: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas Group

texts.es: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas La señora Miriam Lorena de 27 años de edad ella se dedica a hacer costuras de prendas de vestir como uniformes trajes ,es una persona muy responsable pero a beses no tiene mucho trabajo entonces ahora solicitan la ayuda de kiva con un crédito para invertir en una cafetería desea poner otro negocio para no depender solo de uno y para obtener otros ingresos y así sacar a su familia adelante, espera en Dios que se le pueda dar la ayuda que nececita para salir adelante.
texts.en: Dúo Mujeres Accionistas: Ms. Miriam Lorena is 27 years old. She works sewing clothing, such as work uniforms. Miriam is a very responsible person, but sometimes she does not have a lot of work. Now she is requesting the help of Kiva. She is requesting a loan to invest in a cafeteria. Miriam hopes to start this other business so she does not have to depend only on one. She hopes to make more income and be able to get her family ahead. Miriam trusts in God that she will be given the help she needs to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for a cafeteria.

loans.name: Iftikhar

texts.en:
Iftikhar is a very hardworking and active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan with his family. His wife is a responsible housewife, and all of his children are students.

He has been selling seat covers for vehicles which is the only source of income for the family. Currently, he needs to buy Rexine, thread for sewing vehicle seat covers. He will sell the seat covers in the market at a profitable price. He finds this difficult, however, due to a lack of finances. Iftikhar has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase the necessary things to stitch up seats covers for vehicles. He wishes to provide a quality education for his children. He is very much thankful to all Kiva lenders and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary things to stitch up seats for vehicles.

loans.name: Zaib.u.nisa

texts.en:
Zaib.u.Nisa is a 34-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of a child. 

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a tailor and an expert in his profession. He has been sewing clothes for many years. This is the reason he has a lot of experience about his profession. His sewing machine has become out of order and needs to be replaced with a new one, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a new sewing machine. Therefore, Zaib.u.Nisa has requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy a new professional sewing machine.

Her family has work hard to earn income for the huge family. Her husband also participates in earning monthly income. Zaib.u.Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Oygul

texts.en: Oygul is 49 years old. Oygul is married and has adult sons. One of her sons died a year ago. Now she is a keeper of her grandchild who is an orphan. Oygul began her own business in animal husbandry four months ago. Oygul has a cow shed in her house. She is going to increase the working capital of her new business. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 TJS with this aim. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the working capital of her new business.

loans.name: José Augusto

texts.es:
José, posee un nivel de educación muy baja, en vista que por problemas económicos no pudo asistir constantemente a la escuela, vive con sus hijos quienes se dedican a la agricultura y la ganadería, está casado y su esposa es la responsable de los oficios del hogar. Él tiene más de veinte años de residir en la localidad, es conocido como una persona muy responsable y trabajador.
	
El trabajo de toda la vida ha sido la agricultura y la crianza de ganado, estos dos trabajos lo apasionan de gran manera. Ambas actividades las aprendió de ver como trabajaban tanto su padre y hermanos y fue algo con lo que creció y por vivir en ese ambiente se acostumbró a estar rodeado de ganado todo el tiempo. El señor  recorre un aproximado de 3 kilómetros para trasladar el ganado desde su casa hasta el potrero donde los alimenta. En dicha actividad se involucran todos sus familiares.

Con este nuevo crédito, cancelará una obligación existente con Credicampo y el capital sobrante será para la compra de dos novillos (ganado recién nacido), sus créditos siempre han sido para aumentar su flota de ganado o para preparar los cultivos específicamente de maíz. Al poder comprar más ganado, este tendrá la ventaja de poder vender las vacas de mayor edad y con ello obtener ingresos para sus diferentes gastos.

Sueña con enseñar a su hijos como administrar correctamente el negocio de la ganadería, para que el día que él ya no este puedan seguir con el negocio de familia y el cual ha sido desempeñando de generación en generación. El señor siempre ha utilizado sus préstamos de manera muy sensata, y esta no será la excepción y espera tener ganancias de su inversión. El cliente se muestra muy satisfecho con la actividad que realiza y espera seguirla realizando hasta que se lo permita la salud.
texts.en:
José has a very low level of education, as he was unable to attend school consistently due to economic problems. He lives with his children, who work in farming and livestock production. He is married, and his wife is responsible for the household duties. He has lived in his town for more than twenty years and is known as a responsible and hardworking person.

His life's work has always been farming and raising livestock. He is truly passionate about these two trades. He learned both these activities from seeing how his father and his brothers worked, and it was something that he grew up with. Living in that environment, he got used to being surrounded by livestock all the time. Señor José travels approximately three kilometers to transport his livestock from his house to the pasture where they graze. He involves all his family members in that activity. 
	
With this new loan, he will pay off an existing obligation with CrediCampo, and he will use the remaining capital to purchase two calves. His loans have always been used to increase his herd of cattle or to prepare his fields, specifically his corn crop. When he buys more livestock, he will have the advantage of being able to sell the older cattle, thereby obtaining income for his other expenses. 

He dreams of teaching his children to correctly manage a livestock business so that they can carry on the family business, which has been passed on from generation to generation, when the day comes that he no longer can. He always has used his loans very sensibly, and this one will not be an exception. He hopes to profit from his investment. José is very satisfied with his line of work and hopes to keep at it as long as his health permits it.

loans.use: to pay off an existing obligation with CrediCampo; the remaining capital will be used for the purchase of two calves.

loans.name: Crispin

texts.es: El señor Crispin vive en concubinato y tiene 4 hijos,  actualmente se encuentra en entre rios, anhela tener su casa propia y por el momento tiene 2 cuartos construidos. Se dedica a la agricultura,especificamente a la produccion de platano y yuca, realiza una venta promedio anual de 400 quintales de yuca en una hectárea y 1200 racimos de platano en una hectarea. Contrata 3 personas eventuales que le colaboran en el mantenimiento y cosecha de sus productos, actualmente sus ingresos bajaron debido al bajo costo de sus productos, que se vieron afectados por los cambios climatologicos y diversas plagas. El credito solicitado es para la construccion de vivienda con el fin de poder vivir comodamente, dicha construccion quedo paralizada ya que no tenia los recursos economicos  necesarios para concluirla, como solo tiene dos cuartos y la familia consta de seis personas, necesitan tener mas espacio para asi mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentran.
texts.en:
Crispin is in a common-law marriage and has four children. He currently lives in Entre Rios, and dreams of having his own home. For the moment, he has two rooms built. 

Crispin earns a living by farming (specifically through growing bananas and yuca). On average, he sells 40,000 lbs of yuca per hectare and 1200 bunches of bananas per hectare, per year. He hires three seasonal workers to help with the maintenance and harvest of his products. He is currently seeing a decline in income due to the low cost of his products, which were affected by changes in weather and various diseases.

The loan Crispin is requesting is for the construction of his home, so that he can live comfortably. He had to stop construction as he didn't have the financial means needed to finish it. Since the house only has two rooms thus far and there are six people in his family, he needs more space in order to better their current living conditions.

loans.use: to build his house.

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ángela de 30 años de edad, es viuda, por sus pocas oportunidades solamente pudo cursar hasta séptimo grado, por esa razón ella se dedica al comercio de ropa en el sector informal, Ángela es madre de dos hijos, una niña de 9 años de edad, ella está cursando su educación básica a nivel del tercer grado y su hermanito menor está cursando el primer grado, ambos asisten a la misma escuela. Con Ángela también viven su madre y una sobrinita que tiene 10 años de edad y también asiste a la escuela con sus primitos. En ese sentido se puede mencionar que 4 personas dependen de Ángela, ya que es la única que lleva el sustento diario para su familia, porque su madre no trabaja.

Ángela se inició en el negocio del comercio de ropa en el sector informal, como la última alternativa para poder sacar sus hijos adelante, ya que su esposo falleció hace 6 años, un duro golpe de la vida, pero como toda mujer trabajadora siguió adelante. A través, de los consejos de familiares y amigos ella fue acercándose a personas que se dedicaban al comercio de ropa y fue así que conoció como funcionaba este negocio, ahora ella cuenta con seis años de experiencia en este rubro lo cual le ha permitido conocer a diversos proveedores, los cuales cuentan con su confianza y se han convertido en socios de trabajo. También ha logrado formar una cartera de clientes sólida y confiable, todo esto en conjunto le permite generar los ingresos para mantener a su familia. Ella posee un puesto en el mercado el cual atiende de lunes a domingo en un horario de 6:00 am a 5:00 pm, ella se traslada de su hogar hasta su negocio en transporte público a una distancia de unos 8 kilómetros de su hogar.

Ella está solicitando un crédito para mejorar su negocio, es decir ampliar su mercadería y ofrecer más variedad de productos a sus clientes, ella considera que con el 50% del monto del crédito puede lograr ese objetivo y el resto lo pretende utilizar para mejorar su vivienda, es decir; específicamente el techo de su casa. Ella manifiesta que ofreciendo más variedad ella puede mejorar sus ventas y mantener y ampliar su cartera de clientes. Además, convertiría su negocio en un negocio más competitivo. El mejoramiento del techo le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, ya que por experiencias negativas en el último invierno, ella decide invertir para mejorar su techo.

A través de su experiencia en el comercio de ropa, Ángela considera que obteniendo el crédito ella puede hacer crecer su negocio diversificando sus productos y contar con mejores ingresos para su familia. Uno de sus más grandes sueños es sacar adelante sus hijos y convertirlos en profesionales, además apoyar a su madre, ya ella no se encuentra mal de salud. Con el apoyo de CREDICAMPO espera hacer sus sueños realidad y ser como siempre lo ha sido una mujer con ganas de trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ángela is 30 years old and a widow. Due to scarce opportunities she could only study up to 7th grade, which is why she works as a clothing vendor in the informal economy. Ángela has two children, a 9-year-old daughter who attends the third grade of elementary school and her baby brother who's in first grade. Both her children attend the same school. Ángela also lives with her mother and a young niece who's 10 years old and also goes to school with her little cousins. Therefore it can be said that there are four people depending on Ángela, since she's the only one who supports her family on a daily basis, because her mother doesn't work.

Ángela got her start in the business of selling clothing in the informal economy as a last resort towards getting her children ahead. Her husband passed away six years ago, which was a hugh blow to her, but she moved on as any hard-working woman would do. Acting on advice from friends and family members, she began to approach people who sold garments, and that's how she learned how this business worked. She currently has six years of experience in this line of work. It has allowed her to meet several suppliers who have gained her trust and become her business partners. She has also succeded in building a solid and trustworthy clientele. All of these aspects combined allow her to obtain profits in order to support her family. She owns a stall at the market where she serves customers from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m., Monday through Sunday. She uses public transportation to get from her home to her place of business, which is approximately an 8-kilometer distance.

She's requesting a loan so that she can improve her business, that is to say, stock up on merchandise and offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She believes that she can achieve that by using 50% of the loan amount. She intends to use the rest to do home improvements, which means specifically the roof on her house. She reports that by offering more variety she'll be able to increase her sales as well as maintain and expand her clientele. In addition, she could turn hers into a more competitive business. Improving the roof will allow her to improve her family's living conditions. She had negative experiences last winter and she decided to make an investment and improve her roof.

Because of her experience selling garments, Ángela believes that by obtaining the loan she'll be able to make her business grow, diversify her merchandise and get a higher income for her family. One of her biggest dreams is to get her children ahead and have them become professionals. Besides, she wishes to support her mother, since she has been in poor health lately. With help from CrediCampo she hopes to make her dreams come true and be, as she has always been, a woman with the drive to work and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and to replace the roof on her house.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 28-year-old married woman. She is a mother of four children.  Farzana is motivated to provide her family with good quality food and keep them healthly. 

For the past two years, Farzana has been running a small general store out of the corner of her house. Her husband, who has many contacts at the market, assists her with purchasing goods. Farzana wants to expand her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy salt, rice, flour, detergent, biscuits, and beverages. By stocking these items, she will be able to meet the increasing demand at her store and boost her profit. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

This is Farzana's second loan, but her first with Kiva. She was able to repay the first loan she received.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her general store

loans.name: Obed

texts.en: Obed is a repeat borrower, 40 years old and a resident of a rural area in Ntungamo district. He is married and has four children, and he applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy grass, cow dung and hire more labor for his banana plantation. He is a good farmer and yields more maize and bananas, so he wants to add more manure to yield more returns. He is confident this will improve his income and his lifestyle at his home. He is hardworking.

loans.use: to buy organic manure.

loans.name: Elyor

texts.en: Elyor is a kind man from a rural area. He is married and has two children. Since childhood, he has helped his parents with their animal husbandry business. He has great experience feeding cattle. Elyor has had his own business for more than 18 years. He feeds cows and sells them at a local market. Elyor’s sons work in Russia. He must repair his house because it is in bad condition. His son is going to be married and Elyor must finish repairing his house before his son’s marriage party. He is asking for a loan of 3,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, etc. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and wood

loans.name: Brigide's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Cathérine qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 42ans,elle est mariée et mére d'une fille.

Son activité est le commerce de tissus avec l'effigie des saints.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 10 piéces de 12 yards à 12000f l'unité.

Son objectif est d'assurer les frais scolaires de sa fille,ainsi que son alimentation.
texts.en:
This group was created on July 2011. Its members live in the same neighborhood and working as vendors.
Catherine, the one shown on the right raising her hand in the photo, is our star borrower. She is 42 years old, married and has one daughter. Her business is selling fabric decorated with images of saints. With her loan, she plans to buy ten 12-yard [11-meter] pieces of fabric at 12,000 West African francs each.
Her goal is to  be able to provide for her daughter's school fees and food .

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Shahbaz

texts.en:
Shahbaz lives in the city of Pakistan. He is 38 years old and married. He has a very happy and friendly nature.

For many years, Shahbaz has worked at a mobile shop in Lahore, Pakistan. Now, he owns a small mobile repair and accessories shop of his own. He has a huge number of customers.

His shop is very well known not only in his community market but also in nearby regions, and that is why he has many loyal clients who want to come for services particularly at his shop.

Shahbaz asked for a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, in order to buy a lot of mobile accessories for reselling purposes and for repairing mobiles. He has many orders, and he must fill them on time, but he lacks materials which makes his work slow and unproductive. Shahbaz hopes that the loan will be helpful to him to continue his work efficiently. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase mobile accessories to resell and to repair mobiles.

loans.name: Tacko's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2010.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité principale l'agriculture.

Mbossé qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 46 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 05 enfants.

Son activité est l'agriculture,elle cultive l'arachide et le mil.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des semences d'arachide pour un montant de 45000f.
Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne.
texts.en:
This group was formed in 2010. It is composed of members who live in the same village, and they all practice agriculture as their main business.

Mbossé, found at the right of the photo raising her hand, is the leader of the group. She is 46 years old and is a married mother of five. 

Her business is agriculture, and she cultivates peanuts and millet.

 With her loan, she plans to buy peanut plant seeds for the amount of 45,000f. Her goal is to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanut plant seeds

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en: Hasmik lives in Goris town with her husband and two children. Her husband is retired with an army pension and doesn’t work. Hasmik's son is 10-years old and attends the local village school and her daughter is only three years old. To sustain her family and tackle their financial hardships, Hasmik is engaged in livestock breeding. She keeps 40 sheep. After years of hard work, Hasmik is already an experienced farmer with many goals for the future. Hasmik has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase 25 more sheep and enlarge her flock. The loan will be a huge help for this hardworking woman and she hopes that lenders will assist her.

loans.use: to pay for 25 sheep

loans.name: Franklin Javier

texts.es: Franklin, es un joven de 28 años de edad,  es soltero y sin hijos, sus ingresos que recibe de su negocio de  pulpería, los destina para  apoyar a sus padres con quienes habita, Franklin desea aprovechar ese beneficio de financiamiento a largo plazo para  invertir en su venta que carece de productos en la actualidad, con este primer crédito que solicita, podrá mejorar las ventas y por defecto sus ingresos también con mas productos.
texts.en: Franklin is a young man of 28 years of age. He is single and does not have any children. His income comes from his grocery store business and goes towards supporting his parents, with whom he lives. Franklin wants to make the most of this long-term financing by investing in his shop, which is currently lacking products. With this first loan he will be able to increase his sales and his income by buying more products.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soft drinks, meat, chicken, personal hygiene products, and household cleaning products

loans.name: Sindy Pamela

texts.es:
La señora Sindy es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta vive en  una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto  a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su negocio es la venta de ropa usada desde hace 6 años.
Doña Sindy sus ventas son de manera ambulante en los barrios  cercanos a su comunidad. Necesita el  préstamo para la compra de más producto como ser: camisetas, camisas, buzos, faldas, blusas, pantalones, vestidos, faldas, shorts,  etc. que necesita para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes. 
Doña Sindy espera que el préstamo la ayude mucho ya que contara con las prendas necesarias para cubrir los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes a diario y de igual manera que sus ventas tengan un aumento considerable,  con el cual mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia con el aumento de los ingresos en el hogar. 
Doña Sindy espera que sus negocio siga creciendo y de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia y que sus hijos puedan terminara sus estudios y así tener mayores oportunidades en el futuro.


Choluteca, Honduras –Enero 2014
texts.en:
Sindy is a very hard-working and honest person. She lives in a community in the southern part of Honduras with her husband and her three children. Her business consists of selling used clothing and she has been doing this for six years. She sells the clothing on the streets of neighbouring areas. She needs the loan in order to meet customer demand by purchasing more products, such as t-shirts, shirts, tracksuits, skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, and shorts.

Sindy hopes that the loan will help her a lot as it will allow her to have the necessary garments to meet the daily orders of customers and increase her sales considerably, thereby enabling her to improve her family’s quality of life with the increased household earnings.

Sindy hopes that her business will continue to grow so that she can continue supporting her family and her children can finish their studies and have greater opportunities in future.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, tracksuits, skirts, blouses, pants, dresses, shorts, and other items for her business

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Nouvellement inauguré ce groupe est constitué de femmes désireuses d’apporter un changement dans leur quotidien par le biais du programme. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village et partagent des valeurs de solidarité et d’entre aide. Elles vont le petit commerce en majorité et l’agriculture sous pluie accompagné de maraîchage. 

Madame  Aida, (debout à l’extrême  droite), est l’emprunteuse vedette  du groupe. Elle est âgée de   34 ans, est mariée  et mère de 02 enfants uniquement des filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits suivant la saison et maîtrise parfaitement cette activité pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis de plus de 05 ans.

Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte acheter une dizaine de sacs d’orange de 50 kg pour la revente.

Avec  les  bénéfices, elle compte accroître son épargne pour mieux asseoir son commerce.
texts.en:
Newly formed, this group is made up of women who want to bring change to their daily lives through the program. They all live in the same village and share values of solidarity and working together. They mainly run small businesses and practice rain-fed crop cultivation along with truck farming.

Mrs. Aida (standing on the right), is the star borrower of the group. She is 34 years old and is a married mother of two girls. She sells seasonal fruits and has perfectly mastered this business from having been doing it for more than five years.

With her new loan, she plans to buy a dozen 50-kg bags of oranges to resell.

With her profits, she plans to increase her savings to better establish her business.

loans.use: to buy a dozen 50-kg bags of oranges to resell

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is age 32, living with her five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband is a mechanic by profession; he provides services for troubleshooting motorbikes and rickshaws. He always keeps busy repairing vehicles and does not have enough time for his family. He has been recruiting two young kids, teaching them mechanical work.

There are not any spare part shops close to his workshop; customers have to go far away to buy problematic spare parts. He thus, in addition, wants to offer spare parts so that his customers do not encounter any issues during the repair of their vehicles.

Therefore, Musarat has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband would be able to buy spare parts and can replace worn tools. Musarat thanks Kiva and its field partner. BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her workshop.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is 52 years old, and she lives in Kapan city in the Syunik region. She is not married, and she lives with her brother who is also unmarried. Marina’s brother is a shoemaker, and he repairs both men's and women's shoes. Marina is a tailor. She works in her house in a separated room, which she had made into a comfortable workshop for her. She both sews and repairs trousers, dresses, skirts, jackets and coats. She works quickly and cutely; that is why she has no lack of customers, and day by day, the number of her customers grows more and more.

Marina asks for a loan of 700,000 Armenian drams since she has several orders of dress sewing, and she wants to buy material to manage the orders on time.

loans.use: to buy material to manage the orders on time

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is age 36 and lives with her two children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been selling fruits from his shop for many years. He sells seasonal fresh fruits in his hometown. Due to the fruit’s freshness, he has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. Due to his reputation, the demand for fruits has increased and by noon, his stock comes to an end. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so he can generate additional income to support his family in a better way.

Zahida feels proud of her husband and appreciates his efforts for his family. She is taking a loan for her husband to buy fruits in larger quantities and an equilibrium scale to weigh the fruit. 

Zahida wants to save the excess profits for future sudden needs and for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fruits and a scale

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 32-year-old lady living with her three children and husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She owns a general store at home where she has allotted a portion of her house for the store. One of her drawing rooms opens to the front side of the street, so she is utilizing that room for her general store. She offers many items such as rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. 

Bushra has been running this business for many years and this is the major source of income for her family because her husband's earnings are very poor. Now, she wants to grow her business to meet the needs of her family, so she contacted Kiva’s Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan, to request a loan. She will buy rice, flour, pulses, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits, and she hopes that her general store will do better than before. She praises this cooperation and thanks Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy additional inventories to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is a 36-year-old married woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of six children. Her husband is a tailor by profession; he has been running his own tailoring shop for the past 21 years. 

Asia's husband needs to purchase different kinds of accessories, e.g., needles, threads, pieces of cloth, etc., but due to financial constraints, he is not in a suitable position to buy these items for his business purpose. Therefore, Asia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase these items easily for his business purpose, and he can also enable himself to provide better services.

Of this financial assistance, Asia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some accessories for her husband's tailoring shop.

loans.name: Zuhrakhon

texts.en:
Zuhrakhon was born in 1958. She is married and has three children. All of them are married. She has some grandchildren. She loves her family very much. She has been busy with growing agriculture products for more than 20 years. She grows potatoes and wheat. Zuhrakhon has additional income from animal husbandry. Her husband, son and daughter-in-law help her with managing the business. 

Zuhrakhon’s smaller son does not have a job in Tajikistan. He is going to go to Russia for finding work. She is asking for a loan of 4,000 Somomi to buy an air ticket to Russia for her son. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy an air ticket to Russia for her son who wants to find work

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.en:
Abdurahim is 35 years old. He lives in a rural area of the northern part of Tajikistan with his wife and three children. He has poor family living conditions. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. He has been busy with animal husbandry for more than 15 years and has additional income from growing potatoes, beans and wheat.
 
He wants to develop his business but he has no money to buy more cattle. This loan will help him to increase the number of cattle and, from the profit, improve his living condition. He awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to sell

loans.name: Saeeda

texts.en:
Saeeda's age is 45; she is a mother of five children. Her husband owns an embroidery shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a new variety of embroidery material to resell. However, due to lack of money, he finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that purpose, his wife, Saeeda, is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase an embroidery machine and a new variety of embroidery materials. 

Saeeda is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of embroidary materials for her husband's business

loans.name: Lal Bibi

texts.en: Lal Bibi is a 35-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of three daughters and three sons. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for building construction. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work, so that he can generate more income for financially supporting his family. Lal Bibi is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work. She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories

loans.name: Isah

texts.en: Isah is a repeat borrower, 46 years old and married with five children. He applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to improve his farming business. He has the challenge of limited output from his cows, so he wants to use the money to buy more cows to fatten and more drugs for his cows.
