He hopes this will help the cows to yield more milk and grow fat so he can sell them and earn an income to educate his children and improve his standard of living. In the photograph is the client with the UGAFODE credit officer (left to right)

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 50 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Harutyun has graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in Armenian Language and Literature. Harutyun is divorced and now his children and his ex-wife live abroad. Harutyun lives with his retired mother. He works at the nearby village school as a teacher of Armenian Language and Literature. He is very beloved and respected as a specialist by his pupils and his colleagues. Harutyun also gives paid private courses in Armenian Language and Literature to pupils who are going to take entrance examinations. Harutyun is a very interesting and romantic person. He is a talented painter and as he says, while painting he is relaxing and his inner world becomes brighter and richer. 

Harutyun is asking for a loan of 300.000 Armenian drams to buy a computer. He wants to make some innovations in his teaching methods and the computer will serve as a source of useful information for him and his pupils.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for three calves.

loans.name: Ok Mufakose Vendors -A Group

texts.en:
Raphael said he used the loan to increase his stock. The loan impacted his business positively and he now has an advantage over his competitors. He says his disposable income has increased, which resulted in him managing to pay school fees and rentals as well as buy food without any hassles. The business focuses on growth in personal and business circles. Raphael said the successful partnership has borne positive fruits with the funders.

Raphael requested a loan of $200 to buy fruit and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en:
Gayane lives in Doghs village of the Armavir region. She is a divorced woman who lives with her daughter. 

Gayane earns her living by running a farm. Specifically, she owns a greenhouse where she cultivates potatoes, cucumbers, tomatoes and greens. She sells the gathered products, and that's the only source of her income.

Unfortunately, the greenhouse that Gayane owns is too old and needs to be renovated. Because of high costs, Gayane isn't able to do it with her own resources, so she has decided to apply for this loan. 

Gayane has requested a loan of USD $1,500 to purchase polyethylene cover and glasses for the greenhouse and potato seeds. This will be a big support for Gayane, and she hopes for lenders' goodwill.

loans.use: to pay for polyethylene cover and glasses for the greenhouse and potato seeds

loans.name: Baram

texts.en: Baram is a new client who is 40 years old.  He is a married man with four children and he applied for a loan of 1,000,000 KES to improve his coffee plantation and his banana plantation. He has the challenge of limited income. He hopes the loan will help him to purchase manure and pesticides in order to have his plantation spread and sprayed, which will increase his productivity and output and, therefore, increase his income. He will then be in a position to adequately provide for his family and send his children to good schools.

loans.use: To purchase organic manure

loans.name: Vachagan

texts.en:
Vachagan is 46 years old and he lives in the village of Zovaber in the Gegharkunik region. Vachagan has a vocational education and is seriously engaged in farming and agriculture. He is married and has a son and a daughter. Vachagan’s wife does not work and she greatly helps her husband in farming activities. On their farm, Vachagan has two cows, a calf, six sheep and ten chickens. On their plot of land, he mainly cultivates potatoes. From their farm, they manage to sell some dairy products, eggs and potatoes. The income is too little for his family, so Vachagan also does some hired paid construction work around their village and Sevan city. 

Vachagan asks for a loan of 800,000 Armenian Drams to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer with great hope of having a better and larger harvest in the coming season.

loans.use: to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer with great hope of having a better and larger harvest in the coming season.

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is 38 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan, with her four children and husband. She has requested a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is the only earning person in the family. He owns a general store and sells a variety of products in his shop. 

The loan amount will help him to increase his general store business, which he has been doing for five years. He wants the financing to invest in buying products of everyday consumption like bread, milk, eggs, beans, matches, vegetables, fruits and natural drinks, etc. 

He believes in hard work and honesty and is confident that the loan will bring positive changes to his business and will increase his profits. Irshad believes in hard work and honesty. All of her children are going to school. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase products of everyday consumption like bread, milk, eggs, beans, matches, vegetables, fruits and natural drinks, among others.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 32 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Tigran has graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute at the juridical faculty. For several years, he worked at the military commissariat as a lawyer. Now he has his own business. He buys cars and spare parts from Georgia and sells them in the Lori region. He is in this business already five years. In all, Tigran is satisfied with his business income. 

He is married, and he has a son of 3 years old. His wife is unemployed, and she takes care of their child and house.

Now Tigran asks for a loan of 450,000 Armenian drams in order to make customs clearance of the car he brought from Georgia for sale.

loans.use: to make customs clearance of the car brought from Georgia for sale

loans.name: Spartak

texts.en: Spartak lives in Haytagh village in the Armavir region with his wife. Their children are married and live separately with their families. Spartak's wife works at a regional hospital and Spartak is involved in agriculture. He cultivates greens and potatoes and sells his gathered harvest in nearby communities. Despite his age, Spartak is a very enthusiastic and hard working farmer who does his best to enrich his farm. Now, he asks for Kiva lenders' support to purchase potato seeds and fertilizer. He will be very grateful to lenders who give him a chance to enlarge the farm and gather more income for his family.

loans.use: to pay for potato seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen belongs to an ultra poor family. She is 47 years old and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband sells balloons in a cart near schools and picnic places in Lahore. He hangs balloons of various colors to offer his customers. A balloon is a flexible bag that can be inflated with a gas, such as helium, hydrogen, nitrous oxide, oxygen, or air. Modern balloons are made from materials such as rubber, latex, polychloroprene, or a nylon fabric, and can come in many colors.

He wants to buy modern balloons, which have a high cost. Due to a lack of funds, he is unable to make these purchases. Therefore, Parveen has requested a loan for her husband to buy balloons made of rubber, latex, polychloroprene, or a nylon fabric.
 
Parveen is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy modern balloons to sell.

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en: Rehana is a 37-year-old married woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of one son and one daughter, and her husband owns a vehicle spare parts (tire) shop in the market. Her husband has been selling tires for all types of vehicles in his shop. There are the most valuable and durable company tires like General Tires, Panther Tires and Service Tires in his shop. He holds regular hours and gives perfect time to his work; that is why people like him. He speaks with a monotonous tone which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. His tire shop is very famous in town. Due to his good relations, his sales have increased greatly, but he does not have sufficient stock to meet the demand. Therefore, Rehana requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of tires and tubes for his shop. Rehana thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tires and tubes for the shop.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 35 years old, a married woman and a mother of four children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. Her husband drives the auto rickshaw by day and night. He has been continuously driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zarina has applied for a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for the maintenance of rickshaw. Her husband wants to buy new tires and do a little bit of engine maintenance for his vehicle. This will help him to drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her family and will bring positive changes to his services.

Zarina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of the auto rickshaw.

loans.name: Zara

texts.en:
Zara is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been running a business selling cloths for many years. She purchases a variety of cloths from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality cloths in her community. 

Zara requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. 

Zara dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloths for the summer season.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
Gulnaz, age 49, is a very hard-working housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband offers sheltering services. 

Gulnaz is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to expand his business so that he can eventually construct a small house for his family. 

Gulnaz hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase bamboo, nails, and iron sheets for her husband's business.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Taronik village with her family: her husband, three sons, daughter-in-law and new born grandchild. Gohar and her sons are involved in farming activities. They cultivate cucumbers, tomatoes and greens and sell them at local markets. The whole family works hard to gather a good agricultural harvest. As the winter is almost over and the cultivation season is starting, Gohar would like to make improvements on her farm. She is asking for this loan to be able to purchase cucumber seeds, fertilizer and materials to fix the greenhouse. This will greatly improve her farm and she will be able to continue her farming activities.

Gohar and her whole family hope for your support.

loans.use: to pay for cucumber seeds, fertilizer and materials to fix the greenhouse

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is 52 years old and a mother of four children. She lives with her spouse and children in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a green grocer by profession and he has sold fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. 

The needs of his family suddenly increased and he does not have other sources of income to cope with these needs, so he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales. Rukhsana is requesting a loan so her husband would be able to buy more vegetables to sell.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and field partner Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: Vegetable shop

loans.name: Rafia

texts.en:
Rafia is a 28-year-old unmarried woman. She has been in the beauty parlor business for 13 years. She offers many services to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Through providing her best services she has become very famous in her area.

She started her own beauty parlor in her house at the time when her father's minor income was not sufficient to fulfill the expenses of the house. Rafia worked for her family. She wants to give a better life to her parents and support her brothers also.

In order to meet with the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more variety of cosmetic products for the parlor. She needs funds for her business. She is now in her fourth loan cycle. She needs a loan of 45,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation to buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful of catering to more customers after time with the help of the loan.

loans.use: To buy hair care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening

loans.name: Safia

texts.en: Safia is a 57-year-old married woman. For 15 years, Safia has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family. With the passage of time, her sales, and also her income, increased. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her family in all family matters, as well as in financial matters. Safia has some savings and has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is in her 7th loan cycle and has a good credit history

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Otto Francisco

texts.es: Otto Francisco de 51 años, de unión libre, con dos niños menores aún bajo su responsabilidad, originario de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, él es un microempresario el cual posee la actividad de venta de mercadería en general como: ropa nueva variada, zapatos, productos plásticos, entre otros productos; las compras las realiza al contado en mercados de esta ciudad. Las ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales. Y todos sus productos los comercializa de manera ambulante y por encargos. inicia su negocio con fondos propios el cual tiene ya mas de dos años de dedicarse a este tipo de negocio. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertirlo en mercadería como. Uniformes, zapatos, mochilas, bolsos, carteras,  entre otros productos, para poder cumplir con los encargos de sus clientes.
texts.en: Otto Francisco is 51 years old, in a common-law marriage, with two small boys under his responsibility. Originally from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, he is a small business owner who sells general merchandise such as: varied new clothing, shoes, and plastic products, among others products; he makes these sales to markets in his city. The sales are both cash and credit to regular and potential clients, and all of his products are sold by street vendors and by order. He started his business with his own funds, and he has had done this business for more than two years now. The goal of this credit is to invest it in merchandise such as uniforms, shoes, backpacks, bags, and wallets, among other products, to be able to fill his clients' orders.

loans.use: to buy a variety of styles of clothing, cosmetics, and plastic products, among other things.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen is a 46-year-old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of seven children. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly so he has been unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to a lack of money, he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. Therefore Parveen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. Parveen is so very thankful to KIVA.

loans.use: To cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. She has been doing the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she will be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful of getting an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Rehana dreams of her children's bright future.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors and packs of beads, sequins and stones.

loans.name: Nagina

texts.en:
Nagina belongs to a poor family, living with her spouse and five children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

Her husband is a blacksmith. He manufactures iron accessories for doors and windows which are usable in houses. He has been providing door to door services to weld broken accessories.

A few days ago his welding plant became out of order due to overheating and needs to be replaced with a new one. He wants to buy a new welding plant but does not have cash in hand due to a lot of household expenses.

Therefore, Nagina has requested a loan from BRAC, an active field partner of Kiva, so that her husband would be able to buy a welding plant and additional raw materials such as welding rods, soldering rods and iron rods for manufacturing.

Nagina thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for manufacturing iron accessories.

loans.name: Maqsoodan

texts.en:
Ms Maqsoodan is a 49-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her son for last 12 years. (The man shown in the photo is her son,) She sells milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from the milk.  She looks after the buffalos and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her son sells the milk in different places on a daily basis. They are happily doing it together to cover the household expenses.

In order to expand the business, she requested a loan of Rs 45,000 to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers. She hopes to have an increase in her milk production capacity, which ultimately helps in generating more revenues.

loans.use: To buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Hrant

texts.en:
Hrant is 54 years old and lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Hrant is married and has a son and a daughter. His son is married and he lives separately with his family. Hrant’s daughter is divorced and she and her child live with her parents. Hrant works at a dental clinic as a driver and he delivers medicine and medical equipment for the clinic. Hrant is the only one who makes money in the household and it is very hard for him to overcome all his family’s financial problems alone. 

He is asking for a loan of 350.000 Armenian drams, which he needs to make bathroom repairs, in order somehow to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for repairs to his bathroom

loans.name: David Alexis

texts.es:
David, a sus 29 años de edad, es un campesino trabajador, humilde y dinámico; desde hace 4 años se dedica a las labores del campo que aprendió de su familia, posee varias cabezas de ganado productor de leche, cuyo líquido es vendido diariamente en el mercado de la región, esto le ha permitido generar ingresos suficientes para aportar a la economía familiar y costear sus estudios de obras civiles, que realiza en una institución universitaria.
Su perseverancia y las ganas de salir adelante, lo motivan a solicitar el crédito como apoyo para fortalecer su actividad agropecuaria, con el dinero comprará una vaca productora de leche, con la que podrá aumentar su producción diaria y mejorar los ingresos.
David manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder culminar sus estudios y continuar con ambas labores, alternando las actividades para lograr un equilibrio entre ambas, generando así mejores ingresos para su bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
David, at 29 years, is a rural worker, humble and dynamic. For four years he has worked in the countryside, which he learned from his family, and he has various milk cows, whose milk is sold daily in the regional market. This has permitted him to generate sufficient income to help his family's earnings and pay for his studies of civil works, which he takes at a university institution.
His perseverance and desire to improve motivate him to request this loan to help him strengthen his agricultural activity; with the money he will buy a milk-producing cow, with which he will increase his daily production and improve income.
David shows that his main desire is to be able to finish his studies and work at the same time, alternating the activities to find a balance between them, and so improving his income for his well-being and quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is the age of 54 and the mother of seven children. Her daughters are married and live happily at their homes. Her elder son holds together the whole family. He is responsible for all expenses and utility bills. He is a hard worker and a zealous young man who owns a general store in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.
 
Shamim wants to buy more inventories for the general store so her son can generate more income. Therefore, Shamim has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy additional stock of inventories such as pulses, flour, sugar, biscuits, rice etc. She thanks Kiva and hopes that the lenders will support her.

loans.use: To buy stock for her son's general store

loans.name: Karam

texts.en: Karam is a 44-year-old married woman. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs.50,000 to purchase two more calves. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more calves.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 24 years old, and he lives with his family in Gaza. His life conditions prevented him from completing his higher education, so he is working at a printing house where he earns around $500 monthly.
In order to increase his business capital and to expand his selling capacity, Hasan asked Ryada for a youth loan. He plans to buy a machine for cutting paper and large quantities of paper, which will increase his number of clients and his income, and help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.  
Hasan hopes that this loan will help him support the needs of his family, and he hopes to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy a machine for cutting paper and large quantities of paper

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is 37 years old, is married, and has four children. The man shown in the photo is Shabana’s husband who is a driver by profession and who provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. But now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in functional. For this reason, Shabana has applied for a loan of Rs 40,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Shabana is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a responsible mother of a daughter and a son. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transportation by driving a taxi for the past five years. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family. Shehnaz's husband needs to maintain his vehicle because its current condition is not good and requires maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to maintain his vehicle. Therefore Shehnaz has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan, Shehnaz's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily and provide better transportation to earn profitable income. Shehnaz also plans to put money in savings with the profit from her husband's income to meet her family's needs in the future.
Shehnaz is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To make repairs on her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Gougny Claire's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis 2010.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Kandakhassé qui est à droite de la photo est notre emprunteuse vedette,elle est âgée de 28 ans,elle est mariée et n'a pas encore d'enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de marchandises telles que la vente de chaussures et de vêtements.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter des chaussures pour une valeur de 200000f et des vêtements pour une valeur de 100000f.

Son objectif est de pouvoir constituer un fonds roulement consistant afin d'ouvrir une boutique de prêt à porter.
texts.en: This group was created in 2010. Its members live in the same district and are retailers. Kandakhassé, on the right of the photo, is our featured borrower. She is 28 years old, married and doesn't have children yet. She sells merchandise like shoes and clothes. She plans to use her loan to buy 200 000 francs worth of shoes and 100 000 francs worth of clothes. Her aim is to build up some working capital so that she can open a shop selling ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Faty's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juin 2008.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Faty qui se trouve à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 37 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de tissus,de draps et d'encens.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter des drap pour une valeur de 125000f,du tissu pour une valeur de 175000f et de l'encens pour une valeur de 50000.

Son objectif est de renforcer son activité et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en: This group was created in 2008. Its members live in the same area and are retailers. Faty, who is on the right of the photo and raising her hand, is the group leader. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She sells fabrics, sheets and incense. She plans to use her loan to buy 125 000 francs worth of sheets, 175 000 francs worth of fabrics and 5 000 francs worth of incense. Her aim is to strengthen her business and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy sheets, fabrics and incense.

loans.name: Aida's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis décembre 2009.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Thioro qui est à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 54 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 07 enfants.

Son activité est la vente de fruits telles que le oranges,les bananes.

Avec son crédit,elle compte acheter 10 sacs d'oranges pour une valeur de 120000f et 200 kg de bananes pour une valeur 40000f.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de contribuer  aux charges familliales.
texts.en: This group was created in 2009. Its members live in the same district and are retailers. Thioro, who is on the right of the picture and raising her hand, is the group leader. She is 54 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She sells fruit, like oranges and bananas. She plans to use her loan to buy 10 bags of oranges (for 120 000 francs) and 200 kilos of bananas (for 4 000 francs). Her aim is to build her savings and to contribute to the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo es una persona responsable y amigable y se dedica a la fabricación de colchones, él vende sus productos a diferentes revendedores y tiendas comerciales, él desea aumentar el capital del negocio y requiere otro crédito para comprar materiales de trabajo como espumas e hilos. Gerardo se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma. (Este crédito se les otorga a los clientes que son responsables y puntuales con el pago de las cuotas).
texts.en:
Gerardo is a responsible and friendly person who makes mattresses for a living.  He sells his products to different sellers and shops.  He would like to increase his business capital, so he needs another loan to buy material for his work such as foam and thread.  

He is very grateful for the help he receives and he promises to pay the loan off in the given timeframe.  (This credit is granted to those who are responsible and pay their installments on time).

loans.use: to buy foam and fabric.

loans.name: Wendbenedo Group

texts.fr:
Mme POKO ANNE est responsable du groupe WENDBENEDO. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 13ans et le moins âgé a 03ans.03 va à l’école. Elle a 04 personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits, chaussures et pagnes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les habitants du secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter  15 pièces de pagnes, 25paires de chaussures et 15douzaines d’habits pour enfants.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut  réinvestir  dans son activité. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une parcelle et mieux s’occuper  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Poko Anne is the leader of the Wendbenedo group. She is going well. Married, she is a mother of three children. The eldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 3 years old. All three children go to school. She has [an additional] four people under her care.

Poko Anne has been selling clothing, shoes, and pagnes [brightly colored fabric] for ten years. She procures her goods from a market in a part of town known as Sector 10. Her customers are people living in the area.

She would like to buy 15 lengths of pagnes, 25 pairs of shoes, and 15 dozen children's outfits.

With these earnings, she wants to reinvest in her business.

She plans to one day buy a piece of land and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 15 lengths of pagnes [brightly colored fabric], 25 pairs of shoes, and 15 dozen children's outfits

loans.name: Yamb Yel Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme  TENE  est responsable du groupe  YAMB YEL BENEWENDE. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 23 ans et le moins âgés à 10 ans. Les 03 vont  à l’école.
Mme  fait restauration (haricot) et vend de condiments depuis  10ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les  femmes, hommes et enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter  03 sacs d’haricot, 02sac de riz et des condiments.	
Elle veut épargner  ses bénéfices. Mme  ambitionne s’acheter  un motocycle et mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Tene is the leader of the Yamb Yel Benewende group. She is going well. Married, she is a mother of four children. The eldest is 23 years old and the youngest is ten years old. Three of the children go to school.

Tene has worked preparing food (beans) and selling condiments for ten years. She procures her goods from a market in her area. Her customers are women, men, and children.

Tene plans to buy three sacs of beans, two sacs of rice, and condiments. 

She wants to save her earnings. She hopes to one day buy herself a motorcycle and take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy three bags of beans, two bags of rice, and condiments

loans.name: Sababsongo 2 Group

texts.fr:
Mme WOUGO MARGUERITE représente le groupe SABABSONGO 2. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a27ans et le moins âgé a 1an. 07 vont à l’école. Elle a 06personnes en charge. 
Mme vend des tubercules et fruits depuis 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Bobo et au Ghana. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter 30sacs d’ignames.
Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un magasin de stockage de tubercules et fruits et mieux s’occuper de la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Wougo Marguerite represents the Sababsongo 2 group. She is going well. Married, she is a mother of nine children. The eldest is 27 years old and the youngest is one year old. Seven of the children go to school. She has six [additional] people under her care.

Wougo Marguerite has been selling tubers and fruits for 12 years. She procures her goods in Bobo and in Ghana. Her customers are men, women, and children.

Wougo Marguerite would like to buy 30 sacs of yams. She wants to strengthen her business with the earnings.

She hopes one day to open a shop of yams and fruits and take better care of her children's education.

loans.use: to buy thirty sacs of yams

loans.name: Temple Eliel Group

texts.fr:
Mme T. CLARISSE est la responsable du groupe TEMPLE ELIEL. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 8ans et le moins âgé a 03ans. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des condiments  depuis 08 ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son quartier. Ses clients sont  les femmes et les hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 15 boites de patte de tomates, 01 bidon d’huile de 20l pour revendre en détail, 01sac de gombo sec.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne étendre les limites de son activité et mieux s’occuper  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. T. Clarisse is in charge of the Temple Eliel group. She is well. She is married with three children. The oldest is eight and the youngest three years old. One of the children goes to school.
This lady has been selling condiments for eight years. She buys her stock at the local market. Her customers are both men and women.
She would like to buy 15 cans of tomato paste, one 20 liter can of oil to sell retail, and one bag of dried gumbo.
Mrs. Clarisse would like to reinvest her profits in her business. She hopes to expand her business and take better care of her family.

loans.use: to buy 15 cans of tomato paste, one 20 liter can of oil to sell retail, and one bag of dried gumbo.

loans.name: Viim Kom Group

texts.fr:
Mme TATIANA est la responsable du groupe VII KOM. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 18ans. Les  02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits  depuis 2001 soit 13ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes, les hommes.
Mme veut s’acheter 04douzaines d’habits.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne agrandir le champ de son activité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Tatiana is the leader of the VII Kom group. She is well. She is married with two children. The oldest is 21 and the youngest 18 years old. Both of them attend school. She has four people dependent on her.
This lady has been selling clothes since 2001, which is 13 years ago. She buys her stock at the sector 10 market. Her customers are men and women.
Mrs. Tatiana wants to buy four dozen items of clothing.
She would like to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to widen the scope of her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy four dozen items of clothing.

loans.name: Laafilabumb De Yagma Group

texts.fr:
Mme COLETTE est la représentante du groupe LAAFI LA BOUMB DE YAGMA. Mme se porte bien.  Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans le moins âgé a 04ans. 01 va à l’école.
Mme vend des plats en plastique. Elle exerce ce métier depuis  05ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché  de son quartier. Ses clients sont les femmes et hommes.
Mme veut  s’acheter  01 douzaine de gobelet, 01 douzaine de plats et 1/2douzaine de barrique.
Elle  épargne  ses bénéfices  afin de renforcer son activité et s’acheter une moto. Mme ambitionne agrandir  son  commerce  et améliorer sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Ms. Colette is the representative of the Laafi La Boumb De Yagna group. She is doing well. She is the married mother of two children. The oldest is seven years old and the youngest is four. One goes to school.

She sells plastic dishes. She has been doing this job for the past five years. She resupplies from her neighborhood market and her clients are both women and men.

Ms. wants to buy one dozen cups, one dozen dishes, and half a dozen basins.

She saves her profits to strengthen her business and buy a motorcycle. Her ambition is to expand her business and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: buy one dozen cups, one dozen dishes, and half a dozen basins.

loans.name: Omar Mateo

texts.es: Omar es una persona responsable y trabajdora que se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, él vende sus cuyes a diferentes revendedores y resataurantes, él desea aumentar el capital del negocio y requiere otro crédito para comprar alimento de para cuyes. Gerardo se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Omar is a responsible and hardworking person who raises small animals such as guinea pigs. He sells his guinea pigs to different re-sellers and restaurants. He wants to increase his business capital and he needs another loan to buy guinea pig feed. Gerardo is grateful for the opportunity that is being offered in this way and he is committed to making his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy guinea pig feed.

loans.name: Les Soeurs Unies Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATOUMATA est la responsable du groupe LES SŒURS UNIES. Elle se porte bien. Mariée, elle est mère de 05 enfants. Le plus âgé a 16ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Les  05 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend du combustible  depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les provinces environnantes. Ses clients sont  les femmes, les hommes de son quartier.
Mme veut s’acheter 03 rangées de bois.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne agrandir son activité et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is the leader of the "Les Soeurs Unies"  group. She is doing well. She is married and the mother of 5 children. The eldest is 16 years old and the youngest, 4. All of her children attend school.

Fatoumata has been selling firewood for 3 years. She gets her supplies in the surrounding provinces. Her customers are women and men who live in her district. Fatoumata would like to buy 3 cords of wood. She wants to reinvest in her business. Her aim is to expand her business and meet her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy 3 cords of wood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction material to do some home repairs.

loans.name: Wend La Boumbou Group

texts.fr:
Mr  ISSAKA représente le groupe WEND LA BOUMBOU. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 09ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 02 vont à l’école et il a 03 personnes en charge.
Il est couturier depuis 12ans. Il s’approvisionne  au marché de secteur 10 et dans les grandes boutiques. Ses clients  sont les  hommes, femmes.
Mr veut s’acheter une machine à coudre.
IL  veut épargner ses bénéfices pour ouvrir un autre atelier. Il ambitionne agrandir son secteur d’activité  et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa  famille.
texts.en:
Issaka is the Wend La Boumbou group representative. He is married and the father of 2 children. The eldest is 9 years old and the youngest, 6. Both of his children attend school and he is also responsible for 3 other people.

Issaka has been a tailor for 12 years. He gets his supplies at the Sector 10 market and in the big stores. His customers are men and women. He would like to buy a sewing machine. He wants to build his savings so that he can open another workshop. He aims to increase the reach of his business and to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Angelique's Group

texts.fr:
Le banc villageois a été mise en place ce 05 Février 2014 lors de son inauguration. Il est composé de 45 femmes qui voulu intégrer le programme de bancs villageois afin de bénéficier d’un appui financier pour développer leurs activités. Elles vivent toutes dans le même village depuis plusieurs années et entretiennent des relations de solidarité et d’entre aide mutuel. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce et la culture saisonnière sous pluie.

Madame Angélique, âgée de 43 ans (assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est mariée et mère de six enfants dont  trois garçons et trois filles. Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et divers produits de la cueillette auprès de producteurs dans les villages, elle est productrice de patate douce et de manioc qu’elle revend par sac à des commerçants venus d’horizon divers. 

Avec son  nouveau prêt, elle va acheter  une cinquante de bassine de pin de singe à 2 000 FCFA pour la revente par sac contenant deux bassines à 6 500 FCFA.  

 Les bénéfices me permettent de renforcer son épargner pour obtenir durant les prochains cycles de prêts plus importants.
texts.en:
This "banc villageois" was created on the 5th of February, 2014. It is made up of 45 women who wanted to join the "banc villageois" program in order to be able to benefit from financial help so that they could develop their businesses. They have all been living in the same village for several years and enjoy supportive and mutually helpful relationships. Their main business is small retail and growing seasonal produce during the rainy season.

43-year-old Angélique (who is sitting second from the left and raising her hand in the picture) is the group's featured borrower. She is married and the mother of 6 children, 3 boys and 3 girls. She sells fruits and various wild plant foods that she gathers to the producers in the villages and she also grows sweet potatoes and cassava which she sells by the bag to retailers from different places. She will use her new loan to buy 50 baskets of baobab fruit (at 2 000 francs/basket) which she will resell by the bag (containing 2 baskets worth) for 6 500 francs. The profits will enable her to build her savings so that she can benefit from bigger loans during the next loan cycles.

loans.use: to buy baobab fruit for resale.

loans.name: Kadidiatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé en décembre 2010.Il est composé de membres qui sont issus du même quartier,elles ont comme activité le commerce.

Noudje qui est à droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la responsable du groupe,elle est âgée de 37 ans,elle est mariée et mére de 02 enfants.

Son activité est le commerce de tissus"wax",de chaussures et de vêtements.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter du tissu pour une valeur de 150000f,des chaussures pour une valeur de 100000f,des vêtements pour une valeur de 100000f.

Son objectif est d'augmenter son épargne et de constituer un fonds de roulement pour l'ouverture d'un magasin.
texts.en: This group was created in December of 2010. Its members all come from the same area and are retailers. Noudje, on the right of the picture and raising her arm, is the group leader. She is 37 years old, married and the mother of 2 children. She sells "wax" fabric, shoes and clothing. She plans to use her loan to buy 150 000 francs worth of fabric, 100 000 francs worth of shoes and 100 000 francs worth of clothing. Her goal is to build her savings and enough working capital with which to open a shop.

loans.use: to buy "wax" fabric, shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Séjour Olivier

texts.fr: Séjour est un homme de 42 ans marié père de 4 enfants dont l'age varie entre 1 et 10 ans. Il a ouvert un restaurant qu'il gère lui même depuis 12 ans. c'est grâce à lui qu'il s'occupe de sa famille. Le fait d'acheter les produit de restauration en détail ne rapporte vraiment grand chose pour lui. D'où l'importance de ce crédit pour son activité parce que ça lui permettra d'augmenter le stock de ses denrées alimentaires (alvéole d’œufs, lait, sacs de d'arachide, 1 sac de riz et le petit nécessaire pour cuisiner ses plats. Cela lui évitera les déplacements quotidiens et diminuera ses frais de taxi, ça augmentera aussi ses bénéfices. Il réinvestira une partie de ce profit pour agrandir son restaurant, l'autre l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Séjour is a 42-year-old man who is married and the father of 4 children aged between 1 and 10. He has been running a restaurant for 12 years. It is thanks to his business that he is able to take care of his family. He is not able to make a large profit because he has to buy his ingredients retail. This is why this loan is important to him, as it will enable him to increase his inventory of food (trays of eggs, milk, bags of groundnuts, one bag of rice and other ingredients he needs to make his meals). Buying in bulk will help him to avoid having to travel every day and will decrease his taxi expenses, as well as increasing his profits. He will reinvest part of his profit in his business so that he can expand his restaurant and part of his profit will enable him to meet his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his inventory of food.

loans.name: Gertrudis Ramona

texts.es:
Gertrudis de 57 años de edad, madre soltera con  hijos mayores de edad e independiente. Es originaria de Leon, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  En la actualidad ella lucha día a día para  mantener  su negocio en mejores condiciones, y mejorar su calidad de vida a través de sus ingresos, ya que ha sido la forma que ha utilizado para poder ayudar a sus hijos y los formo en hombre de bien para la sociedad.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica un pulperia, es una pequena tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequenas como: arroz, frijoles, azucar, leche, pan, detergente, aceite, jabon,jugos, huevos, crema, galletas, fosforos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del credito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.Gertudis agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y paises pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Gertrudis is 57 years old and a single mother to children who are now independent adults. Gertrudis is originally from León in the west of Nicaragua. She is hard-working, responsible and has a desire to do better. Gertrudis fights every day in order to keep her business going and to improve her quality of life with her income. This business has been Gertrudis' way of helping her children and making them good people in society.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Gertrudis has a grocery store, a small shop selling small quantities of consumable goods, such as rice, sugar, beans, milk, bread, detergent, oil, soap, juices, eggs, cream, biscuits and matches. Gertrudis works 12 hours a day selling her goods. This loan will be used to invest in working capital and to stock up her business with consumable goods. With this loan, in the not-too-distant future Gertrudis can earn a higher income. Gertrudis is grateful to Kiva investors for their help to poor countries like Nicaragua and for help poor people to have the opportunity to have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy consumable goods such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, detergent, oil, soap, juices, eggs, cream, biscuits and matches.

loans.name: Maqsod

texts.en: Maqsod is a 55-year-old married woman doing business selling animals for the past 10 years. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices.  She has five goats, one cow and one buffalo. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. She is a mother of six children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet life's day to day expenses.  It’s her sixth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business. Now, she requested a loan of RES 40,000 to purchase two more baby goats. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase two more baby goats.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Maria Alicia, soltera, originaria de unos de los municipios de Chinandega, donde predomina el turismo y el comercio. Ella es una microempresaria la cual se dedica a la venta de productos como: gaseosas, golosinas, cigarrillos, frutas, entre otros así como también bollitos de coco, de maní, atol, arroz de leche, y los comercializa de manera ambulante; Alicia es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora que lucha por salir adelante y  desde muy temprano sale de su casa para ofrecer sus productos. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertirlo en materia prima como: vainilla, azúcar, maní, arroz, canela, entre otros productos, para de esa manera poder satisfacer con las demandas de los clientes.
texts.en: María Alicia is single and originally from one of the municipalities in Chinandega, an area where tourism and businesses are very important. Alicia has a small business where she sells goods such as fizzy drinks, sweets, cigarettes, fruits and more. She also sells small desserts such as coconut balls, peanuts, a cornflour drink and rice pudding. She sells these goods as a street vendor. Alicia is an enterprising and hard-working woman who fights every day to get ahead. Early in the morning she heads out in order to sell her goods. This loan will be used to buy basic supplies such as milk, coconut, vanilla, peanuts, rice and more. With these supplies she will then be able to satisfy customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy basic supplies such as milk, coconut, vanilla, peanuts, rice and more.

loans.name: Leon

texts.es:
Leon vive en compañia de uno de sus hijos en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como Policia,  nos solicito el crédito para poder realizar un pequeño arreglo a un departamento que tienen en la zona de achachicala y de esta manera tener mayor comodidad de vida.

El sueño de Leon es dar los mejores estudios a sus hijos y que salgan profesionales
texts.en:
León lives with one of his children in the city of La Paz.  He's a police officer.

He requested a loan to be able to make a small repair on their apartment in the Achachicala area so they'll have a more comfortable life.

León's dream is for his children to get the best possible education and become professionals.

loans.use: to make repairs on his home

loans.name: Nargiz

texts.en:
Nargiz is from the Shaghap village where she lives with her husband and 24-year-old son. Nargiz and her family have been involved in agriculture for 13 years. During those years, they were able to work hard and build a sustainable farm. The farm currently includes cows, sheeps, pigs and a calf as well as a plot of agricultural land where wheat, barley, tomatoes and grass are cultivated.

Nargiz's husband and their son sell the gathered harvest in local markets and gather income for everyday life. The fact that the income is hardly enough for covering basic needs, Nargiz would like to improve.  She has applied for this loan to purchase three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock. This purchase will greatly help her family to increase their agricultural income and Nargiz will be very grateful to lenders for their help.

loans.use: to pay for three oxen and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a male aged 38. He is married with four children and one dependent.  He lives on the outskirts of the town of Kyotera with his family.

He deals in the banana trading business in the town of Kyotera where he works for five days a week and six hours a day. He is also a farmer from which he earns an additional income.

He is acquiring the loan with the hope of boosting his matooke (banana) business.  He usually sells his bananas to traders around Kyotera and to the local people. In the future, Tadeo wishes to construct rentals and also expand his business.

However, he faces high transport costs which affects his operations.  He is described as a honest and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy bananas to trade

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is a 35-year-old woman.  She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her five children. Her husband has been working in the public sector organization for many years.  He is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family.  Nargis provides sewing services and earns income to contribute with her husband's to manage the household.
 
She needs different kinds of goods, e.g. needles, threads, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for her business, but due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these accessories and will also be helpful to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Nargis is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy pieces of clothes, ribbons, needles, threads, etc.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a very hardworking woman. Her husband owns a restaurant in the main market where he sells a variety of tasty dishes like rice, mix vegetables, etc. 

Currently, he is in need of purchasing a variety of food items to cook food to sell. For that his wife Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase rice and a variety of vegetables for her husband's restaurant. Yasmeen hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband and it will bring a positive change in their lives. 

With the profit amount, Yasmeen wants to provide education to her children. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase variety of food items to cook delicious dishes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional lappa, (fabric) nickel and watches for her business.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a 45-year-old vigorous lady. She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her sixth loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors with packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en: Shabana is a 35-year-old vigorous lady.  She has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons to create a means of increasing revenue so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors along with packs of laces, zippers and buttons

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en:
Susanna is 57 years old and she lives in Ijevan city in the Tavush region. Susanna has two sons and a daughter. Her sons work and live in Russian Federation, and her daughter lives with her (she works at the bakery as a baker). 

Susanna is a widow; her husband took part in the war between Armenia and Azerbaijan (conflict of Nagorno Karabakh) and got wounded. After several years, he died since he did not manage to recover. Now Susanna’s sons financially provide for their mother and sister from abroad. 

Despite Susanna's works as a baker (her daughter is also employed), they do not have enough money to repair their house; it has not been repaired for 20 years, and living conditions in it are far from being comfortable.

Susanna asks a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams to repair her house and improve her and her daughter’s living conditions.

loans.use: to repair her house and improve her and her daughter’s living conditions

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 36-year-old lady, living with her spouse and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

She wants to make some savings so that she can provide better living facilities to her children, but it seems impossible in the absence of a profitable source of income.

Her husband has been driving a moto rickshaw for several years, but his income is insufficient to feed his entire family. He has to maintain the rickshaw’s body, but he does not have a sufficient amount to fix the problem. 

Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband would be able to buy the moto rickshaw’s body. She hopes that she will be able to make enough saving in time to marry her children.

loans.use: To buy a new moto rickshaw's body.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
At the age of 56, Naseem is an energetic married woman. She has been running a business making and selling decorations for many years with the support of her husband (also shown in the photo). She always has a great collection of decorations to offer to her customers, and earns a good amount of income to bear their household expenditures. 

At present she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase good quality mud, plaster of paris, artificial flowers and paints in large quantities from the market at lower rates.

In this way she will be able to increase her sales, which ultimately helps her generate more income. 

She desires to expand her business and wishes to spend part of the profits to provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase good quality mud, plaster of paris, artificial flowers and paints in large quantities.
